search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior performance analyst - digital marketing & insights (mar04315-17)job description senior performance analyst - digital marketing & insights - mar04315-17description position overview:   as the senior performance analyst on the digital marketing & insights team, you will play a key role in driving insights to maximize investment opportunities and strategy for telus digital marketing activities.   candidates for the role will be curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and are excited about the opportunity data provides in creating best in class digital marketing programs for telus. you will work with both internal and external partners to find insights in order to optimize our digital marketing spend.   candidates will lead the strategy to evolve telus’s digital marketing measurement and attribution to a best in class model.   our team is known within telus as a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that is an agent of change and a great place to learn and grow. we have a culture of collaboration, recognition, and high-performance. simply put, if you're bright, ambitious and looking for a challenge, this is the place to be.   responsibilities:  lead analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis work with agency and partner teams to define kpi’s and develop tracking/tagging strategies to allow for the kpi’s success to be measured manage regular reporting, scorecards, and dashboards (weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc requests) leverage data to tell the story of how digital marketing is achieving outcomes design, build and maintain financial models to connect initiatives/activity with kpi’s & outcomes for the channel or campaign champion, coach and mentor team members on best practices in program analytics proactively identify opportunities to constantly improve our digital campaign measurement evolve telus digital measurement from “last click” to a weighted multi-touch attribution model qualifications required knowledge:  passionate about how data can be used to solve business problems strong presentation skills with the ability to tell stories with data, and ability to influence and persuade executive stakeholders and working team members a flexible approach and the ability to accept and champion change highly organized with a demonstrated ability to monitor and manage high volume workloads creative and innovative thinker a bias for action  required skills & abilities:  advanced microsoft office package (especially ms excel) adobe analytics (report builder, segments, adhocs) google analytics facebook report builder doubleclick campaign manager sql experience with adobe audience manager is a plus  required professional designation/certification:  post-secondary degree in marketing or business mba (or equivalent experience) would be an asset  required experience:  5+ years digital analytics experience preferable to have digital experience in a telco along with analytics tools: domo, tableau, qualtrics, sql, adobe, google analytics, adwords  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

title: 
                        
business analyst with capital markets - market risk and credit risk
                        









 

requisition id: 7437
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose:
the business analyst ii is responsible for assisting the manager in the research and analysis of business processes and defining requirements that lead to the implementation of solution and systems for global risk management and regulatory/compliance to meet their business needs.  the candidate is also responsible for assisting with the testing of new systems or enhancements, and the provision of ongoing support to all global units for the business areas.
 
key accountabilities:
1.             assist the manager/senior business analysts by conducting research and analysis, and accurately and clearly defining user requirements and processes required to resolve business problems and to meet the business needs.  this may involve participation in rapid prototyping, preparing requirements and project documentations.
 
2.             participate in the systems implementation process by assisting in the development of test cases and the conducting of testing, assisting in the definition of user procedures and workflows, assisting in the development of conversion and implementation strategies, and assisting in the provision of user documentation, user training, and post-implementation support.
 
3.             providing end user support to business users, assisting with the resolution of system issues and the design and implementation of systems enhancements.
 
functional competencies:
 
1. creative, reliable self-starter, results oriented, highly motivated individual with excellent analytical skills, attention to detail and ability to apply knowledge to independently resolve complex business problems.
 
2  good interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills, and exercise diplomacy and judgement to effectively work with business users and project team members, technology teams and management. 
 
3.  understanding of current it practices, agile systems development techniques, including requirements specification; testing methodologies; real time analytical and formal modeling tools, keeps current with rapidly changing technology. 
 
4. adaptable, able to operate in dynamic environment.
 
5. knowledge/understanding of capital markets and financial instruments including market conventions; understanding of market and credit risk management methodologies and valuation methods an asset
 
6. experience with linux, relational databases, sql queries, python and other analytics tools an asset.
 
educational requirements:
a recognized degree in business, computer science, mathematics or related discipline is required, along with 2-5 years practical experience.
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.









job segment: 
credit, risk management, business analyst, credit analyst, banking, finance

job description - strategy & planning consultant (c04m2p)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - strategy & planning consultant (c04m2p)  strategy & planning consultant - c04m2p who
we are

canadian tire has been canada's most-shopped
general merchandise retailer for 94 years and has been providing canadians with
everything they need for the jobs and joys of life in canada. with nearly 500
retail locations across canada, we sell more products, in more places, than any
other canadian retailer and continue to innovate with great new brands,
in-store and online technologies, and exciting merchandise strategies to
delight consumers and reach more canadians. we truly are canada’s store.
 
we are providing canadians with unprecedented innovation, value and excitement
through great new brands such as woods, and canvas, which offer high-quality
products and modern style and design elements, and best-in-class canadian tire
marketing campaigns. the company’s vast list of private-label and exclusively
licensed brands also includes names such as motomaster, mastercraft, noma,
woods, denver hayes, windriver, diadora. these brands have earned a level of
credibility that is on par with national brands, and are sought after by
consumers from across the country.

what you’ll do

reporting to the manager, planning & performance, the strategy 
and planning consultant plays a pivotal role in the design and
execution of the consumer brands division’s (cbd) overall strategic and
business planning processes.  the team provides support, development, 
and
delivery for multi-year brand planning, brand portfolio evaluation, and 
product
development and financial management systems, to build a sustainable 
foundation
for long-term success.  as a part of this exciting team you will also be
responsible for research, brand and business analytics, business 
reporting,
process development and re-engineering, and overall generation of 
strategic
content and plans.    

•    work with the cbd leadership team building multi-year brand
roadmaps 
•    work with various stakeholders to further develop, manage
and refine the owned brand portfolio growth strategy/roadmap for ctr
•    support product development process build
•    report on product development process gates and milestones
to ensure achievement
•    support build and execution of historical and future
looking financial management processes
•    build operational tools to support performance management
needs
•    support (as needed) identified ctc banners and their associated
owned brand growth strategy
•    note: consultant roles within the team will varying levels
of responsibility depending on identified fit between candidates and work
streams 

what you’ll need

you are detail oriented and process minded, but comfortable crafting
strategy and operating in an ambiguous environment. you have strong business,
financial, and analytical acumen with a demonstrated ability to operate
effectively in complex organizations. other qualifications include:

•    2+ years of experience of retail experience in a
consulting, planning or process role
•    strong financial acumen with exceptional analytical skills
•    highly organized and detail oriented, able to tackle
multiple projects with varying scope
•    highly effective relationship management skills with a
track record of facilitating conversations with cross-functional teams and
leading change 
•    demonstrated ability to collaborate, influence and
negotiate with colleagues at various levels of the organization
•    strong written and oral presentation skills with
demonstrated ability to adjust style and format as required to suit the
audience
•    expert proficiency of ms excel, ms powerpoint; ms visio
knowledge an asset
•    university degree and or post-secondary education  canadian tire corporationontario-torontopermanentfull-timejob posting: aug 24, 2017, 2:02:23 pm

position summary
 deloitte leads with purpose, solving complex issues for our clients and communities. across disciplines and across borders, deloitte global supports our network of member firms by developing and driving global strategy, programs, and platforms, and creating new solutions and transformational experiences. our people share a passion for igniting change and a strong service orientation that shapes our organization and those it supports. the global technology services-business services group is seeking a data scientist.  as an integral member of global technology services organization, the data scientist (sr. engineer) will be responsible for developing and managing global products for deloitte’s global analytics studio.  additionally, the data scientist:provides technical direction for project delivery to address business needs. acts as predictive analytics subject matter expert to a broader delivery team of architects, business systems analysts, technical leads and engineers on technical direction and solutioning of applications to address business needs.ensures necessary adoption, refinement and oversight of the delivery team’s use of the agile methodology, including acting as the scrum master through project effortscoordinates with stakeholders, project management, infrastructure, security and performance management teams to ensure successful delivery of projectsensures project/program objectives are met in a timely manner and adhere to the application standards. manages quality and risk throughout the execution.contributes to direction, product and project planning and sdlc practices for predictive analytics-oriented projects. possesses in-depth knowledge and enforces standards, procedures, and methodologies. supports the maturing of systems engineering, quality assurance and analysis policies, procedures, standards for predictive analytics projects in line with gts standardsmaintaining awareness and authoritative understanding of our key technology vendor offerings, strategies, roadmaps and capabilities to both influence our maturing standards and ensure team access to the appropriate vendors for training, seminars and workshopsmaintain relationships within other gts studios and member firmsthe key job responsibilities include the following:acts as a key contributor to predictive analytics-oriented software engineering projectsprovides technical leadership for predictive analytics technologies to the broader delivery teamacts as a trusted advisor to stakeholders by providing objective, practical and relevant ideas, insights, and advice by developing an in-depth understanding of the business applications including technical trends/marketplace, technology development sound strategic and tactical understanding of technology product mix comprising the solution, including vendor product roadmaps, and product strengths, weaknesses, and limitationsfosters an environment with consistent focus on business objectivesthe key skills required are as follows:working experience with statistical analysis and modelling is a mustworking experience with predictive modeling and simulation techniquesability to query and mine large data sets to discover transaction patterns, examine data and isolate targeted information - using traditional as well as predictive/advanced analytic methodologiesworking experience with machine learning algorithms and platforms such as azureml or mllib or mahout, etc.knowledge of at least 2 of the following: sas, spss, matlab, r, python.working experience with hadoop, hbase, hive or mapreduce or spark.experience in database design, development with advanced proficiency in sql.experience with data cleansing techniques and toolsexperience with unstructured text analytics is a plusexperience with nosql technologies, such as mongodb is a plusan ability to understand business strategy, business requirements and to envision how predictive analytics technologies enable organizational strategiesstrong skills in presenting and facilitatingstrong skills in influencing, diplomacy, negotiation and consensus buildinggood attention to detail and accuracyexperience with the rational suite life at deloitte

data science careers at deloitte

                                        
                                            our data scientists discuss their passion and careers

 this video series shows the many faces of data science at deloitte, from data modelers to analytics enthusiasts, and why they chose a career with us. 

the faces of data science at deloittewhat are data scientists like? they’re as unique and varied as the stories they tell with data. the truth is, there’s no single type of data scientist. our data science professionals have an array of interests and passions that attracted them to the field, and they are empowered to create their own paths forward.here are some of the data scientists that call deloitte home:the data science thrill-seekermany children dream of riding the roller coasters at disneyworld—but not many dream of taking the plunge into the world of data science as a career. one consultant began to think of a career in data science after a talk on analytics by disney's head of operations research. learning about the inner workings of disneyworld sparked an interest and led to a career in data science at deloitte.the data science numbers loverto some of us, numbers are numbers. but to one deloitte manager, it was that first college statistics class that hooked her on everything data. the idea that data can make meaning of the world was something so intriguing that it became a quest, a passion, and ultimately a career.the data science super modelersometimes, data scientists enter the field because they've already dabbled in data in a related discipline. that's the case for one of our data science consultants who studied computer science, then entered the workforce supporting analytics implementations. a fascination with building data models led to an interest in predictive modeling and data mining.helping people was a source of inspiration for one analyst. the ability to build models that could turn volumes of data into insights, approaches, and solutions that could help many people was too powerful to ignore.
read more 







perspectives

end users and data everywhere

                                        
                                            part 1: cloud and infrastructure article series

 legacy data centers are falling farther and farther behind as the adoption of cloud computing contributes to better mobile end-user experiences. 

widespread adoption of cloud computing and the evolution of the end-user experience are dramatically changing the corporate office. end users are on the move on different devices—and so is end-user data. as customer and enterprise data moves across both internal and external telephony and wireless networks, cios are facing growing challenges around control and management of enterprise it and data flow to and from the data center (which may now be external).
read more 







perspectives

natural language generation and data science

                                        
                                            interview with kris hammond, chief scientist, narrative science

 what is natural language generation, what should clients be doing about nlg, and what is its future? get answers from kris hammond, deloitte’s chief scientist. 

surrounded by a wealth of data that’s growing all the time, we look to machines to make sense of it. natural language generation is part of a larger ecosystem in artificial intelligence, cognitive computing, and analytics that helps us turn data into facts and draw important conclusions from those facts. this is how we can make data highly useful and highly relevant in a contextual way. learn how natural language generation takes facts that machines can understand and turns them into a language that humans can process and act upon.​
read more 







perspectives

mobile device security risks: keeping data safe

                                        
                                            corporate cybersecurity in a mobile world

 security of data for mobile devices is a key concern for corporations and individuals. what potential mobile device security risks could you be facing? 

risks and opportunities​who are you? the computer wants to know. convincing the machine you are who you claim to be is at the heart of network security. for the vast majority of us—those committed to safeguarding bank accounts, personal data, corporate patents, and inside information—security of data hinges on establishing our identity in a way that no one, man or machine, can replicate.you might think that mobile device security risks are rising. after all, global workers are venturing far outside old corporate firewalls. from the ballpark to the beach, they’re using their own smartphones and tablets to copy and forward proprietary documents and spreadsheets. and much of this data is stored on cloud computers belonging to other companies. add it all up, and it may appear as though corporations have utterly lost control of their secrets.security companies stress these risks and the need for security in their marketing. “but we’re not simply at the mercy of the attackers,” says  michael wyatt , managing director, deloitte   touche llp, and identity management solution leader in deloitte advisory’s cyber risk services. in the end, wyatt says, smartphones in the hands of mobile workers may prove to be more secure than the old cubicle pc equipped and vetted by the tech department. “the developments that people associate with increased mobile device security risks also create opportunities for new solutions.”

date posted: 
sep 29, 2017
                                

 reference code: 27841-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionas part of our corporate financial planning and analytics (fp&a) team, this role acts as a finance business partner and provides proactive financial analysis and business advisory support to our business services as well as to business leaders within enabling area nationally. this position will support and report to the senior manager, and will be located at our head office in downtown toronto. the ideal candidate for this role will be a highly independent and motivated individual, who is able to work and communicate effectively across functions with strong analytical experience, customer service attitude and strong financial/accounting knowledge.
key responsibilities and areas of involvement include, but not limited to: 
- support fp&a team and enabling area fabs in any capacity required to deliver financial advisory and business support including the following:

proactively support the enabling area fabs in period-end reporting and analysis, year-end close, financial planning and forecasting, ad-hoc reporting and analysis as required
provide ongoing business insights versus plan or forecast including presentations to the leadership team on periodic financial results
provide analysis of period variances to provide insight and help drive next steps
prepare operational cost analysis encompassing variance analysis of non-client expenses
provide a future focused outlook to help to identify pending issues and identify opportunities for improvement in the delivery of this project
research, analyze and respond to ad hoc requests for financial information from within the firm
support period-end reporting activities and analysis including appropriate accruals and journal entries where required

- participate in the annual plan and quarterly forecasting process, ad-hoc reporting and analysis as required
- ongoing assessment of the operational strategy, targets, processes and policies in support of the business units’ objectives by supporting better management reporting, information flow and management and business processes

proactively look to improve operations, processes and policies to improve alignment with business plan

- participate in firm wide finance initiatives, fostering integration and collaboration across regions and services
- build relationships with finance peers supporting other services and reporting experts to share best practices and insights
external posting qualifications- education and experience

bachelor’s degree and/or a professional certification in: finance & accounting or related education
2-4 years or related years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience

- technical foundation

working knowledge of finance and accounting (debits/credits, accruals, income statements vs balance sheets vs cash flow statements etc.)
advanced excel skills: pivot tables, lookup formulas, conditionals
knowledge of ms excel, word, powerpoint, visio, financial reporting/project tracking and or database experience a plus
knowledge of sap preferred

 
·        key qualities and abilities:

ability to thrive in an environment of change
ability to adapt quickly and learn new tasks independently
accountable, responsible and responsive
excellent organization skills, able to manage competing priorities
strong attention to detail, analytical and problem solving skills
communicate effectively & tactfully with personnel on all levels
collect relevant facts quickly and provide recommendations
ability to make decisions, generate bold, creative ideas to improve processes
team oriented and works well independently
french, spanish language skills would be an asset (verbal and written)

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Analyst/Senior Analyst, Product and Perception of Coverage M...
text:
job description - analyst/senior analyst, product and perception of coverage marketing (17011755)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - analyst/senior analyst, product and perception of coverage marketing (17011755)job description analyst/senior analyst, product and perception of coverage marketing-17011755description american express canada is a company with a long history and a bright future. a canadian employer since 1853, amex has created a culture that nurtures extraordinary talent and turns careers into unparalleled experiences. a company where every employee is given the opportunity to learn, grow and excel, amex is always on the lookout for driven, forward-thinking and creative people ready to take their career to the next level. so, if you share our passion for excellence, our dedication to great service and our excitement about innovation, there’s a world of opportunity waiting for you in a career with american express canada.
 
global merchant services marketing is dedicated to bringing buyers and sellers together and transforming how american express is welcomed. gms marketing is responsible for partnering with gms markets to drive profitable growth, accelerate coverage and enhance the value of amex acceptance to merchants and card members at scale. we focus on enhancing our relationships with millions of merchants of all shapes and sizes, and our geographic purview includes many commerce hubs across the globe including the u.s, canada, latin america, the caribbean, europe and the asia-pacific region. 
it is also critical for gms marketing to collaborate effectively with card issuing teams and other sister organizations across the blue box in order to fully harness the power of the closed loop via mediums including custom consulting, offers, recommendations, multi-merchant campaigns, digital experiences and brand awareness. gms marketing partners with organizations including client management, marketing operations, information management, enterprise digital, web experience, global advertising and brand management and global servicing network.
the role 
with the launch and expansion of the optblue program, our merchant coverage has started to expand nationwide, and it is a critical blue box priority to ensure card members and card member prospects are aware that you can use your american express card in more places than ever.
the successful candidate will be responsible for the development, execution, and ongoing management of perception of coverage related products and programs that drive incremental value to american express merchants. 
the successful candidate will bring a strong customer first mindset along with a proven ability to collaborate and drive results among a diverse stakeholder group (amex issuing partners, international gms partners, central product teams, and external agencies).  
key responsibilities 
product & campaign management: 
•      ownership of overall experience and merchant eligibility of amex map assets to increase web traffic and engagement on the map 
•      ownership of coverage claim assets and management/creation of data driven insights
•      develop and execute marketing campaigns to drive merchant and cm activations through cm recommendations capabilities. 
•      ownership of overall experience of the point of purchase (pop) program including customer journey optimization, product development, and inventory management. 
 
relationship management: 
•      build partnerships with gms central teams, both international and u.s. markets to leverage best practices and project manage market capability launches 
•      build partnerships with issuers to drive channel optimization & adoption of poc assets. 
•      partner with client management teams to create custom pop programs with prioritized merchants. 
•      liaise/collaborate with external agencies/ vendors to brief and oversee marketing campaigns and inventory management. 
 
strategy & data analytics: 
•      understand & analyze big data to create insights that drive and inform coverage marketing strategies and campaigns 
•      develop regular reports measuring and analyzing the performance of key business metrics, and recommend and implement strategic actions and solutions
•      understand customer and competitive trends by completing periodic competitive and qualitative assessments and providing commentary on findings
 
offer of employment with american express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.qualifications 

university degree or equivalent combination of education and business experience.

2-3 years marketing experience in financial services or similar industry.  
§  strong analytical skills and proven ability to conduct analysis to support business initiatives and sound recommendations
 
§  strong customer focus and ability to analyze customer experience processes and insights to inform strategies
 
§  high energy, proactive and able to work well under pressure with competing priorities
 
§  proven collaborator with excellent communication skills with the ability to influence a range of stakeholders. 
 
§  excellent project management skills to manage multiple ongoing projects across various teams
 
§  attention to detail and process-oriented is essential

it’s an exciting time to join american express canada, where we dedicate extensive time, resources and effort to satisfying and surprising our customers. we make that same commitment to our employees, as well, striving to create an environment where people are respected, both personally and professionally. be part of it. american express canada is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, members of visible minority groups and women.  if you have a disability accommodations can be made. 
 
 job marketingprimary location canada-ontario-torontoschedule full-timejob posting sep 21, 2017, 9:05:45 am - oct 5, 2017, 10:59:00 pm   american express is an equal opportunity employer. contact us at global.recruiting@aexp.comadchoicesprivacy statementterms of serviceamerican express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law.us candidates/employees: click here to view the "eeo is the law" poster and supplement and the pay transparency policy statement.all users of our online services subject to privacy statement and agree to be bound by terms of service. please review.© 2015 american express company. all rights reserved.

description

position at ddb canada


data analyst the analyst, marketing analytics will pair their considerable digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. in this role, you will be driven to find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. he/she must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy. he/she will be a strong and confident communicator, who is adaptable to many different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets.you will:guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of developmentlead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data miningensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and trainingdrive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing advanced analytics models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark datainterpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needsuse advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environmentfacilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offerscreation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualizationyou must have:curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environmentundergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline3+ years analytical experience: strong problem solving skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation/discussionstrong understanding of database design, database management, data warehousing, data mining, feature enrichment, feature engineering, variable creation, variable selectionknowledge of etl processesat least 1 year working experience on sql server and intermediate level of sql skills including sql server intergration services (ssis)knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communicationsexperience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformationkeen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadershipa strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-orientedexperience designing, executing and analyzing experiments using multi-variate testing methodologies (full-factorial and fractional-factorialexperience with developing segmentations, clustering, clv scoringintermediate level capabilities with adobe solutions, primarily adobe campaign including building technical workflows to import and extract dataproficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)demonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projectsbonus points for:experience with tableauexperience with google analyticsexperience designing, supporting, executing and interpreting research projects and experimentsexperience with digital qualitative research platformsexperience with tag management platforms (dtm, gtm, tealium iq, ensighten manage)experience with ad tech integrations for adobe analytics, domo, anametrics or google analytics premiumwe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we are also an inclusive employer and offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. if you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior manager, strategic analytics (1700016398)job description senior manager, strategic analytics-1700016398description the senior manager, strategic analytics (credit risk) role is an ideal opportunity to be part of a growing and dynamic team in a collaborative environment that supports personal segment of the bank. personal segment (part of p&c canada) is an important segment of the bank with 25% of the bank’s assets. the incumbent will have high visibility to senior management and will be a recognized contributor who impacts the client experience and the bank’s results. 
 
the senior manager, strategic analytics works with business, technology & operations, enterprise risk teams and data base partners to lead the design, development, and implementation of analytics solutions that drive measurable business outcomes and create a distinctive customer experience.  the senior manager, strategic analytics plays a key role in influencing the data architecture and data repository build for future analytical needs, providing thought leadership and insights from new data for strategies and  conducting research and analysis, generating ideas, structuring data and building predictive models and solutions.
 
this is an exciting opportunity that is on the forefront of a critical enterprise capability, providing thought leadership to the enterprise on the value of data and analytics.  the incumbent will get to work with and support multiple lines of business to help them achieve their objectives.
 
this role could also be quite attractive for a past data scientist who has performed big data analytics on large volumes and wide varieties of data.  the role would permit the incumbent to be engaged on both the business and technology side and will use analytics to provide additional insight to our environment and provide intelligence that will act as a catalyst of change.
 

leveraging data to drive insights and recommendation on variables that can be used to improve credit decisions 

selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using advanced modeling techniques 
data mining using state-of-the-art methods 
doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
 

building prediction models to help improve credit decisioning with objective to provide better customer experience 

creating regression based models to help improve credit decisioning 
leveraging machine learning and/or other advanced analytical techniques to improve current prediction models 
building high quality analytic solutions that are intuitive for senior audiences, simple to maintain, and drive real business outcomes
 

supporting the data infrastructure and data repository build for retail business including risk reporting and analytics 

represent the risk team for the build of data infrastructure for risk reporting and analytics. champion the process/ partner with relevant retail business stakeholders to guide the infrastructure build for retail 
extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed 
enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems across retail business 
processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
 

manages key relationships with partners to build a lasting foundation of trust and advice 

work with partners in business, technology & operations, enterprise risk teams and data base partners
 

contributing to building an enterprise community of data & analytics practitioners to facilitate best practice sharing and support.qualifications knowledge:

university degree in business/commerce, data sciences, engineering, finance and/or mathematics (graduate level degrees preferred) and/or 7 to 10 years of experience in analytics, finance and/or consulting. 
advanced knowledge of design and analysis methodologies to work in an agile development environment. 
experience with common data science toolkits, such as r, python, etc. . excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable. 
experience with data visualisation tools, such as spotfire, tableau etc. 
proficiency in using query languages such as sql, sas
skills:

exhibits advanced analytical, critical thinking skills, and integrative skills. 
demonstrates solid communication skills (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills at a senior management level. 
demonstrates ability to build a good fact base, apply sound reasoning, and generate relevant recommendations that get implemented and lead to business success. 
demonstrates innovative thinking and creativity. 
is able to handle multiple priorities. 
is able to work highly independently and work successfully with a team that has diverse skills, knowledge, and educational backgrounds.

we’re here to help
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.

date posted: 
sep 9, 2017
                                

 reference code: 19626-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionour analytics and information management (a+im) practice provides services that focus on one of our clients' most important assets - information. we help organizations actively manage their costs and margins by empowering clients to deploy technology and processes that enable efficient management and delivery of actionable information.

businesses today are creating and capturing more information than ever before - but that can make their challenge harder, not easier. these days, the quality of data can determine the success (or failure) of the most important business decisions. a+im can provide the solutions companies need to help address key business challenges by unlocking the value buried deep in their data. the companies that can access the information they need, when they need it - and trust its accuracy - have the upper hand where it counts.
the breadth of services that a+im provides is vast and varied and we have broken down our services into the following categories:

advanced analytics
performance management technology
business intelligence
enterprise data management
enterprise content management, social media and web channels

your role as a manager at deloitte:

embrace and live the firm’s purpose – to make an impact that matters – by pushing yourself and your team to identify solutions to challenges that are most important for our clients, people, and society
develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
deliver exceptional client service by maximizing results and driving high performance from people, while also fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships
understand key objectives for clients and deloitte, and align people to them to set appropriate priorities and direction

specifically for this role you will provide advice and implementation services regarding business intelligence, data warehousing and big data solution capabilities and functions to customer organizations. you will be required to analyze and diagnose the client's business and technical issues to develop an understanding of customer's business and project scope. you will also be involved in leading and working on project streams which involves developing strategies, as well as implementing business intelligence, data warehousing and big data tools and technologies.
external posting qualifications
at least 8 to 10 years’ experience in developing and implementing business intelligence and data warehouse solutions
at least 2 to 3 years’ experience in developing and implementing big data solutions
extensive experience with data architecture, data modeling and data warehouse designs & architectures
demonstrated experience with developing and implementing big data platforms using hadoop ecosystem (spark, hive, pig, sqoop, flume etc)
minimum of 3 years of experience in scripting languages (perl, python, java etc)
minimum of 3 years of experience in nosql solutions (hbase, cassandra, mongodb, couchdb etc.) and managing unstructured data
demonstrated experience with oracle big data solutions
demonstrated experience with design and implementation of obiee presentation and repository layers
demonstrated experience with design, implementation and extensions to oracle bi applications data model and associated tools
experience with working with business users to gather and translate requirements in necessary data structures
excellent knowledge of sql programming language and experience with creating queries in oracle, db2, or sql server
experience in integrating data from essbase or design and implementation of essbase is a major asset
experience using other business intelligence suites, such as sap business objects, cognos, or microstrategy
experience using data integration/etl tools, such as informatica or oracle data integrator (odi) with specific emphasis on odi
experience with applying agile in system implementation methodologies specific to analytics

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
 
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - associate, strategy and business management (1700015939)job description associate, strategy and business management-1700015939description the associate will have responsibility for day-to-day operational support of the trading products people strategy. the tp people strategy (ps) is a business-led strategy that maximizes the abilities of tp employees by offering equitable access to targeted development opportunities, providing managers with tools to further enable merit-based, objective decisions regarding talent and facilitates the delivery of inclusive leadership capabilities. the incumbent, reporting to the vice president, tp strategy & business management and working with various stakeholders to facilitate the implementation of tp’s people strategy, will co-ordinate project deliverables and manage data while partnering in the resolution of operational issues and consulting with business leaders on ps related issues. the associate also supports the implementation of sbm group-wide undertakings when called upon and establishes and develops strong relationships at all levels across the organization to ensure effectiveness in executing against the mandate.  
 
a.  project co-ordination & implementation
 
 


supports the manager responsible for ps project outcomes, by contributing to the execution of the project plan, and monitoring and controlling the project elements. including: 
 
o    creating baseline schedules and conducting progress analysis
 
 
o    ensuring consistent and accurate status reporting and detailed project roadmaps
 
 
o    tracking costs and processing (or facilitating processing of) invoices
 
 
o    preparing communications in the form of agendas, presentations, reports, newsletter/blog posts, and speaking notes
 
 
o    proof-reading and cross-checking accuracy of content in project deliverables
 
 
o    identifying issues, gaps and process improvements, and addressing them as authorized or escalating when necessary
 
 
o    retention of historical project and ps data, successful practices, and effective templates
 
 
 

maintenance of skills inventories library
co-ordination with cm learning and cm hr on documenting development plans and efficient scheduling of development plan implementation.
tack completed development actions for managers of in-scope employees
support inclusive leadership elements of ps including schedule co-ordination for leaders’ coaching sessions 
event/meeting/conference call management, including room bookings, preparation of materials, a/v co-ordination and on-site oversight when required (for the ps & tp-led diversity & inclusion activities) 
establishes effective relationships, enabling and supporting collective objectives and business performance 
works with the sbm team on strategic, planning, financial, and operational issues and provides issue resolution (as authorized) in a professional, ethical, and conscientious manner 

b.  data management
 


collects accurate tp employee data necessary to deliver on ps responsibilities 
maintains up to date in-scope employee lists to ensure appropriate communications and project deliverables are properly shared (i.e.: in phases) across different geographies, lines of business and levels 
assigns appropriate permissions and manages content on sbm sharepoint sites

interacts with tp businesses, cm office of the coo, and bmo corporate groups to compile and maintain information and resources for audit requests 

responds to requests for dataqualifications  
knowledge:


  an undergraduate degree or equivalent relevant experience

3+ years in the financial services industry in capital markets

project management, data analytics, and communications
 
 
skills:
 


 advanced propensity for:
                  a. attention to detail/accuracy
                  b. resiliency & adaptability
                  c. critical thinking: anticipatory, solution-oriented & problem solver
                  d. dependability: self-starter, accountable & takes ownership
                  e. sense of urgency


advanced ability in computer applications and database management tools including, but not limited to, ms excel, ms word, ms powerpoint, ms project and sharepoint advanced written and verbal skills for the creation of project documents, presentations and various communications

advanced interpersonal skills necessary within a high pressure team environment with ability to build, maintain, and leverage inter-departmental relationships

advanced prioritization, time management and organizational skills for planning own tasks and maintaining project schedules 

intermediate level knowledge of practices that foster diversity and inclusion in the workplace

intermediate understanding of the treatment of sensitive information

intermediate ability to review, assess, and provide detailed information daily

 intermediate ability to adjust content to audience by articulating the most important points clearly and quickly and listening effectively

 intermediate ability in data analysis  
 
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. 
bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

date posted: 
sep 20, 2017
                                

 reference code: 26283-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionorganizations today depend and thrive on timely, accurate and strategically relevant information. but as technology enables the creation and capture of ever-increasing amounts of data, effective management and productive analysis of that information are becoming enormous challenges. our information management and analytics technology team provides cost-efficient, risk-effective solutions to help clients leverage and unlock the value of their information assets.
 
organizations that can access on-demand information, trust its accuracy and turn it into strategic insight can achieve superior outcomes and gain a real competitive advantage.
 
a career in analytics information management consulting will offer you the opportunity to:
 

work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective technical field
develop solutions through debate and discussion, in our teams and with clients
continue your professional development to reinforce and expand your chosen career path
work with high profile canadian and foreign clients on a variety of canadian and international transaction and advisory engagements

  
our toronto practice is growing and we are seeking a talented practioner to join our team. as a senior manager, analytics and information management, you will leverage your educational background and skills as you develop an understanding of our clients' business and develop positive client relationships while working in a consensus-oriented environment. you'll identify issues, define symptoms or problems, and recommend solutions to clients. assisting in proposal development, participating in client presentations or services development as well as contributing to effort estimating, work planning and status reporting will be an integral part of your role.
 
you are expected to contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways, including:
 

taking a lead role in delivering and managing consulting services to high growth organizations with a diverse team of consultants;
determine the client needs by selecting and applying appropriate approaches, tools, and techniques best suited to the client's business;
working closely with clients to understand engagement change implications and facilitate implementation;
implementing end-to-end analytics and data management solutions;
manage implementation and deployment of modern big data architectures into existing it operations;
identifying and driving advanced analytics opportunities to completion;
creating analytics roadmaps, building supporting analytics organizational structures, and applying agile-based planning and implementation techniques;
identifying and leading business development opportunities;
contributing to the development of proposal technical and business content;
developing and delivering sales presentation or market positioning material;
participating in industry and technology events through speaking engagements;
defining and guiding the development of market-valued intellectual capital;
defining and developing practical solutions and methodologies;
defining and leading alliance relationships with third parties and partners;
achieving expertise in a specialization and a strong reputation as a business advisor;
mentoring and coaching team members to their highest potential and create a learning environment through leadership.

external posting qualificationswe are seeking the best and the brightest individuals. successful candidates will be able to demonstrate the following characteristics as job requirements:
 

completion of an degree equivalent to a canadian undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, information technology, information management or a related field is required;
as a senior manager role, a minimum of 8 years’ of professional experience in managing and delivering large transformation programs enabling bi/reporting/analytics various industries – specifically with analytics and information management in retail industry – is required;
knowledge of the strategic business drivers and operational process requirements within the retail industry is required;
experienced in business development and building a practice with respect to analytics and information management, primarily in the retail industry, is required;
demonstrable, expertise knowledge in modern data lake architectures (hadoop, spark, hive, or cloudera), cloud infrastructures (aws or azure), and advanced analytics (r, python, real-time analytics, finance and risk analytics, or advanced visualization) is required;
proven experience with developing data strategies, data architectures and roadmaps, delivering data governance and data management engagements is required;
experienced with project problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing client expectations, project profitability and team leadership by having lead and completed a minimum of 3 full project lifecycles is required;
expertise in market leading information management & analytics technologies including, but not limited to ibm, oracle, sap, sas, and informatica is required; and
lead delivering advisory and implementation services of large analytics programs with a multi-disciplinary teams and be accountable for results is required.

 
salary range of cad $158,000.00 to cad $172,000.00
 
benefits:
 

employee variable pay plan, providing an individual performance bonus
cad $1,300 in wellness spending
20 days allotted vacation, prorated in the first year of service
comprehensive benefits package including medical and dental coverage
rrsp and pension contribution plans available
eligible for discretionary bonuses, increase in salary, and promotions; the whole in accordance with deloitte’s standard operating procedures.

 
this position is located at: 22 adelaide street west, suite 200, toronto, on, m5h 0a9, canada
our contact information is: 22 adelaide street west, suite 200, toronto, on, m5h 0a9, canada, www.deloitte.ca

title: 
                        
senior manager, fraud innovation & analytics
                        









 

requisition id: 7163
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
the senior manager, fraud innovation & analytics will be responsible for working with business partners and stakeholders to build advanced analytics capabilities, drive innovative fraud proof-of-concepts, identify fraud threats, vulnerabilities and recommend/implement remedial actions. as an important member of the fraud team, the incumbent will support the director of fraud innovation and analytics in aligning the enterprise initiatives, acquiring enterprise level data and building out strategic roadmaps and programs to improve fraud loss performance while maintaining a positive customer experience and controlling operation costs.
 
key job accountabilities:

apply advanced data analytics techniques, data mining and machine intelligence to improve fraud mitigation capabilities.
drive the innovative fraud proof-of-concepts, ongoing assessment of the fraud threat landscape and anticipation of risks and corresponding improvement of our strategies and capabilities.
act as fraud subject matter experts in the bank’s digital factory and provide support on key business initiatives where there is a dependence on the machine learning/cognitive computing technology.
assess existing analytics functions/tools and investigate new opportunities to develop new and enhance existing fraud detection capabilities utilizing artificial intelligence (e.g. machine learning) and advanced statistical methodologies/modeling.

 
skills, experiences and functional competencies:

specific bank and/or industry experience around fraud models, advanced mathematics, machine learning, artificial intelligence
understanding banking system/processes and general payments ecosystem
in-depth industry fraud knowledge, including current fraud trends and challenges globally
minimum 5+ years of advanced analytics (e.g. machine intelligence)  experience
strong coding skills, expertise in organizing and manipulating large amount of data (sas, r & python, etc.)
deep expertise in applying complex data analytics techniques, including bayesian analysis, advanced data mining and dynamic analytics, as well as data warehousing

 
education and other requirements:

post-secondary degree in machine or statistical learning or similar discipline such as applied mathematics/statistics or engineering strongly preferred

 
location(s):  canada : ontario : north york || canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.









job segment: 
analytics, data analyst, bank, banking, engineer, management, data, finance, engineering

title: 
                        
program analyst, strategy / programs
                        









 

requisition id: 8221
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose
responsible for conducting data analysis and assessment of recruitment programs and tools, ensuring compliance with established standards and guidelines. this role utilizes data and analytics to identify improvement opportunities for recruitment
 
accountabilities

champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader bank relationships, systems and knowledge
supports the management of global recruitment programs and strategy, includes responding to inquiries related to programs, managing escalation, tracking on execution of strategy, organizing communication channels, etc.
analyzes and interprets data on recruitment programs and tools to identify improvement/enhancement opportunities
coordinates with other recruitment coes to ensure desktop procedures (dtps) and guides are updated in accordance with supported programs
collaborates with hr services in gathering feedback and data on recruitment tools to support continuous improvement efforts/initiatives
manages recruitment budget including the tracking of spend/forecast and monthly/quarterly reporting
provides project coordination support to sr. managers and program managers
conducts research on leading trends and practices on recruitment tools and processes, provides insights to director, strategy/program
understands how the bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions
actively pursues effective and efficient operations within his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, aml/atf risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the operational risk management framework, regulatory compliance risk management framework, aml/atf global handbook and the guidelines for business conduct
champions a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

 
skills

post-secondary degree or diploma in human resources or business or pursing education in related field
chrp designation is considered an asset
previous experience in recruitment operations preferred
previous experience managing and tracking budgets ($1m and up)
deep understanding and knowledge of bank policies and procedures
strong knowledge of organizational structure and internal dynamics        
knowledge of recruitment programs and processes
attentive to details and deadlines; ability to manage multiple priorities   
ability to analyze and intepret data

location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

09/28/2017






m&a analytics senior associate, transaction services






toronto, on 


job description


kpmg llp is the canadian member firm of kpmg and has offices in 33 locations across canada. the firm's more than 700 partners and 5,600 employees provide crucial services to many of the public and private business, not-for profit, and public-sector organizations in canada.in every economic environment, there are opportunities to create, enhance, and preserve value. our deal advisory professionals help buyers, sellers, private equity investors, governments, and lenders in developing and executing on their value strategies.by their nature, major transactions such as m&a deals are higher risk and reward than day-to-day business activity. it is important for our clients to remove as much risk as possible by taking advice from experienced advisers — people who have done it before and know what to look for.we offer start-to-finish support in the acquisition process, including input on strategy, early identification of risk areas, coordination and execution of due diligence investigations (financial and commercial) and input and advice on contract terms geared to reduce risks. we also get involved in assisting our clients with a host of services surrounding closing the transaction and post-deal integration.our deal advisory team includes the following service lines: transaction services, valuations, corporate finance, restructuring & turnaround, and infrastructure advisory.our clients are typically private equity funds, pension funds, large public companies, as well as private corporations. our people are motivated self-starters with expertise in finance, valuation, tax, accounting and financial reporting. our network is global.  position summary kpmg's transaction services is currently looking for professionals in our downtown toronto office at the senior associate level with a focus on applying proprietary and third-party data analytics solutions in a deal environment. working in multi-disciplinary teams, you will apply your professional and technical skills on a wide variety of transactions and at different stages of the transaction process.   role and responsibilities the successful candidate will be responsible for:  using kpmg proprietary and third-party data analytics tools to deliver deeper insights to our clients at deal speedworking with deal teams to evaluate a business’ historical performance and sustainability of earnings/cash flows and financial projections.identifying and reporting key issues, performing the relevant financial analysis, and interpreting results.developing analytical procedures and templates that can be deployed to others to increase the capabilities of the wider team.working with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured) - investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful insights to achieve targeted outcomesconducting training and information sessions with kpmg practitioners from across the firm.participating in kpmg’s engagement teams with senior client executives, attorneys, and investors.writing detailed professional reports and other client deliverables.establishing credibility and developing relationships with current and prospective clients.providing support/assistance for proposals.contributing to the effective working of the team and development of team morale.occasionally supporting one of our other business units in a cross-functional role (e.g. valuations, corporate finance, restructuring, global infrastructure project group, etc.). at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. skills & qualifications a successful candidate will possess the following skills and behaviours:highly motivated, committed, and flexible to cope with changing priorities and strict deadlines.financial and commercial awareness with strong analytical skills.demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment is essential.curiosity, healthy skepticism, creativity, and attention to detail.the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.excellent verbal and written communication skills.ability to build effective working relationships internally and externally.willingness and ability to travel internationally as required. technical skills: post-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in business or numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, statistics, computer science.experience with databases (sql server) data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of data.prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, qlikexperience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.) is an assetproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and word#li-gr1 

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.
