date posted: 
sep 20, 2017
                                

 reference code: 26283-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionorganizations today depend and thrive on timely, accurate and strategically relevant information. but as technology enables the creation and capture of ever-increasing amounts of data, effective management and productive analysis of that information are becoming enormous challenges. our information management and analytics technology team provides cost-efficient, risk-effective solutions to help clients leverage and unlock the value of their information assets.
 
organizations that can access on-demand information, trust its accuracy and turn it into strategic insight can achieve superior outcomes and gain a real competitive advantage.
 
a career in analytics information management consulting will offer you the opportunity to:
 

work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective technical field
develop solutions through debate and discussion, in our teams and with clients
continue your professional development to reinforce and expand your chosen career path
work with high profile canadian and foreign clients on a variety of canadian and international transaction and advisory engagements

  
our toronto practice is growing and we are seeking a talented practioner to join our team. as a senior manager, analytics and information management, you will leverage your educational background and skills as you develop an understanding of our clients' business and develop positive client relationships while working in a consensus-oriented environment. you'll identify issues, define symptoms or problems, and recommend solutions to clients. assisting in proposal development, participating in client presentations or services development as well as contributing to effort estimating, work planning and status reporting will be an integral part of your role.
 
you are expected to contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways, including:
 

taking a lead role in delivering and managing consulting services to high growth organizations with a diverse team of consultants;
determine the client needs by selecting and applying appropriate approaches, tools, and techniques best suited to the client's business;
working closely with clients to understand engagement change implications and facilitate implementation;
implementing end-to-end analytics and data management solutions;
manage implementation and deployment of modern big data architectures into existing it operations;
identifying and driving advanced analytics opportunities to completion;
creating analytics roadmaps, building supporting analytics organizational structures, and applying agile-based planning and implementation techniques;
identifying and leading business development opportunities;
contributing to the development of proposal technical and business content;
developing and delivering sales presentation or market positioning material;
participating in industry and technology events through speaking engagements;
defining and guiding the development of market-valued intellectual capital;
defining and developing practical solutions and methodologies;
defining and leading alliance relationships with third parties and partners;
achieving expertise in a specialization and a strong reputation as a business advisor;
mentoring and coaching team members to their highest potential and create a learning environment through leadership.

external posting qualificationswe are seeking the best and the brightest individuals. successful candidates will be able to demonstrate the following characteristics as job requirements:
 

completion of an degree equivalent to a canadian undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, information technology, information management or a related field is required;
as a senior manager role, a minimum of 8 years’ of professional experience in managing and delivering large transformation programs enabling bi/reporting/analytics various industries – specifically with analytics and information management in retail industry – is required;
knowledge of the strategic business drivers and operational process requirements within the retail industry is required;
experienced in business development and building a practice with respect to analytics and information management, primarily in the retail industry, is required;
demonstrable, expertise knowledge in modern data lake architectures (hadoop, spark, hive, or cloudera), cloud infrastructures (aws or azure), and advanced analytics (r, python, real-time analytics, finance and risk analytics, or advanced visualization) is required;
proven experience with developing data strategies, data architectures and roadmaps, delivering data governance and data management engagements is required;
experienced with project problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing client expectations, project profitability and team leadership by having lead and completed a minimum of 3 full project lifecycles is required;
expertise in market leading information management & analytics technologies including, but not limited to ibm, oracle, sap, sas, and informatica is required; and
lead delivering advisory and implementation services of large analytics programs with a multi-disciplinary teams and be accountable for results is required.

 
salary range of cad $158,000.00 to cad $172,000.00
 
benefits:
 

employee variable pay plan, providing an individual performance bonus
cad $1,300 in wellness spending
20 days allotted vacation, prorated in the first year of service
comprehensive benefits package including medical and dental coverage
rrsp and pension contribution plans available
eligible for discretionary bonuses, increase in salary, and promotions; the whole in accordance with deloitte’s standard operating procedures.

 
this position is located at: 22 adelaide street west, suite 200, toronto, on, m5h 0a9, canada
our contact information is: 22 adelaide street west, suite 200, toronto, on, m5h 0a9, canada, www.deloitte.ca

title: 
                        
senior manager, fraud innovation & analytics
                        









 

requisition id: 7163
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
the senior manager, fraud innovation & analytics will be responsible for working with business partners and stakeholders to build advanced analytics capabilities, drive innovative fraud proof-of-concepts, identify fraud threats, vulnerabilities and recommend/implement remedial actions. as an important member of the fraud team, the incumbent will support the director of fraud innovation and analytics in aligning the enterprise initiatives, acquiring enterprise level data and building out strategic roadmaps and programs to improve fraud loss performance while maintaining a positive customer experience and controlling operation costs.
 
key job accountabilities:

apply advanced data analytics techniques, data mining and machine intelligence to improve fraud mitigation capabilities.
drive the innovative fraud proof-of-concepts, ongoing assessment of the fraud threat landscape and anticipation of risks and corresponding improvement of our strategies and capabilities.
act as fraud subject matter experts in the bank’s digital factory and provide support on key business initiatives where there is a dependence on the machine learning/cognitive computing technology.
assess existing analytics functions/tools and investigate new opportunities to develop new and enhance existing fraud detection capabilities utilizing artificial intelligence (e.g. machine learning) and advanced statistical methodologies/modeling.

 
skills, experiences and functional competencies:

specific bank and/or industry experience around fraud models, advanced mathematics, machine learning, artificial intelligence
understanding banking system/processes and general payments ecosystem
in-depth industry fraud knowledge, including current fraud trends and challenges globally
minimum 5+ years of advanced analytics (e.g. machine intelligence)  experience
strong coding skills, expertise in organizing and manipulating large amount of data (sas, r & python, etc.)
deep expertise in applying complex data analytics techniques, including bayesian analysis, advanced data mining and dynamic analytics, as well as data warehousing

 
education and other requirements:

post-secondary degree in machine or statistical learning or similar discipline such as applied mathematics/statistics or engineering strongly preferred

 
location(s):  canada : ontario : north york || canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

analytics, data analyst, bank, banking, engineer, management, data, finance, engineering

title: 
                        
program analyst, strategy / programs
                        









 

requisition id: 8221
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose
responsible for conducting data analysis and assessment of recruitment programs and tools, ensuring compliance with established standards and guidelines. this role utilizes data and analytics to identify improvement opportunities for recruitment
 
accountabilities

champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader bank relationships, systems and knowledge
supports the management of global recruitment programs and strategy, includes responding to inquiries related to programs, managing escalation, tracking on execution of strategy, organizing communication channels, etc.
analyzes and interprets data on recruitment programs and tools to identify improvement/enhancement opportunities
coordinates with other recruitment coes to ensure desktop procedures (dtps) and guides are updated in accordance with supported programs
collaborates with hr services in gathering feedback and data on recruitment tools to support continuous improvement efforts/initiatives
manages recruitment budget including the tracking of spend/forecast and monthly/quarterly reporting
provides project coordination support to sr. managers and program managers
conducts research on leading trends and practices on recruitment tools and processes, provides insights to director, strategy/program
understands how the bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions
actively pursues effective and efficient operations within his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, aml/atf risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the operational risk management framework, regulatory compliance risk management framework, aml/atf global handbook and the guidelines for business conduct
champions a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

 
skills

post-secondary degree or diploma in human resources or business or pursing education in related field
chrp designation is considered an asset
previous experience in recruitment operations preferred
previous experience managing and tracking budgets ($1m and up)
deep understanding and knowledge of bank policies and procedures
strong knowledge of organizational structure and internal dynamics        
knowledge of recruitment programs and processes
attentive to details and deadlines; ability to manage multiple priorities   
ability to analyze and intepret data

location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

09/28/2017






m&a analytics senior associate, transaction services






toronto, on 


job description


kpmg llp is the canadian member firm of kpmg and has offices in 33 locations across canada. the firm's more than 700 partners and 5,600 employees provide crucial services to many of the public and private business, not-for profit, and public-sector organizations in canada.in every economic environment, there are opportunities to create, enhance, and preserve value. our deal advisory professionals help buyers, sellers, private equity investors, governments, and lenders in developing and executing on their value strategies.by their nature, major transactions such as m&a deals are higher risk and reward than day-to-day business activity. it is important for our clients to remove as much risk as possible by taking advice from experienced advisers — people who have done it before and know what to look for.we offer start-to-finish support in the acquisition process, including input on strategy, early identification of risk areas, coordination and execution of due diligence investigations (financial and commercial) and input and advice on contract terms geared to reduce risks. we also get involved in assisting our clients with a host of services surrounding closing the transaction and post-deal integration.our deal advisory team includes the following service lines: transaction services, valuations, corporate finance, restructuring & turnaround, and infrastructure advisory.our clients are typically private equity funds, pension funds, large public companies, as well as private corporations. our people are motivated self-starters with expertise in finance, valuation, tax, accounting and financial reporting. our network is global.  position summary kpmg's transaction services is currently looking for professionals in our downtown toronto office at the senior associate level with a focus on applying proprietary and third-party data analytics solutions in a deal environment. working in multi-disciplinary teams, you will apply your professional and technical skills on a wide variety of transactions and at different stages of the transaction process.   role and responsibilities the successful candidate will be responsible for:  using kpmg proprietary and third-party data analytics tools to deliver deeper insights to our clients at deal speedworking with deal teams to evaluate a business’ historical performance and sustainability of earnings/cash flows and financial projections.identifying and reporting key issues, performing the relevant financial analysis, and interpreting results.developing analytical procedures and templates that can be deployed to others to increase the capabilities of the wider team.working with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured) - investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful insights to achieve targeted outcomesconducting training and information sessions with kpmg practitioners from across the firm.participating in kpmg’s engagement teams with senior client executives, attorneys, and investors.writing detailed professional reports and other client deliverables.establishing credibility and developing relationships with current and prospective clients.providing support/assistance for proposals.contributing to the effective working of the team and development of team morale.occasionally supporting one of our other business units in a cross-functional role (e.g. valuations, corporate finance, restructuring, global infrastructure project group, etc.). at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. skills & qualifications a successful candidate will possess the following skills and behaviours:highly motivated, committed, and flexible to cope with changing priorities and strict deadlines.financial and commercial awareness with strong analytical skills.demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment is essential.curiosity, healthy skepticism, creativity, and attention to detail.the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.excellent verbal and written communication skills.ability to build effective working relationships internally and externally.willingness and ability to travel internationally as required. technical skills: post-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in business or numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, statistics, computer science.experience with databases (sql server) data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of data.prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, qlikexperience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.) is an assetproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and word#li-gr1 

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

07/28/2017






senior manager -data science






toronto, on 


job description


working at kpmg allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. being part of the kpmg global member firm of 155 countries and 174,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. you will work with national and global organizations, adding value and gaining valuable on-the-job experience. at kpmg, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available. position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following:  help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision makingvirtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques read here to know more about: kpmg data & analytics role & responsibilities  interact cross-functionally with a variety of teams and executives within kpmg to identify opportunities and to make business recommendations leveraging advanced analytics techniques and toolsprovide thought leadership to the teamresearch and develop analysis, forecasting, and visualization methods to improve the quality of kpmg company-wide analyticsengage with senior stakeholders across the business to advise and solve complex problemstranslate complex datasets into strategic insights for the business and communicates simply to non-technical audiences, visualizing results, to create understanding and solution buy-inidentify new analytics trends and opportunities to drive the innovation agenda across business functionsassignments may include international projects in collaboration with our local kpmg officesminimum qualifications: ms degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., machine learning, statistics, computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering)7-10 years of relevant work experience in data analysis or related field. (e.g., as a statistician / data scientist / quantitative analyst).previous experience leading a teamstrong communication and interpersonal skillstechnical skills: proven track record of working with large structured and unstructured data sets to extract timely, meaningful and impactful insights (including writing scripts, web scraping, calling apis, etc.)fluent with database languages (e.g., sql)strong programming skills with statistical software (e.g., r, python, matlab, weka) working experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., theano, tensorflow, scikit-learn, etc.)good knowledge of data architecture / data warehousing solutionsfamiliar with data visualization tools and libraries (e.g. tableau, qlik, power bi, d3, etc.)experience with big data architectures and distributed computing is a plus (e.g., hadoop, spark, presto, etc.)#li-ak1 

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

date posted: 
sep 18, 2017
                                

 reference code: 24623-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: montreal, quebec, canada 
all available locations: montreal 
external posting descriptionour analytic team is seeking a consultant who is passionate about using technology, leveraging analytic models and approaches to solve business problems. ideally you will be someone who displays initiative, lateral thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving. your main responsibility would be to position the analytic practice with sas.  support the expansion of the analytic practice in quebec working on analytics and digital strategic advisory mandates and implementation projects
 
in particular you will be involved in :

work in a fast growing, problem solving, innovative, agile and technology enabled environment with like­minded people who are eminent in their respective fields such as analytics strategy, business intelligence, data modeling, agile bi delivery, data management, big data, data visualization, data science and much more
orienting, designing and implementing business intelligence and data warehousing solutions problem solving critical client issues using data to deliver valued results
balancing multiple client projects and other responsibilities
becoming a reference in analytics and information management, particularly in the financial services industry and in the marketing/customer oriented lines of business
participate in building the practice, growing the team and developing eminence communicating effectively to all levels of management

external posting qualifications
1 to 3 years in a business area such as finance, risk/insurance 3 years+ in design analytics and data architectures
highly proficient in sql (or a variant such as t­sql or plsql) programming 3 years+ in implementing sas technology
experienced in other sas solutions including base sas, enterprise miner, visual analytics and other sas technologies would be well regarded
strong understanding of the sas intelligence platform and integration with applications, databases, and service oriented architectures (soap, json, rest)
the capability of quickly, regularly, and independently learning new technologies under the pressure of consistent high­profile project deliverables with review by peers and analytic leaders
strong commitment to professional and client service excellence

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: 
                        
data scientist
                        










 
requisition id: 1900
the digital factory is an innovation hub with a clear and well-supported mandate to transform the way banking technology is delivered, by re-imaging the customer experience, to deliver new digital value propositions. we have the support and experience of one of the world’s largest banks behind us and a talented, and growing, team of industry leaders driving us forward.
do you want to help us reinvent how people bank? at the scotiabank digital factory, we are passionate about transforming the customer experience.
we’re looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done.
by joining our team, you will make an impact on our customers, the banking industry, and ultimately, the world.
 
 
overview
there has never been a better time to join scotiabank as a data scientist. the data scientist role in the applied analytics team at scotiabank is designed for individuals with a curiosity for deriving insights out of data and applying them to address business opportunities.
 
what’s in it for you?

placement in a bootcamp to introduce candidates to the world of data science at scotiabank
exposure to different business lines where analytics techniques are being applied
assignment in hands-on practical projects which provide an opportunity to gain new knowledge and develop skills
ongoing training and learning program with resources like books, conferences and networking with subject matter experts at analytics user groups organized by decision sciences
a compensation program with competitive salary, opportunities for annual performance incentives based on performance thresholds, a competitive benefits program and continuing education programs. 

 
responsibilities:

collaborate with business lines and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to drive business value by leveraging data science
ingest massive volumes of structured and unstructured format data, model, transform and store it in variety of data stores
leverage distributed computing tools (e.g. spark, hadoop) for analysis, data mining and modeling
collaborate with data engineering and operational teams to deploy models and algorithms in production, across different channels and customer platforms
create and apply model and algorithm testing strategies to measure conduct multi-variate testing and a/b testing to measure effectiveness of models and make ongoing changes
prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models and algorithms used and developed
present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes

 
requirements:

university degree in relevant stem discipline (computer sciences, electrical/computer/software engineering, mathematics)
experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, xml, json, flat files, audio, image)
hands-on experience with big data ecosystem tools (e.g., hive, pig, sqoop, spark, kafka) and experience with nosql databases (e.g., hbase, cassandra, druid)
production experience with experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning and predictive modeling (e.g., cross-sell, upsell, attrition, acquisition and lookalike models)
programming skills in java, c++ or python
experience with common machine learning libraries in r, python, spark
experience with unix tools and shell scripting
solid sql skills for querying relational databases (e.g., sql server, db2, mysql)
experience using and implementing visualization tools like d3, tableau or qlikview

 
 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto 
 
 
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. scotiabankers hail from over 120 countries, speak more than 100 languages and serve over 23 million customers globally. as a highly diverse company, we know that an inclusive environment for employees and customers helps everyone achieve their best. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide a positive recruitment experience.









job segment: 
database, scientific, scientist, bank, banking, engineering, technology, science, finance

trade strategy analyst
job number: 7378
location(s): mississauga, on 
apply


food. purpose. you. 
 
we serve the world by making food people love. as one of the world’s leading food companies, general mills believes that food should make us better. food brings us joy and nourishes our lives, connecting us to each other and the earth. general mills operates in more than 100 countries and markets more than 100 consumer brands, including cheerios, häagen-dazs, nature valley, betty crocker, pillsbury, annie’s, lara bar, yoplait and more. headquartered in minneapolis, general mills had global net sales of us$17.6 billion during fiscal 2015.
 
we seek out the best talent, and then give them development resources, support and the chance to lead something big. choosing a career with general mills means joining a company where you can make a difference in the lives of millions of people. there is tremendous opportunity here for individuals who want to advance food through innovation and serve the world.
we are looking for a trade strategy analyst who is passionate about working with some of the most iconic brands.  as a key contributor to our organization, you will play a crucial to deliver analytical support and critical thinking, while contributing to the development and implementation of end to end trade strategy solutions. this role works  closely with multiple cross functional internal teams including:trade strategy, marketing, sales/account managers, finance, demand planning, customer supply chain and business execution
 
accountabilities:
support and lead trade analytics and initiatives, including:

new product launches (trade strategy components)
sell in material support and creation
trade strategy analysis and support, communication and implementation
communication liason to sales and marketing teams and information gathering
opportunity recommendations based on analytics and fact based decision making

 
assist with the analysis and evaluation of merchandising strategies

track programs
analyze and interpret results
identify opportunities
develop recommendations (end to end solutions)

 
assist with customer volume targets and yearly planning

assist with customer and business assessment
assist with the development of recommendations for assigned categories/brands utilizing consumer data and field input
data gathering, analysis, and interpretation of all trade spending to identify business opportunities
provide clear communication and direction to sales teams

  
special projects

assist sales and trade marketing with analytical projects for assigned customers/categories


assist with data needs for collaborative sessions as it relates to trade strategy


ensure all company policies and procedures are executed

title: Senior Associate, Information Design / Data Visualization
text:
pwc canada jobs - job details












                               canada    français english       pwc home industries research and insights services private companies up front tm press room events                   ?

jobs homesearch  openingssearch  resultscurrent pagejob  details   

job details job 1 of 1   apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs      position id  11273br   title  senior associate, information design / data visualization   line of service  consulting & deals   job type  full-time   city  on - toronto   job description   collaborate with industry leaders, diverse teams and innovative minds our consulting & deals practice:our extensive selection of services provides businesses with the value they’re looking for. through expert advice and assistance based on our financial, analytical and business process skills, we enhance the performance of companies of all sizes. our clients value our ability to draw on our national and international network of professionals to deliver fast, proven results. pwc’s consultants are business integrators with extensive consulting and industry experience who help our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy through execution. a pwc consulting career may provide the opportunity to grow and contribute in our various competencies that we apply to our clients’ business issues every day. the opportunity: senior associate, information design / data visualization we are seeking an experienced designer (senior associate) to join our growing information design team. information design is best defined as the effective visual representation of complex information so that it can be understood clearly and used to extract value. our team uses information design, data visualization, and structured typography best practices to analyze and interpret data, provide high-level insights, tell compelling stories, develop clear and focused solutions to complex business problems, and communicate key messages on behalf of corporate, institutional, and government clients. we work closely with the other teams within the analytics practice group, as well as technology, the various industry sectors, and the emerging digital practice. requirements: develop static and interactive visualizations from client data to deliver convincing narratives and relevant insights to clients within a variety of industry sectors actively manage design projects and the design/visualization components of larger, multi-disciplinary consulting engagements supervise junior design staff work effectively in multi-disciplinary project teams using collaborative methods emphasizing design thinking rapidly absorb key business issues and develop visual concepts that enhance audience understanding, clarify insights, and identify solutions apply project management skills to balance competing priorities and meet/exceed project deadlines and commitments demonstrate initiative and teamwork through active participation in the coordination of time-sensitive deliverables (in collaboration with project managers, creative directors, marketing managers, editors, and in-house production staff) provide creative and innovative approaches to design while paying outstanding attention to detail and quality under challenging deadlines minimum experience required  minimum of 4 years designing static (infographic) and/or interactive visualizations for client deliverables through the application of information design best practices, preferably in a corporate environment (design portfolio required) minimum of 1 year leading a design or development team proficient in adobe creative suite (indesign, photoshop, illustrator), as well as interactive data visualization tools such as tableau and qlikview familiarity with project management methods, tools, and the application of best practices familiarity with wireframing, rapid prototyping, and iterative development expertise in html5, javascript, d3, and css is highly desirable programming and data skills a bonus ability to work conceptually and solve problems through design thinking strong presentation and communication skills to convey ideas and concepts to various target groups in both business and technology minimum educational experience required  university degree in graphic design or information design, or degree in another discipline (such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering) combined with work experience in information design why work for pwcour employees make an impact with their dedication to client service, creativity, and high performance.  whatever your passion is, the opportunities available to you at pwc will help you realize your career aspirations.   pwc is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. we encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to ethnicity, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply. pwc: the opportunity of a lifetime    apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs

title: Marketing and Customer Insights Manager
text:
career opportunities








marketing and customer insights manager


job code:
7214


location:
toronto, on


department:
sonnet


# of openings:
1


job type:
full time


closing date:
04/10/17



description
marketing and customer insights manager
reporting to the marketing planning director, you will be responsible for utilizing data and analytics to identify valuable and actionable marketing and customer insights for the business in order to develop and optimize marketing strategies.  lead team to define, build and implement best in class marketing analytic programs and customer insights center of excellence.
who we are:
sonnet is an innovative new insurance brand giving canadians fast, fair and clear insurance done completely online. our mission is to provide canadians with an easy, transparent, and customized way to buy home and auto insurance online to protect where life’s most important moments happen.
we believe canadians deserve a better insurance experience, so we set out to create it. we focus on our customers first, we bring our best, and we’re stronger together.
your responsibilities:


work with numbers, trends and data to identify valuable insights and strategic opportunities.


research and analyze target markets to develop strategic and tactical plans to grow the business.


defines analytics approach and strategy on projects in line with client business and marketing objectives.


develops new marketing programs and enhances current campaigns to meet performance objectives.


proactively seeks out new analytical research and tools/approaches, or refines and enhances current suite. leads projects involving analyses and mining of large data sets, both sonnet specific data and syndicated research.


partners with cross-functional team to outline learning agenda and measurement to build a foundation for marketing strategy.


provides significant input for analytic technology acquisitions, implementation, and operational activities. determines problems and identifies opportunities to resolve based on data analysis.


your skills & experience:


university degree or college diploma in business/marketing/communications or related field.


6+ years’ experience in marketing/marketing analytics and/or customer research in order to have developed a deep understanding of the total marketing function and how data and analytics can support that.


4+ years’ experience preferred in a management role with direct reports with the ability to lead and inspire a team.


demonstrated ability to work collaboratively as part of a cross functional team to identify data sets and utilize said data to generate meaningful insights on which to build strategies and marketing plans.


proven track record of developing strategies based on marketing and customer analytics to drive business growth in an e-commerce/digital environment.


strong team player with the ability to manage projects independently.


what you’ll experience:


an incredible team of smart, diverse, and supportive people that want to help you be better at what you do


great benefits, ongoing education, and competitive pay


how to apply:
be sure to submit your application directly online for consideration.
at economical we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment that welcomes diversity and supports accessibility across the organization.
if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know at hrsharedservices@economical.com and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Senior Analyst, Insights and Analytics
text:
job application for senior analyst, insights and analytics at traderev




















          apply now
        
senior analyst, insights and analytics

        at traderev
      

        head office
      


join a tech company in high-growth mode that's part of two of the most exciting industries this generation has to offer: cars & technology. 
find out more about us and our awesome benefits at: work.traderev.com    
as the senior strategy analyst, you will be a key contributor to strategically drive the business forward using data and analytics. you will develop and implement data driven decision-making models to help us achieve our strategic objectives. with your thorough understanding of the business, you will identify opportunities to improve and own processes and practices, new initiatives, and outline milestones for successful implementation.  by being a part of the traderev team, you will get to work closely with every member of traderev, you will have a lot of opportunities to own your projects and have your voice heard.
duties and responsibilities:

design and develop sales and business intelligence reporting using reporting tools such as tableau.
using gathered data, create accessible and simplistic presentation reports leading to actionable insights. \
conduct research to identify and/or analyze trends/issues that may lead to resolving potential or current business intelligence challenges
monitor, optimize and resolve performance issues of different dashboards.
build reports and dashboards using different data sources such as my sql, sql, salesforce, excel, and google analytics.
perform in-depth analysis of research information for the purpose of identifying opportunities, developing proposals and recommendations for use by management, sales, finance and others.
interface with business stakeholders to collect and compile information; find key patterns; and combinethese analytical findings in support of strategy development.
collaborate with sales, sales operations, and accounting to define data requirements, proactively assess reporting needs and identify key metrics to assess business performance.
interface with other groups within traderev to collect and compile information; find key patterns; and combine these analytical findings in support of strategy development.
assist in developing executive-level presentations and communication that clearly links corporate sales strategy analysis and recommendations using data.
develop an understanding of how our clients operate and how technology can be leveraged to create new value streams.

desired skills and experience:

bachelor’s degree or equivalent with preferred majors in statistics, economics, business, computer science or other quantitative-focused degree.
4-6 years experience in reporting in tableau, salesforce, sql in an analyst role in business intelligence, analytics and/or reporting. 
superior data analysis, visualization and reporting skills.
detail oriented individual with high desire to organize and structure tasks and processes
exceptional problem solving, analytical and organizational skills.
experience with scripting languages such as sql, bash or python
power user in conducting business analytics using microsoft office applications (particularly expert capabilities for excel) and summarizing the data into digestible parts to different audiences.
demonstrated project management ability to meet short deadlines and execute against competing or changing priorities as well as concurrent projects.
comfortable working both independently and in a team environment.
ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise manner both verbally and in writing.
ability to interact with all levels of management within the company, customers and partners.
highly driven and motivated individual who can work in a company in hyper growth.

our core values:  fun. honest. accountable. brave. 
we thank all interested candidates; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
traderev is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity.
traderev is committed to providing employment in accordance with the ontario human rights code and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if contacted for an interview, please advise human resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior analyst/analyst, decision strategy (1700015484)job description senior analyst/analyst, decision strategy-1700015484description responsible to support the development and management of credit risk strategies of the bank for consumer or small business loans (under $250k) portfolio. examples include: installment loans, mortgages, lines of credit, auto loans, credit card or small business loan (under $250k) portfolios.
using credit, analytic and quantitative skills along with a thorough understanding of applicable operating systems, ensure portfolios performance is aligned with the bank’s risk objectives specifically as it relates to past due performance and credit losses. development of strategies must balance profit maximization
with the credit quality of the loan portfolios
 
key accountabilities

develop new, rebuild existing or modify current strategies via the decision strategy change management process. this process requires simulation, validation testing, statistical analysis to evaluate the effectiveness of the decision strategies. full documentation of the decision strategy business case is required.
maintain a good understanding of the bank’s credit risk portfolio management models, working closely with the consumer risk methodology and analytics group to implement new or refined models.
maintain a thorough understanding of the bank’s automated lending decision tools (e.g. strata), working closely with the credit system management group to implement new or refine current strategies.
assist in the development and monitoring of test and learn strategies (i.e. champion / challenger) for opportunities in reducing risk and/or improving efficiencies / profitability.
understand profitability structure under risk / return assessment analysis.
maintain a thorough understanding of the external environment and competitive offerings, identifying and acting upon trends within the marketplace where necessary to maintain the bank’s risk / return profile.
maintain in‐depth knowledge of the assigned portfolio product characteristics / offerings and a very good understanding of all lending portfolios
liaise with business and risk partners on initiatives such as new products, new strategies and campaigns.qualifications knowledge

quantitative degree in math or business (e.g. statistics, math, economics, finance, operations research, engineering etc.)
understanding of modeling and analytics; knowledge of sas desirable
technical & data manipulation skills leveraging tools like sql, sas, r etc.
knowledge of personal loan and small business loan product offerings is an asset.
strong documentation skills and strong knowledge of the ms office suite of products e.g. word, excel, powerpoint.
knowledge of risk management theory, processes and portfolio management reporting techniques
skills

risk management concepts
analytical/systems thinking
conceptual/strategic thinking
financial understanding e.g. financial statements, time value of money, return on investment, internal rate of return
teamwork and cooperation
initiative driven
organizational communication
good communication (verbal and written) skills
enterprising personality able to deal with tight deadlines
ability to work on numerous activities simultaneously.
we’re here to help
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.

title: Strategic Insights Analyst
text:
strategic insights analyst - dac group - job board view our website view all jobs thanks for visiting our job board. please review our open positions and apply to the positions that match your qualifications. strategic insights analyst toronto, ontario, canada full time strategy mid level leading digital performance agency the best strategies rise from thorough research and knowing your opponent—er, client---inside and out. whether it’s an existing engagement or a new business pitch, we need expert analysts to lay the strategic groundwork before we can launch a successful digital marketing campaign. that’s where you come in—our geeks with personality on the strategic insights team are on the hunt for a talented researcher with a knack for extracting a coherent game plan from a jumble of statistics and trends. think you have what it takes to inspire big ideas and guide us towards cutting-edge marketing breakthroughs? get in touch today! *bonus points if you’re an expert chess player and you’ll never turn down an intense game of risk.  what you get the opportunity to shape the future – yours and ours – at a well-established and fast-growing digital performance marketing agency with offices across the us, canada and europe. the chance to contribute to the creative and strategic direction of a top digital performance agency and work alongside a team of passionate research professionals. a competitive salary and benefits package, plus profit sharing. a modern, recently renovated working environment in toronto, complete with free parking, collaborative spaces, pint-pong table, treadmill desk, free in-building gym and easy access to public transit (three-minute walk to leslie subway station)  what we get a strong multi-tasker who can handle pressure and meet deadlines without sacrificing the quality of their work. a professional with excellent written and verbal communication skills who can use a variety of programs to convey stories to our clients a thorough researcher with experience using google analytics and google adwords to spot, analyze and understand trends. knowledge of spss is a huge plus. experience with graphics programs such as photoshop, fireworks, paintshop, and image composer to create engaging presentations a plus. a team player with experience using microsoft powerpoint, word, excel and/or access, and outlook. a confident speaker with experience taking data and turning it into a visual presentation that tells a story for clients and colleagues.  position accountabilities research and analysis: conduct market, industry and competitive research using in-house tools and databases to extract relevant insights to inform our clients’ digital marketing efforts. act as power user of research tools including hitwise, netbase, comscore, pmb/telmar, google analytics, and a key user of semrush, etc examples of types of research include: market / audience research: demographic, geographic, psychographic and behavioral research to develop detailed audience personas for clients. includes cross-tabulating data from multiple sources in order to build a convincing story. competitive audits: conduct analyses of multiple competitors to identify positioning, gaps, opportunities and rankings. social conversation research: handle social media conversation audit requests and act as netbase power user for social engagements, social pitches or new business pitches media audits: keyword research, share of search, ranking reports and competitive spending information. strategic insights and presentation building: build and assemble powerpoint decks and presentation content using extracted research data translate market, competitive and industry data into compelling storytelling presentations with meaningful conclusions and recommendations strong ability to identify the key takeaways or “so whats?” from a large quantity of data thought leadership and dac research support: assist with interviewing, writing, editing, proofreading and supporting the production of dac group white papers, original research and other thought leadership content. develop povs and participate as sme/write for dac blog initiative media and account support: planning efforts to support display and search teams using predictive modeling software one-off account team requests that can vary in scope, urgency, and topic monthly communications to teams on search/iyp landscape miscellaneous responsibilities: contribute to dac group task forces, ad-hoc committees etc as needed on a volunteer basis maintain organization of marketing data on “intranet” and marketing and of paper files attend semi-regular vendor meetings and express questions/concerns in order to represent dac pull together final reports for the customer service satisfaction survey what we want it’s really very simple: we want to know what makes you special. send us an application that showcases your talent – and your personality – and shows us how you would thrive in our unique agency environment. read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* address phone* resume* attach resume or paste resume attach resume as .pdf, .doc, or .docx (limit 2mb) or paste resume paste your resume here or attach resume file cover letter* in 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye!* 150 submit application ×close forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your email address enter a message (optional) the message cannot contain links human check* privacy & terms

text:
registry support and compliance officer | rpra

forgot your password?



 






share this job:





registry support and compliance officer

company:
        rpra
      

location:
      toronto, on
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
are you a passionate advocate for the environment? do you go out of your way to reduce, reuse, and recycle? do you envision a waste-free future?
if you answered yes to those questions then we’d like to hear from you.
we are the resource productivity and recovery authority (authority) and our vision is: “a waste-free ontario where all resources are reused and recycled. our mission is: “to promote and enforce accountability for the reduction and management of packaging and products.”
our mandate from the government of ontario is to advance a circular economy by supporting the implementation of the government’s strategy for a waste-free ontario: building the circular economy and enforcing the requirements of the resource recovery and circular economy act, 2016 (rrcea) and the waste diversion transition act, 2016 (wdta).
we are looking for smart, talented and committed individuals to join our registry support and compliance team to support the government’s efforts to create a clean and healthy environment for generations to come and to establish a new economy in which all waste is reused, recycled and reintegrated.
as a registry support and compliance officer, your primary responsibilities will include:

ensuring producer performance against objectives set in rrcea regulations by conducting compliance and enforcement activities
ensuring obligated parties comply with current waste diversion program plans and industry stewardship plans under the wdta by conducting compliance and enforcement activities
ensure newly obligated parties comply with registration and reporting requirements under the rrcea by providing support with the authority’s registry system and by conducting compliance and enforcement activities.

in this role, you will perform a range of activities that will allow you to flex both your analytical and customer service skills, and effect positive change in ontario.  
you’re someone who thrives in a dynamic environment. you are detail-oriented. you have an affinity for numbers and data. you can clearly communicate complex ideas. you love digging deep into databases and data models to draw out relevant info and identify larger patterns. above all, you are mission-oriented, compliance-driven, and guided by your commitment to the authority’s legislated mandate.
on a practical level, you will:

assist in the development of annual reporting for current waste diversion programs
develop and execute data quality assurance processes to ensure data consistency, completeness, timeliness, and credibility
analyze complex data sets, translating them into clear and easy to understand reports for key internal and external stakeholders
be a direct line of support to our new registrants, helping them navigate the registry through expert advice and training
deliver a high level of service for registrants to ensure customer satisfaction and ongoing user compliance
ensure compliance by conducting audits and investigating compliance issues
develop relationships with member organizations, municipalities and industry stewards to drive program participation and compliance

data, analytics and reporting will be a big part of being a registry support and compliance officer, but this role is more than just numbers and data. you will be working on the front-lines of a new enforcement and compliance initiative that will require building relationships with producers that will enable us to achieve a waste-free ontario and build a circular economy.
working at the resource productivity and recovery authority
we are a small team and recently formed.  we are in start-up mode operating in an entrepreneurial environment. we are looking for team players who know what all hands on deck means, can hit the ground running, and are ready to make the job their own.
you will be a part of a collaborative team doing ground-breaking and meaningful work with a critical environmental and economic mission.
this is a full-time, permanent position offering a competitive salary between $50,000 – $55,000/ year, commensurate with experience. we also offer generous benefits, a defined contribution pension plan, and 3 weeks of vacation. you will work full-time hours monday to friday.
our office is conveniently located on the yonge subway line at sheppard avenue. if you commute to work via the ttc, we will also provide a monthly metro-pass.
qualifications

experience in data management and analysis
experience with data modelling and forecasting tools, crm software, statistical databases and sql
experience in a customer/client service role is essential
advanced microsoft office skills (word, excel, access, outlook); experience in excel working with advanced functions and formulas, lookups, formatting, databases, mail merge is essential
experience working in a regulatory body doing compliance-related work (e.g. environmental stewardship bodies) is a significant asset
project management experience is an asset
experience working in the non-profit industry is an asset
post-secondary degree/diploma or equivalent work experience (a background in accounting and/or economics is an asset)

how to apply
our online application will allow you to apply for this position as a complete person – not just a resume with key words. the application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. after submitting, you'll receive an email inviting you to log in and view your assessment results.
we value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. if we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “help” button in the application.
we will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment, and look forward to hearing from you.

title: Business Insights Manager
text:
job description - business insights manager (17001659)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - business insights manager (17001659)job description business insights manager(job number: 17001659)primary location:on-mississauga administration employee type:full-time description:
job summary
　
the business insights manager, patient support services is responsible for managing client relationships while creating and developing continuous improvement and program insights on an ongoing basis.
the ideal candidate will have a mix of business, data, and project management skills, an inquisitive mind, and a demonstrated ability to present complex strategies in a clear and concise format.

　
duties and responsibilities

be the primary contact for designated customers


responsible for understanding client needs and converting them into solutions.


you will leverage your educational background and skills as you develop an understanding of our clients’ business and develop positive client relationships while working in a consensus-oriented environment. you’ll identify issues, define symptoms or problems, and recommend solutions to clients.


participate in client presentations or services development as well as contributing to effort estimating, work planning and status reporting will be an integral part of your role.


you will be responsible for understanding customer scenarios; defining and prioritizing program requirements and investment roadmap using data and be able to assess and validate investment impacts to the program


analyze data and understand patient trends including most at risk patients, adherence, predictive analytics and other tools to ensure program goals are met. you must be able to present these findings to the client and affect change to address findings with the program manager.


analyze financial data on a regular basis with the ability to determine and evaluate the need for change to drive business.


implement necessary cost controls, execute on growth plans and strategies through all channels. 


lead team through formulation and execution of program plans, strategies and functions.


implementing end to end analytics and data management solutions.


identifying and driving advanced analytics opportunities to completion


creating analytics roadmaps, building supportive analytics organizational structures and applying agile based planning and implementation techniques


creating business rules/ algorithms required to complete customer engagements


adhere to bayshore policies and procedures.


participate in quality activities and continuous improvement initiatives in keeping with the company's quality management system


participates in proactive health & safety activities while performing all duties. is responsible to notify immediate supervisor of any health & safety risks or concerns. responsible for completing accident reports for all direct reports who injure themselves on the job, within 24 hours of the incident.



maintains confidentiality of client and corporate information and discusses same only with appropriate bayshore personnel



complete other tasks as requested


employee will maintain relevant level of knowledge of ich (international conference on harmonization), gcp (good clinical practice) and health canada gvp (good pharmacovigilance practices) guidelines appropriate to their hired role which is to be provided at time of hire and annually. with this knowledge the employee will perform the work as required by their assigned function and will be provided with regular updates as required
 qualifications:
ba in business administration or finance and analytics

ma or mba in business administration is an asset


strong leadership, interpersonal, organizational and communication skills


5-8 years’ experience working with complex projects.


knowledge of the strategic business drivers and operational process requirements.


business development and building a practice with respect to analytics and information management.


5-8 years’ experience in analyzing and presenting results to stakeholders and clients


knowledge of the canadian pharmaceutical industry


strong quantitative and mathematical skills

job description


kpmg professionals are...  individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, are driven to achieve their full potential and understand the importance of delivering value and building relationships with clients, their communities, the global firm, and each other. a kpmg professional should have the following characteristics:strong work ethicthrive on challengespassion for creativity and innovation dedicated to providing outstanding client serviceoverview of the opportunity:  as part of advisory services, kpmg's management consulting practice can help clients unlock new potential in their organization. with the advantage of objectivity, we can apply a range of market-tested approaches clients can use to build a solid platform for their business. our professionals bring their industry experience, combined with strong technical skills and global resources, to help clients move forward. kpmg’s information technology (it) advisory practice in toronto focuses on it enabling strategies and solutions that drive greater business performance. we provide organizations the insights and capabilities they need to balance the introduction of new, innovative solutions, disrupting their business model, while continuing to maintain ongoing operations in line with cost and quality expectations. as a consultant or senior consultant in the it advisory practice, you will work as part of a multi-disciplinary team, equipped with deep industry knowledge, and use your superior analytical skills to help organizations run a more efficient business in addition to deriving greater value from it. you will help our clients address complex marketplace dynamics, leverage opportunities for growth, explore evolving technologies, and adapt to regulatory shifts. as a consultant or senior consultant in the management consulting practice within it advisory, you will:understand client issues, develop hypotheses, conduct primary and secondary research and analysis, and develop valuable recommendations;rapidly become knowledgeable on the business concepts and issues which drive the client’s needs;analyze client data in order to advise clients on insights and business opportunities based on evidence;work collaboratively with client teams and help develop client capabilities; andcontribute to all aspects of building a management consulting practice (e.g. business development, culture, community engagement, etc.)general skills and qualifications: top candidates will possess an outstanding academic record and should be pursuing (or have obtained) an undergraduate or graduate degree in engineering, computer science, business, information technology, or related field. candidates should demonstrate a proven track record of excellence and achievement, demonstrated personal and professional growth or advancement, and well-rounded involvement in academic, professional, and personal pursuits.  experience in a professional services firm supporting clients is an asset including project management and/or process improvement experience with demonstrated research, analysis, and report writing skills.the following general skills and qualifications are required:consultants are expected to have 0-3 years of work experiencesenior consultants are expected to have 3-5 years of work experience in a relevant settingstrong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to clearly and articulately identify and define problems and develop creative solutions to address client requirementsdata analysis experience demonstrated research, analysis and report writing skillsexcellent oral and written communication skillsproven relationship development and project management skillsability to work independently once provided with directionan affinity for teamwork and relationship-buildinga recognized university degree in a related discipline, with a strong academic recordtechnical skills and qualifications: preference will be given to candidates with demonstrated industry experience in supporting it initiatives using the following technologies:microsoft (e.g. azure, dynamics)workdaysap (e.g. ecc, bw, hana)oracle (e.g. ebs, fusion, peoplesoft)ibm (e.g. cognos bi)servicenowsalesforceprogramming languages (e.g. visual basic, java, c, c++, .net, php, c#, etc.)databases (e.g. microsoft sql server, oracle, mysql, etc.)proficiency and certifications in one or more of the following technical subject areas are also desired:enterprise architecturerequirements analysis and business process modellingsystems implementation (e.g. erp, hrms, etc.)it service management and itilcloud platforms and cloud integrationcyber securityinformation managementdata analytics/data warehousingsystem development lifecycle (e.g. plan, analyze, design, build, test, implement, maintain)independent it project reviews (e.g. health checks)to apply: all applications must be received no later than friday, october 6th, 2017 by 5:00pm est. our online application system will allow you to include up to five documents without losing your formatting. applications can be addressed to hiring manager and should include:cover letterresumeelectronic copy of your most recent transcript, gpa and/or gmat. if you do not have access to an electronic copy of your transcript, we ask that you attach a screenshot of your grades from your school’s website. if you experience any difficulties, please contact ca-fmmbarecruitment@kpmg.ca.
