title: 
                        
senior manager, business transformation
                        









 

requisition id: 8614
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose:
the senior manager, business transformation is responsible for the development and execution of strategic and key change management initiatives for small business banking. the incumbent leads complex cross-functional initiatives that will enable profitable growth of our customer base, net income and volume growth targets. the incumbent works closely with a diverse range of stakeholders to deliver on the short-term and long-term business objectives.
the role requires strong presentation and communication skills, influencing, leadership, people management, and project and change management skills.  
 
key accountabilities:
contribute to small business banking strategic objectives by:

supporting the director, business transformation & analytics, in the development and execution of short and long-term strategic initiatives and special projects
creating, delivering and executing business cases to support recommendations, aligned with strategic plans
performing and executing competitive market assessments and research to shape the external environment (customer, regulatory, economic, etc.), increase market position and generate customer value
being a strategic thinker who is innovative and creative in transforming information into actionable insights and plans
communicating clearly and purposefully, sharing business and strategic context on an ongoing basis to ensure our stakeholders are continually informed of relevant industry and business developments and our leadership team’s priorities and expectations
ensuring project timelines are adhered to by keeping the director aware of any red flags concerning the timing or integration process
supporting key initiatives with skills in process excellence, project management, facilitation, problem solving, accelerating transformation and value creation to drive toward required outcomes
surfacing capacity, pacing, resourcing issues and any other red flag issues needing leadership attention
applying his/her passion for growth, driving change and identifying areas of improvement across all disciplines and teams within the department and in the field
continuously improving both his/her skill set and of the team’s processes to optimize the strategy development and communication, project management, stakeholder engagement and analytical support provided to the broader small business department and in the field

 
actively engage with key stakeholders, representing small business banking objectives by:

developing strong relationships with stakeholders at peer and sr. management levels
being someone who can advise and shape strategy by influencing with and without authority
working to proactively engage business lines and product groups in enhancing capabilities and strategies within small business banking and enterprise-wide
collaborating with various other internal or external teams across the bank to deliver on key objectives as required

 
develop team capability and manage team initiatives by:

providing day to day management of his/her direct report ensuring team goal alignment
providing employee development opportunities for his/her direct report
ensuring appropriate communication, coaching, delegation and support are provided to his/her team member to effectively optimize productivity, engagement and long term development plans
continuously acquire and enhance knowledge of one self’s business/product knowledge, competitive practices, and market insights

 
skills:
the small business bank is a large contributor to canadian banking, generating niat of close to $200mm and is supported by over 600 small business advisors across canada

being able to thrive in ambiguous situations, demonstrating structured thinking/processes to simplify complexity
excellent organizational and project management skills and ability to handle multiple initiatives and prioritize effectively
the role requires a high degree of collaboration across wide ranging groups
excellent strategic thinking, organizational, influencing and strong presentation skills are critical for success
strong communication skills essential with clients, vendors and management
ability to prepare and present powerpoint decks to convey key messages and opportunities
solid understanding of financial statements and p&l levers with the ability to drive sound business decisions based on analytics and reporting
clear understanding of competitive small business market place and environment
proficient in the use of all ms office applications
strong customer focus with ability to identify customer needs and develop solutions that create customer value and profitability for the bank
5+ years related work experience in strategy development and execution and experience with strategic planning, business planning and/or strategy review processes
previous product area or business line experience preferred

 
education:

university degree or mba in business management/administration or commerce preferred

 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.









job segment: 
bank, banking, law, strategic planning, business manager, finance, legal, strategy, management

title: Senior Director, Digital Insights
text:
job description - senior director, digital insights (17014161)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior director, digital insights (17014161)job description senior director, digital insights requisition id: 17014161position type: regularposition status: full timejob: marketing/advertisingwork location: canada-ontario-toronto-40 dundas street west 4th floorunposting date: oct 10, 2017, 10:59:00 pm description cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution that’s been providing a full range of financial products and services to 11 million clients for 150 years. at cibc digital we provide personalized, simple, yet flexible digital experiences for our clients, and accelerate revenue growth for our bank. our client-centered approach builds relationships and improves sales and service through our targeted offers, atm, web and mobile channels.
 
working in an agile based startup environment, our team is comprised of talent from across all verticals – banking, consulting, and technology, among others. we brainstorm and incubate ideas at our live labs at mars discovery district where we challenge ourselves to see the world through the eyes of the client, then build and test our way to success. and we have fun while we’re doing it!
 
join our growing team of digital groundbreakers with the bank of the future. you’ll fit right in if you…
 
…think like an entrepreneur
…can see through the client’s eyes
…love to challenge the status quo
…have a passion for all things digital
…understand that collaboration is necessary for success
 
to learn more about cibc’s lines of business check out our website. 
 
to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please visit cibc.com.
 
job overview
 

reporting
to the senior vice president, digital, the senior digital insights is
responsible for setting the vision, strategy and enabling deeper insights to
drive digital sales and to provide support other future state digital
experience strategies on cibc’s online, mobile, social and abm channels.  this includes forming a digital insights
centre of excellence goals and objectives, proactively identifying and developing
tactics to accelerate revenue growth, building and leading a team of seasoned
analytics practitioners, supporting long term online/mobile channel
implementations, and developing strategic partnerships with multiple lines of
business.  this position also works closely with the chief data office, technology
and other internal and external partners to ensure data integrity, and the
efficient and effective management of information reported to and utilized by
the business.the senior director will also maintain a
strong understanding of evolving customer preferences, industry best practices,
performance benchmarks, competitor capabilities and strategies while continuing
to identify ways to enhance sales effectiveness / optimization of client
experiences across online, mobile, app, wearable, and atm technologies using
relevant measurement strategies.what you’ll be doinglead a team responsible for the development and
implementation of measuring online, mobile, app and wearable technology- touch-points
in a consistent and comprehensive manner, including understanding effectiveness
of sales, costs of servicing, campaign cost of sale insights, impact of digital
channels on customer retention and satisfaction, digital channels usage impacts
on customer lifetime value and digital enhancement impacts to overall net
promoter score.rollout of the digital experience and insights
centre of excellence operating model with a high priority placed on operating
efficiencies and processes that will enable the quick turnaround of
deliverables, real time / ad hoc insights, and synergies between other digital
channels teams.push the status quo to dive deeper into
understanding the digital client journey, connecting external traffic drivers,
benchmarks, and other relevant client experience insights to build a cohesive
story and actionable recommendation from data.provide post analysis support for digital sales,
strategy, cibc.com, online banking and mobile banking related initiatives. partner with channel strategy to support proof of
concept assessments involving cross selling from digital and identifying interrelationships
between digital and all major cibc distribution channels.create executive level insights as single point of
contact for use in business case development, revenue forecasting, modelling
and presenting findings at an overall committee level.develop and maintain relationships with key vendors
to investigate leading edge analytical tools, methodologies, and to keep
abreast of best practices across the banking and other sales industries.monitor the performance of digital
channel strategies, policies, programs, to ensure the fulfillment of strategic
objectives. recommend changes to
programs, products or services, or channel offerings as needed.provide authoritative analysis,
interpretation and opinion to support and guide executive management and teams,
ensuring an understanding and acceptance of issues and influence the direction
and nature of programs including digital user experience, digital strategy,
digital optimization, digital sales, and lines of business.at the executive level of the
organization, promote the strategic concepts, analytical tools and
deliverables, and other services provided by the digital experience and insights
team.  support sales, strategy and
partner peers with relevant insights related to adopting the new approaches to
doing business, new digital channel technologies, or new products or channel
enhancements.prepare and present reports on
significant trends impacting digital banking, including client, competitive,
regulatory, and technological or data developments.develop and support high-level
recommendations, approaches and solution for input into cibc overall digital
strategy.drive sales through strategic
project insights and new capabilities eg) implementation on how to complete
e-deposit  what we’re looking for
ability to conduct detailed
     analysis, incorporating comprehensive mathematical, statistical and
     analytical methods, models and guidelines. 
comprehensive knowledge of analysis
     sufficient to interpret and analyze complex concepts and apply these in
     innovative ways.
advanced communication skills
     sufficient to creatively and precisely articulate ideas and opinions that
     involve analysis, interpretation and assessment. 
knowledge and user capability
     of test & learn software.
comprehensive knowledge of
     financial services industry and a solid understanding of cibc distribution
     channels. 
ability to build and retain a
     highly skilled experience and insights team.
deep experience in digital strategy
     development, market/competitive and customer research and analytics;
     relevant strategy experience in product/distribution management
developed knowledge of cibc and
     retail banking industry including products, services and channels.
developed understanding of
     retail financial services distribution, including the challenges
     associated with a complex, multi-channel sales and service environment,
     from a customer and organizational perspective. 
ability to define and make
     recommendations on multi-year strategic business priorities by assessing
     implications of industry-level trends, competitive and internal business
     dynamics, and the evolution of customer needs, preferences and behaviours.
experience and understanding of
     process and technology issues and the impact on customer experience.
proven analytic and problem
     solving skills, including the ability to develop creative, logical and
     practical analytic frameworks; ability to define, assess and prioritize a
     broad portfolio of strategic initiatives. 
demonstrated business judgment
     and ability to prioritize actions or focus, particularly when faced with
     significant complexity or ambiguity. 
proficiency with adobe
     marketing cloud, google analytics, sql, ios, android and various other
     industry leading digital sdk’s and technologies is an asset. 
what cibc can offer you

flexible health benefits, stock purchase plan, competitive incentive pay and recognition programs

competitive salary and banking benefits 

career growth, development and continuous learning opportunities

opportunity to be involved in cibc events that help our communities

click to learn more about rewards & recognition, learning & development, and employee community involvement

must be legally eligible to work in canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role#li-al1

manager, operations strategy






12693br


company information


solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. that's travelers. our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. you will find travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

job summary

under general supervision, the manager of operations strategy will be responsible for successfully executing approved change initiatives within operations. this position would be responsible for all aspects of change management for projects that originate from or impact operations, including business readiness, planning and communication.this job is a manager: responsible for setting work objectives and goals for employees and managing their performance. typically involved in compensation decisions. employees have a formal reporting relationship to this job. this job works under general direction: establishes procedures for attaining specific goals and objectives in a broad area of work.


primary location

oakville - ontario - canada 


job category

project/operations management 


position type

experienced/professional 


target openings

1


primary job duties & responsibilities

evolve the function of change management within operations to be a leading area that is tightly aligned to the business.gain a detailed understanding of all inflight programs, projects and initiatives to appropriately manage the impact to different areas within operations.identify impediments to effective and efficient operational performance; introduce change in business operational processes and organizational behaviours within operations that have a positive impact on bottom line results.develop robust business intelligence reporting for service and underwriting operationspartner with business teams and owners to make data driven decisionsdetermine appropriate business capabilities needed to achieve a best in class experience and efficiencyestablish data driven benefit and proforma analyses to adequately assess business value of change initiativedefine business architecture of different capabilities and create a road map of activities for improvement investmentsdrive cost-benefit discussions around hard and soft benefit realization and trackingliaise with enterprise workforce analytics group (wag) to manage and evolve work force capacity models to align to business objectivesdevelop a strategic relationship with product management organizations to appropriately deliver necessary adjustments in our operations to meet business objective.provide expert feedback and impact analysis to business partners to help quantify total cost of ownership of changes to our operations.collaborate with business partners to implement recommendations.leverage lean six-sigma techniques to increase efficiency and effectives of operations unit.other duties as assigned.


minimum qualifications

5 years operational effectiveness experience


education, work experience & knowledge

bachelor's degreeprevious management experience considered an assetthorough knowledge or experience with project management processes and methodologythorough knowledge or experience with competitive analytics tools, including how to extract and analyze datageneral knowledge of insurance profitability, risk loads and other ratemaking conceptsgeneral knowledge of insurance operations - products and systemsgeneral knowledge of business analytics, finance or accounting and insurance fundamentals


job specific & technical skills & competencies

advanced organizational and time management skills' advanced oral and written communication skills intermediate ability to interact and manage in a highly matrixed organization intermediate use of excel, access, power point and word


licensing or certificates

green belt six sigma certification


equal employment opportunity statement

travelers is an equal opportunity employer.we are committed to providing accommodation to persons with disabilities.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment or interview process we will work with you to accommodate your needs.

title: Analytics & Insights Manager
text:
job description - analytics & insights manager (0088613)go to the main content section.careers at loyaltyonelearn more about our opportunitieslife at loyaltyoneour teamswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - analytics & insights manager (0088613)job description analytics & insights manager - (0088613) about the analytics & insights group
 
the analytic & insights group at the air miles® reward program provides world class analytical solutions through the delivery of insights that enable our clients to build stronger mutually-beneficial relationships with their customers. the group works directly with the sponsors of the program as well as internal business managers to ensure the successful partnering with our clients.
 
why work with us?
 
the manager will play a key role in supporting the development of customer-centric business and loyalty marketing strategies by delivering world class analytical solutions.  the successful candidate will lead a team of analysts and provide expertise in the application and execution of consumer data and analytics within a retail industry context. this role enables sponsors to build stronger, mutually-beneficial relationships with their customers. as a critical member of the sponsor account team, the incumbent of this role will offer expertise to link analyses and results to the business issues and analytical objectives.\
 
what will you be doing?
 

plan the analytical workload, ensuring that work is completed, insights and case studies are created, and relevant information is communicated to the sponsor team
support the client lead to define metrics and success criteria for program impact
develop and interpret analytical methods (from bi reporting to advanced modeling) in support of retail business objectives
support customer and sponsor strategies/segmentation by creating and leveraging analytics and underlying trends, providing input into developing the data plan to support the strategies
develop an ongoing analytic plan for sponsor, planning timetable and communicating deliverables for key stakeholders
execute quarterly forecasting and monthly variance analyses based on inputs from internal stakeholders, ensuring completion and accuracy and provide explanation of variances as required
accountable for ensuring that the campaign occurs as planned ensuring budget constraints are being considered against the financial forecast.
develop measurement plan and key metrics based on campaign scope as outlined by the client marketing manager and ensure the campaign objectives link back to overall sponsor objective
provide historical/trend insight to facilitate the proper planning of individual sponsor marketing calendars and provide input and recommendations into campaign targeting and campaign design
demonstrate analytics thought leadership, guidance, and representation across loyaltyone and participate in business development initiatives  what will you bring?


bachelor’s degree in any of the following (or combination of): statistics, economics, computer science, engineering, applied math, math

minimum of 8-10 years of directly-related work experience in managing analysis and insight delivery

minimum of 5 years of supervisory/management experience

technical skills - experience with excel, access, sas, sql, r, relational databases, data warehouses, analytics systems (e.g. microstrategy); strong analytical & data mining skills; intermediate predictive modeling / machine learning experience; experience with both qualitative and quantitative consumer research techniques

business skills - strong understanding of retailing - merchandising and direct marketing (market research, experimental design); interpret research, extracting insights, linking to strategies, and communicating a compelling summary of findings and drive results, client communication and presentation.

about loyaltyone

loyaltyone is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics, and loyalty services for fortune 1000 clients around the world. loyaltyone has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. these include the air miles reward program, north america's premier coalition loyalty program, precima, the global retail strategy and analytics arm, loyaltyone consulting, european-based brandloyalty, and latin america's leading coalition program, dotz. loyaltyone is an alliance data company. www.loyalty.com 

about ads

alliance data® (nyse: ads) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. the company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. alliance data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. an s&p 500 and fortune 500 company headquartered in plano, texas, alliance data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com 

employment opportunity employer. accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.

cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution
that’s been providing a full range of financial products and services to 11
million clients for 150 years. at cibc digital we provide personalized, simple,
yet flexible digital experiences for our clients, and accelerate revenue growth
for our bank. our client-centered approach builds relationships and improves
sales and service through our targeted offers, atm, web and mobile channels. working in an agile based startup environment, our team is

challenge ourselves to see the world through the eyes of the client, then build

the future. you’ll fit right in if you… …think like an entrepreneur…can see through the client’s eyes…love to challenge the status quo…have a passion for all things digital…understand that collaboration is necessary for success to learn more about cibc’s lines of business check out our website. to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please
visit cibc.com.  
job overview 

cibc’s digital insights boasts a unique experience within the
bank. positioned within cibc’s digital team, and with a startup-like
environment, the insights team is helping to lead the way in digital banking,
not just within our walls but canadian banking as well. for examples of current
digital banking solutions, please visit our website. reporting into the director of digital insights, the senior
manager is a high-impact role on a growing team. the senior manager is
accountable for overseeing a variety of projects and working closely with our
development teams, and for fostering an environment of collaboration,
problem-solving, knowledge-sharing and insight generation.  this
individual is responsible for delivering actionable insights that support
business strategy and objectives and that drive continuous enhancements to
transform the client experience of cibc’s digital properties. the ideal candidate will have a strong background in digital
analytics with a passion for understanding the broader context and uncovering
the story - the ‘why’ - behind the data. 

what you’ll be doing  1.  strategycontribute to the digital
insights roadmap and strategysupport and deliver key
strategic activities and milestones2.  relationship management continuously advocate for business
insights and customer experience metrics in all aspects of reporting
measurement.  help build trust, rapport, and credibility for digital
analytics across the organizationcollaborate with multiple teams to
correlate and share reporting, data, and insights, including:digital sales - to drive optimization
of online sales and marketingdigital strategy & innovation -
to help drive the strategic roadmapdesign & development - to help
implement changes to digital assets (online and mobile)many other business partners3.  analytics & insightsdevelop an effective reporting and
analysis framework aligned to overall business kpi’s, objectives, and goals
conducive to the optimization of all digital programs and projectswork with internal & external
partners to build a complete customer view in order to profile, segment and
optimize the user experience across digital platformsconsult with business partners to
understand business goals and the intended client journey. work collaboratively
to define and agree on kpis and target success metrics, as well as the desired
reporting format and frequency.work with the development team to
implement analytics tagging based on our standard data layer.  analyze and consolidate information from
multiple data sources (web analytics and offline data) using various reporting
toolsproduce recurring reports,
dashboards, and ad hoc reports for a wide variety of stakeholdershighlight and visualize findings and
insights in a clear and compelling manner, making it easy for stakeholders to
understand4.  benchmarkingdevelop and maintain
benchmark and trending analyses that support the business goals and customer
experience through the digital channelproactively report on
relevant multi-channel insights to provide context for performance relative to
other lines of business, and to industry-specific benchmarks

 what we’re looking for
university degree in business, math,
marketing, finance, information management, statistics or related field
(masters is an asset). solid understanding of research,
analytical and statistical methodologies and metrics and their application to
business measurement.must have 5+ years’ experience in
digital analytics, with proven track record of deriving business- and
client-related insightsmust have 5+ years of experience
using the adobe cloud platform – particularly adobe analytics (formerly
sitecatalyst), ad hoc (formerly discover), target (formerly test & target).understanding of the financial
services industryworking knowledge of online marketing
channelsunderstanding of web development best
practices, including knowledge of website design, html, javascript, and

(tableau, etc.)sql database and olap reporting tools
(cognos, etc.)experience with mobile jdkconceptual thinker with proven
analytical and problem solving skills who can see the "big picture".
ability to translate data analysis into actionable business insights.excellent communication and
presentation skillsmotivated self-starter with ability
to multi-task and prioritize competing requests in a fast-paced environmentstrong interpersonal and
collaborative skills with ability to work independently and as a contributing
member of multi-disciplinary teams.

development (023312)job description senior analyst - global market development-023312primary location: can-british columbia-vancouver what you will do (external) who we are lululemon is a yoga-inspired technical apparel company up to big things. the practice and philosophy of yoga informs our overall purpose to elevate the world through the power of practice. we are proud to be a growing global company with locations across north america, australia and new zealand, europe, and asia. we owe our success to our innovative product, our emphasis on our stores, our commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we get to make in every community we are in.about the global market development teaman integral part of the strategy team, the market planning team is a trusted partner in the development of long and short range market development plans. supporting a global multi-channel, multi-brand organization, the senior analyst, market development will work cross-functionally with retail operations, store development, real estate, finance, and other teams to devise and undertake necessary market planning, analytics, research & due diligence to develop and enable our future growth strategy..a day in the life: you conduct global market capacity analysis to identify potential new markets for long term strategic planningyou develop initial market plans for international markets, collaborating with international, digital and store development teams to target & sequence geographic areas for market seeding and channel developmentyou create market development plans using geospatial and demographic analysis, customer analytics, and competitive reviews you support operational executives in areas such as cross-channel development strategies, new store site selection, and store portfolio managementyou collaborate with finance to develop financial scenarios, projections and allocate resources to ensure strategy implementation through the annual operating plan processyou manage and utilize enterprise gis (geographic information systems), and geodemographic databases to provide mapping and cartographic analysis as neededqualifications:undergraduate degree required, quantitative degree in finance, economics or geography preferred3-5 years relevant professional experience with significant quantitative analytical work, preferably in a retail environmentdemonstrated ability to leverage data & generate meaningful business insightgis (geographic information systems), real estate, retail or market planning experience requiredtravel domestically and internationally about 20% of the timemust haves:acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life.possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results. communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same. leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure. fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships. integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously. note: only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is consultant, business performance & analytics






9127br


company information


solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. that's travelers. our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. you will find travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

job summary

under general supervision, explore and profile data, draw business inferences, complete analysis and clearly articulate findings for a target audience.  this position is accountable for performing less complex core tasks of descriptive analytics (the exploration and investigation of past business performance), and partnering with team members on more complex tasks.this job does not manage staff.  


primary location

toronto - ontario - canada 


secondary location

oakville - ontario - canada 


job category

actuarial and analytics 


position type

experienced/professional 


target openings

4


primary job duties & responsibilities

applies descriptive analytics to analyze data and validate assumptions.selects appropriate relevant data and extracts from various internal and external sources.manipulates raw data sets into information fit for analysis applying needed logic.  may require additional information from subject matter expert.presents analysis and recommendations to team members and manager. contributes to development of reporting to monitor business critical results. partners with team members to monitor data to recognize patterns and analyze trends.provides required analysis, partnering with team members as needed.applies established best practices to descriptive analytics’ assignments.participates in the peer review process.manages assigned “less complex” projects under general guidance of manager and/or team members.other duties as assigned.


minimum qualifications

minimum of 2 years of experience with descriptive analytic practices and processes. •2years working successfully with microsoft office products or similar products.


education, work experience & knowledge

bachelor’s degree in mathematics, finance, computer science, statistics, mis or equivalent experience preferred.experience with descriptive analytic practices and processes.general business knowledge required.experience working on teams.working understanding of the business functions of businesses supported.working understanding of the business functions, processes, and overall business strategies.working knowledge of analytic concepts.  


job specific & technical skills & competencies

demonstrated intermediate analytic and diagnostic skills.demonstrated intermediate interpersonal skills.demonstrated intermediate communication skills.intermediate problem solving and decision making skills.ability to work independently and as part of a team.intermediate project management skills.desire to see tasks to completion.intermediate computer skills in excel and basic skills in database programming language and/or related applications. working understanding of the business functions of businesses supported.


preferred qualifications

bachelors degree in stem (science, technology, engineering, mathematics) preferred.2+ years of analytics or related experience preferred.2+ years working successfully with microsoft office products or similar products preferred.working knowledge of analytic concepts.  experience with descriptive analytic practices and processes.general business knowledge preferred.working knowledge of insurance products/concepts preferred.experience working on teams.working knowledge of the main features of the collection of data and the relationship of data elements to each other.working knowledge:  understands basic principles and terminology in order to understand and solve simple problems).


licensing or certificates

none required.


equal employment opportunity statement

travelers is an equal opportunity employer.we are committed to providing accommodation to persons with disabilities.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment or interview process we will work with you to accommodate your needs.

                            september 26, 2017






full-time






toronto, on, canada











thescore, inc. is an independent creator of mobile-first sports experiences, connecting fans to the sports content they love through an addictive combination of comprehensive and personalized real-time news, scores, stats, alerts and videos via emerging and established digital media platforms, including its mobile sports applications thescore and thescore esports, its web platforms thescore.com and thescoreesports.com and thescore bot for facebook messenger and amazon alexa.
typical work day at thescore:

support marketing & growth efforts across the company’s three products, with an emphasis on its flagship app – thescore.
assist marketing initiatives including seo, aso, house ad executions, email newsletters and push campaigns.
design creative assets/ad units and compose copy.
create and manage marketing lists and partner-tracking docs.
track and identify news trends and media opportunities relevant to thescore.
assist in monitoring of data and performance of strategies and tactics, including compiling reports on user acquisition, retention and channel metrics.
partner identification and research; finding and investigating non-obvious partners for bd or ua (via app annie, trade publications, etc.).
day to day collaboration with the marketing team & the product growth team.
other duties as required.

requirements:

1-3 years of experience in a marketing role.
university degree in marketing preferred.
knowledge of digital marketing channels and growth tactics (a/b testing, running app install campaigns, building marketing funnels, implementing marketing partnerships, managing e-mail newsletter and push notification campaigns).
strong experience with design tools such as adobe photoshop.
proficient at excel.
excellent written and oral communications skills.
adept at managing relationships with both internal constituents and external partners.
experience with social channels including facebook, twitter, instagram and pinterest, and an understanding for what makes good social content.
comprehension of mobile analytics and marketing tools a plus (such as: google analytics, mailchimp, facebook analytics, twitter analytics, appsflyer, branch or other attribution solutions).
ability to work in a nimble and fast paced team environment.
passion and excitement for solving marketing challenges.

what we offer:

competitive salary with employee share purchase plan
comprehensive benefits package
fun, relaxed work environment
located downtown toronto; easily accessible by public transit
snacks and drinks provided
awesome patio with bbq
games room (bring your a game for our fifa 18, arcade, ping pong and foosball tournaments!)

we are an equal opportunity employer. accommodation will be made upon request.

entry-level consultant - consulting by degrees - 2018 intake - toronto






105231br


job description


 we live in an incredible time of transformation for business, society and the workplace. ibm global business services (gbs) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. with global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, ibm gbs empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries. ibm global business services (gbs) canada is now hiring entry-level consultants for the 2018 intake of the consulting by degrees program. ibm consulting by degrees (cbd) is our world class program designed to groom top, entry level consultants into tomorrow’s leaders. by providing a variety of project and role experiences, and deep skills development opportunities, our consultants are prepared to launch and accelerate their careers successfully. the cbd program seeks the best and brightest from all walks of life –from business to engineering; communications to computer science; analytics to application development and everything in between.  for more information on the consulting by degrees program, please visit our cbd program page athttp://www-935.ibm.com/services/ca/en/gbs/consulting/careers/cbd/opportunities/service lines and teams that we are currently recruiting for include:  digital strategy and interactive:you will address customer needs by designing world-class digital customer experiences; create user experience designs and prototypes. mobile development: candidates interested in mobile development roles must have experience with ios, android, hybrid and blackberry mobile applications and platforms, along with development methodologies such as agile. desired experience also include exposure to mobile web technologies (html5, javascript, css3) and hybrid technologies such as worklight, apache cordova etc. ui/ux designers: candidates interested in user experience designers/information architects roles need to have experience with css, adobe creative suite, axure, typography, human factors, agile design and development methodology and processes.cognitive process transformation: cognitive business decision support: supporting decision making that drives business value using advanced analytics, cognitive technology, industry/domain specific expertise and data. candidates interested in this role must have a strong interest in technology, analytics, big data, cloud, mobile, social and how that technology intersects with business and strategy. education includes math, statistics or an analytics or data science degree is strongly preferred. cognitive process services: outsourced functional process services using cognitive technologies to help clients speed up their transformation and deliver faster financial benefits. candidates interested in this area must have a strong financial or talent & engagement background/education. cognitive process re-engineering: core process transformation consulting services to help clients realize their strategic transformation objectives using digitization, automation and cognition. cloud application innovations: next-gen ea and mobile:  will cover all cloud, cognitive, industry, on-premise and mobile offerings and solutions for sap (s/4hana, hana analytics, hybris, successfactors, ariba, concur), oracle (erp cloud, hcm cloud, jde cloud, cx), microsoft (ax, dynamics crm, office 365, sharepoint) and workday (hcm cloud and finance cloud), as well as mobile at-scale offerings and solutions. candidates interested in this role are expected to be fully functional with all aspects of ms technology experience (office 365, visual studio and azure) or have some exposure to sap and crm systems. in addition to the technical requirements, we look for the following in an ibm gbs entry-level consultant:a technical degree in computer science or related field – for design roles, you must be able to showcase your portfolio. demonstrated leadership and adaptability with the willingness to readily and voluntarily take ownership of highly challenging tasks and problems, even beyond initial scope of responsibility.a thorough and analytical approach with the capability to apply logic to solve problems.ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines while maintaining focus despite conflicting demands.drive to overcome the most challenging or difficult obstacles and look for ways to improve results.initiative to actively seek new knowledge and improve skills.effective interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate and work effectively with individuals, strengthening relationships to achieve win-win solutions.ability to communicate complex situations clearly and simply by listening actively and conveying difficult messages in a positive manner.ability to write effectively, communicating complex messages or requirements clearly, simply, and concisely.a passion for innovative ideas, coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of view.additional criteria:must be able to travel extensively.french language proficiency is an absolute requirement for roles in quebec. a valid driver's permit is required for this role. this role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo export regulations.  if you are a foreign national from any of the following embargoed countries (cuba, iran, north korea, sudan, and syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.

trade strategy analyst
job number: 7378
location(s): mississauga, on 
apply


food. purpose. you. 
 
we serve the world by making food people love. as one of the world’s leading food companies, general mills believes that food should make us better. food brings us joy and nourishes our lives, connecting us to each other and the earth. general mills operates in more than 100 countries and markets more than 100 consumer brands, including cheerios, häagen-dazs, nature valley, betty crocker, pillsbury, annie’s, lara bar, yoplait and more. headquartered in minneapolis, general mills had global net sales of us$17.6 billion during fiscal 2015.
 
we seek out the best talent, and then give them development resources, support and the chance to lead something big. choosing a career with general mills means joining a company where you can make a difference in the lives of millions of people. there is tremendous opportunity here for individuals who want to advance food through innovation and serve the world.
we are looking for a trade strategy analyst who is passionate about working with some of the most iconic brands.  as a key contributor to our organization, you will play a crucial to deliver analytical support and critical thinking, while contributing to the development and implementation of end to end trade strategy solutions. this role works  closely with multiple cross functional internal teams including:trade strategy, marketing, sales/account managers, finance, demand planning, customer supply chain and business execution
 
accountabilities:
support and lead trade analytics and initiatives, including:

new product launches (trade strategy components)
sell in material support and creation
trade strategy analysis and support, communication and implementation
communication liason to sales and marketing teams and information gathering
opportunity recommendations based on analytics and fact based decision making

 
assist with the analysis and evaluation of merchandising strategies

track programs
analyze and interpret results
identify opportunities
develop recommendations (end to end solutions)

 
assist with customer volume targets and yearly planning

assist with customer and business assessment
assist with the development of recommendations for assigned categories/brands utilizing consumer data and field input
data gathering, analysis, and interpretation of all trade spending to identify business opportunities
provide clear communication and direction to sales teams

  
special projects

assist sales and trade marketing with analytical projects for assigned customers/categories


assist with data needs for collaborative sessions as it relates to trade strategy


ensure all company policies and procedures are executed

job details job 1 of 1   apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs      position id  11273br   title  senior associate, information design / data visualization   line of service  consulting & deals   job type  full-time   city  on - toronto   job description   collaborate with industry leaders, diverse teams and innovative minds our consulting & deals practice:our extensive selection of services provides businesses with the value they’re looking for. through expert advice and assistance based on our financial, analytical and business process skills, we enhance the performance of companies of all sizes. our clients value our ability to draw on our national and international network of professionals to deliver fast, proven results. pwc’s consultants are business integrators with extensive consulting and industry experience who help our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy through execution. a pwc consulting career may provide the opportunity to grow and contribute in our various competencies that we apply to our clients’ business issues every day. the opportunity: senior associate, information design / data visualization we are seeking an experienced designer (senior associate) to join our growing information design team. information design is best defined as the effective visual representation of complex information so that it can be understood clearly and used to extract value. our team uses information design, data visualization, and structured typography best practices to analyze and interpret data, provide high-level insights, tell compelling stories, develop clear and focused solutions to complex business problems, and communicate key messages on behalf of corporate, institutional, and government clients. we work closely with the other teams within the analytics practice group, as well as technology, the various industry sectors, and the emerging digital practice. requirements: develop static and interactive visualizations from client data to deliver convincing narratives and relevant insights to clients within a variety of industry sectors actively manage design projects and the design/visualization components of larger, multi-disciplinary consulting engagements supervise junior design staff work effectively in multi-disciplinary project teams using collaborative methods emphasizing design thinking rapidly absorb key business issues and develop visual concepts that enhance audience understanding, clarify insights, and identify solutions apply project management skills to balance competing priorities and meet/exceed project deadlines and commitments demonstrate initiative and teamwork through active participation in the coordination of time-sensitive deliverables (in collaboration with project managers, creative directors, marketing managers, editors, and in-house production staff) provide creative and innovative approaches to design while paying outstanding attention to detail and quality under challenging deadlines minimum experience required  minimum of 4 years designing static (infographic) and/or interactive visualizations for client deliverables through the application of information design best practices, preferably in a corporate environment (design portfolio required) minimum of 1 year leading a design or development team proficient in adobe creative suite (indesign, photoshop, illustrator), as well as interactive data visualization tools such as tableau and qlikview familiarity with project management methods, tools, and the application of best practices familiarity with wireframing, rapid prototyping, and iterative development expertise in html5, javascript, d3, and css is highly desirable programming and data skills a bonus ability to work conceptually and solve problems through design thinking strong presentation and communication skills to convey ideas and concepts to various target groups in both business and technology minimum educational experience required  university degree in graphic design or information design, or degree in another discipline (such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering) combined with work experience in information design why work for pwcour employees make an impact with their dedication to client service, creativity, and high performance.  whatever your passion is, the opportunities available to you at pwc will help you realize your career aspirations.   pwc is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. we encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to ethnicity, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply. pwc: the opportunity of a lifetime    apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs

title: Marketing and Customer Insights Manager
text:
career opportunities








marketing and customer insights manager


job code:
7214


location:
toronto, on


department:
sonnet


# of openings:
1


job type:
full time


closing date:
04/10/17



description
marketing and customer insights manager
reporting to the marketing planning director, you will be responsible for utilizing data and analytics to identify valuable and actionable marketing and customer insights for the business in order to develop and optimize marketing strategies.  lead team to define, build and implement best in class marketing analytic programs and customer insights center of excellence.
who we are:
sonnet is an innovative new insurance brand giving canadians fast, fair and clear insurance done completely online. our mission is to provide canadians with an easy, transparent, and customized way to buy home and auto insurance online to protect where life’s most important moments happen.
we believe canadians deserve a better insurance experience, so we set out to create it. we focus on our customers first, we bring our best, and we’re stronger together.
your responsibilities:


work with numbers, trends and data to identify valuable insights and strategic opportunities.


research and analyze target markets to develop strategic and tactical plans to grow the business.


defines analytics approach and strategy on projects in line with client business and marketing objectives.


develops new marketing programs and enhances current campaigns to meet performance objectives.


proactively seeks out new analytical research and tools/approaches, or refines and enhances current suite. leads projects involving analyses and mining of large data sets, both sonnet specific data and syndicated research.


partners with cross-functional team to outline learning agenda and measurement to build a foundation for marketing strategy.


provides significant input for analytic technology acquisitions, implementation, and operational activities. determines problems and identifies opportunities to resolve based on data analysis.


your skills & experience:


university degree or college diploma in business/marketing/communications or related field.


6+ years’ experience in marketing/marketing analytics and/or customer research in order to have developed a deep understanding of the total marketing function and how data and analytics can support that.


4+ years’ experience preferred in a management role with direct reports with the ability to lead and inspire a team.


demonstrated ability to work collaboratively as part of a cross functional team to identify data sets and utilize said data to generate meaningful insights on which to build strategies and marketing plans.


proven track record of developing strategies based on marketing and customer analytics to drive business growth in an e-commerce/digital environment.


strong team player with the ability to manage projects independently.


what you’ll experience:


an incredible team of smart, diverse, and supportive people that want to help you be better at what you do


great benefits, ongoing education, and competitive pay


how to apply:
be sure to submit your application directly online for consideration.
at economical we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment that welcomes diversity and supports accessibility across the organization.
if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know at hrsharedservices@economical.com and we will work with you to meet your needs.

join a tech company in high-growth mode that's part of two of the most exciting industries this generation has to offer: cars & technology. 
find out more about us and our awesome benefits at: work.traderev.com    
as the senior strategy analyst, you will be a key contributor to strategically drive the business forward using data and analytics. you will develop and implement data driven decision-making models to help us achieve our strategic objectives. with your thorough understanding of the business, you will identify opportunities to improve and own processes and practices, new initiatives, and outline milestones for successful implementation.  by being a part of the traderev team, you will get to work closely with every member of traderev, you will have a lot of opportunities to own your projects and have your voice heard.
duties and responsibilities:

design and develop sales and business intelligence reporting using reporting tools such as tableau.
using gathered data, create accessible and simplistic presentation reports leading to actionable insights. \
conduct research to identify and/or analyze trends/issues that may lead to resolving potential or current business intelligence challenges
monitor, optimize and resolve performance issues of different dashboards.
build reports and dashboards using different data sources such as my sql, sql, salesforce, excel, and google analytics.
perform in-depth analysis of research information for the purpose of identifying opportunities, developing proposals and recommendations for use by management, sales, finance and others.
interface with business stakeholders to collect and compile information; find key patterns; and combinethese analytical findings in support of strategy development.
collaborate with sales, sales operations, and accounting to define data requirements, proactively assess reporting needs and identify key metrics to assess business performance.
interface with other groups within traderev to collect and compile information; find key patterns; and combine these analytical findings in support of strategy development.
assist in developing executive-level presentations and communication that clearly links corporate sales strategy analysis and recommendations using data.
develop an understanding of how our clients operate and how technology can be leveraged to create new value streams.

desired skills and experience:

bachelor’s degree or equivalent with preferred majors in statistics, economics, business, computer science or other quantitative-focused degree.
4-6 years experience in reporting in tableau, salesforce, sql in an analyst role in business intelligence, analytics and/or reporting. 
superior data analysis, visualization and reporting skills.
detail oriented individual with high desire to organize and structure tasks and processes
exceptional problem solving, analytical and organizational skills.
experience with scripting languages such as sql, bash or python
power user in conducting business analytics using microsoft office applications (particularly expert capabilities for excel) and summarizing the data into digestible parts to different audiences.
demonstrated project management ability to meet short deadlines and execute against competing or changing priorities as well as concurrent projects.
comfortable working both independently and in a team environment.
ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise manner both verbally and in writing.
ability to interact with all levels of management within the company, customers and partners.
highly driven and motivated individual who can work in a company in hyper growth.

our core values:  fun. honest. accountable. brave. 
we thank all interested candidates; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
traderev is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity.
traderev is committed to providing employment in accordance with the ontario human rights code and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if contacted for an interview, please advise human resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

using credit, analytic and quantitative skills along with a thorough understanding of applicable operating systems, ensure portfolios performance is aligned with the bank’s risk objectives specifically as it relates to past due performance and credit losses. development of strategies must balance profit maximization
with the credit quality of the loan portfolios
 
key accountabilities

develop new, rebuild existing or modify current strategies via the decision strategy change management process. this process requires simulation, validation testing, statistical analysis to evaluate the effectiveness of the decision strategies. full documentation of the decision strategy business case is required.
maintain a good understanding of the bank’s credit risk portfolio management models, working closely with the consumer risk methodology and analytics group to implement new or refined models.
maintain a thorough understanding of the bank’s automated lending decision tools (e.g. strata), working closely with the credit system management group to implement new or refine current strategies.
assist in the development and monitoring of test and learn strategies (i.e. champion / challenger) for opportunities in reducing risk and/or improving efficiencies / profitability.
understand profitability structure under risk / return assessment analysis.
maintain a thorough understanding of the external environment and competitive offerings, identifying and acting upon trends within the marketplace where necessary to maintain the bank’s risk / return profile.
maintain in‐depth knowledge of the assigned portfolio product characteristics / offerings and a very good understanding of all lending portfolios
liaise with business and risk partners on initiatives such as new products, new strategies and campaigns.qualifications knowledge

quantitative degree in math or business (e.g. statistics, math, economics, finance, operations research, engineering etc.)
understanding of modeling and analytics; knowledge of sas desirable
technical & data manipulation skills leveraging tools like sql, sas, r etc.
knowledge of personal loan and small business loan product offerings is an asset.
strong documentation skills and strong knowledge of the ms office suite of products e.g. word, excel, powerpoint.
knowledge of risk management theory, processes and portfolio management reporting techniques
skills

risk management concepts
analytical/systems thinking
conceptual/strategic thinking
financial understanding e.g. financial statements, time value of money, return on investment, internal rate of return
teamwork and cooperation
initiative driven
organizational communication
good communication (verbal and written) skills
enterprising personality able to deal with tight deadlines
ability to work on numerous activities simultaneously.
we’re here to help
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.

title: Strategic Insights Analyst
text:
strategic insights analyst - dac group - job board view our website view all jobs thanks for visiting our job board. please review our open positions and apply to the positions that match your qualifications. strategic insights analyst toronto, ontario, canada full time strategy mid level leading digital performance agency the best strategies rise from thorough research and knowing your opponent—er, client---inside and out. whether it’s an existing engagement or a new business pitch, we need expert analysts to lay the strategic groundwork before we can launch a successful digital marketing campaign. that’s where you come in—our geeks with personality on the strategic insights team are on the hunt for a talented researcher with a knack for extracting a coherent game plan from a jumble of statistics and trends. think you have what it takes to inspire big ideas and guide us towards cutting-edge marketing breakthroughs? get in touch today! *bonus points if you’re an expert chess player and you’ll never turn down an intense game of risk.  what you get the opportunity to shape the future – yours and ours – at a well-established and fast-growing digital performance marketing agency with offices across the us, canada and europe. the chance to contribute to the creative and strategic direction of a top digital performance agency and work alongside a team of passionate research professionals. a competitive salary and benefits package, plus profit sharing. a modern, recently renovated working environment in toronto, complete with free parking, collaborative spaces, pint-pong table, treadmill desk, free in-building gym and easy access to public transit (three-minute walk to leslie subway station)  what we get a strong multi-tasker who can handle pressure and meet deadlines without sacrificing the quality of their work. a professional with excellent written and verbal communication skills who can use a variety of programs to convey stories to our clients a thorough researcher with experience using google analytics and google adwords to spot, analyze and understand trends. knowledge of spss is a huge plus. experience with graphics programs such as photoshop, fireworks, paintshop, and image composer to create engaging presentations a plus. a team player with experience using microsoft powerpoint, word, excel and/or access, and outlook. a confident speaker with experience taking data and turning it into a visual presentation that tells a story for clients and colleagues.  position accountabilities research and analysis: conduct market, industry and competitive research using in-house tools and databases to extract relevant insights to inform our clients’ digital marketing efforts. act as power user of research tools including hitwise, netbase, comscore, pmb/telmar, google analytics, and a key user of semrush, etc examples of types of research include: market / audience research: demographic, geographic, psychographic and behavioral research to develop detailed audience personas for clients. includes cross-tabulating data from multiple sources in order to build a convincing story. competitive audits: conduct analyses of multiple competitors to identify positioning, gaps, opportunities and rankings. social conversation research: handle social media conversation audit requests and act as netbase power user for social engagements, social pitches or new business pitches media audits: keyword research, share of search, ranking reports and competitive spending information. strategic insights and presentation building: build and assemble powerpoint decks and presentation content using extracted research data translate market, competitive and industry data into compelling storytelling presentations with meaningful conclusions and recommendations strong ability to identify the key takeaways or “so whats?” from a large quantity of data thought leadership and dac research support: assist with interviewing, writing, editing, proofreading and supporting the production of dac group white papers, original research and other thought leadership content. develop povs and participate as sme/write for dac blog initiative media and account support: planning efforts to support display and search teams using predictive modeling software one-off account team requests that can vary in scope, urgency, and topic monthly communications to teams on search/iyp landscape miscellaneous responsibilities: contribute to dac group task forces, ad-hoc committees etc as needed on a volunteer basis maintain organization of marketing data on “intranet” and marketing and of paper files attend semi-regular vendor meetings and express questions/concerns in order to represent dac pull together final reports for the customer service satisfaction survey what we want it’s really very simple: we want to know what makes you special. send us an application that showcases your talent – and your personality – and shows us how you would thrive in our unique agency environment. read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply text:
registry support and compliance officer | rpra

share this job:





registry support and compliance officer

company:
        rpra
      

location:
      toronto, on
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
are you a passionate advocate for the environment? do you go out of your way to reduce, reuse, and recycle? do you envision a waste-free future?
if you answered yes to those questions then we’d like to hear from you.
we are the resource productivity and recovery authority (authority) and our vision is: “a waste-free ontario where all resources are reused and recycled. our mission is: “to promote and enforce accountability for the reduction and management of packaging and products.”
our mandate from the government of ontario is to advance a circular economy by supporting the implementation of the government’s strategy for a waste-free ontario: building the circular economy and enforcing the requirements of the resource recovery and circular economy act, 2016 (rrcea) and the waste diversion transition act, 2016 (wdta).
we are looking for smart, talented and committed individuals to join our registry support and compliance team to support the government’s efforts to create a clean and healthy environment for generations to come and to establish a new economy in which all waste is reused, recycled and reintegrated.
as a registry support and compliance officer, your primary responsibilities will include:

ensuring producer performance against objectives set in rrcea regulations by conducting compliance and enforcement activities
ensuring obligated parties comply with current waste diversion program plans and industry stewardship plans under the wdta by conducting compliance and enforcement activities
ensure newly obligated parties comply with registration and reporting requirements under the rrcea by providing support with the authority’s registry system and by conducting compliance and enforcement activities.

in this role, you will perform a range of activities that will allow you to flex both your analytical and customer service skills, and effect positive change in ontario.  
you’re someone who thrives in a dynamic environment. you are detail-oriented. you have an affinity for numbers and data. you can clearly communicate complex ideas. you love digging deep into databases and data models to draw out relevant info and identify larger patterns. above all, you are mission-oriented, compliance-driven, and guided by your commitment to the authority’s legislated mandate.
on a practical level, you will:

assist in the development of annual reporting for current waste diversion programs
develop and execute data quality assurance processes to ensure data consistency, completeness, timeliness, and credibility
analyze complex data sets, translating them into clear and easy to understand reports for key internal and external stakeholders
be a direct line of support to our new registrants, helping them navigate the registry through expert advice and training
deliver a high level of service for registrants to ensure customer satisfaction and ongoing user compliance
ensure compliance by conducting audits and investigating compliance issues
develop relationships with member organizations, municipalities and industry stewards to drive program participation and compliance

data, analytics and reporting will be a big part of being a registry support and compliance officer, but this role is more than just numbers and data. you will be working on the front-lines of a new enforcement and compliance initiative that will require building relationships with producers that will enable us to achieve a waste-free ontario and build a circular economy.
working at the resource productivity and recovery authority
we are a small team and recently formed.  we are in start-up mode operating in an entrepreneurial environment. we are looking for team players who know what all hands on deck means, can hit the ground running, and are ready to make the job their own.
you will be a part of a collaborative team doing ground-breaking and meaningful work with a critical environmental and economic mission.
this is a full-time, permanent position offering a competitive salary between $50,000 – $55,000/ year, commensurate with experience. we also offer generous benefits, a defined contribution pension plan, and 3 weeks of vacation. you will work full-time hours monday to friday.
our office is conveniently located on the yonge subway line at sheppard avenue. if you commute to work via the ttc, we will also provide a monthly metro-pass.
qualifications

experience in data management and analysis
experience with data modelling and forecasting tools, crm software, statistical databases and sql
experience in a customer/client service role is essential
advanced microsoft office skills (word, excel, access, outlook); experience in excel working with advanced functions and formulas, lookups, formatting, databases, mail merge is essential
experience working in a regulatory body doing compliance-related work (e.g. environmental stewardship bodies) is a significant asset
project management experience is an asset
experience working in the non-profit industry is an asset
post-secondary degree/diploma or equivalent work experience (a background in accounting and/or economics is an asset)

how to apply
our online application will allow you to apply for this position as a complete person – not just a resume with key words. the application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. after submitting, you'll receive an email inviting you to log in and view your assessment results.
we value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. if we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “help” button in the application.
we will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment, and look forward to hearing from you.
