title: Business Insights Manager
text:
job description - business insights manager (17001659)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - business insights manager (17001659)job description business insights manager(job number: 17001659)primary location:on-mississauga administration employee type:full-time description:
job summary
　
the business insights manager, patient support services is responsible for managing client relationships while creating and developing continuous improvement and program insights on an ongoing basis.
the ideal candidate will have a mix of business, data, and project management skills, an inquisitive mind, and a demonstrated ability to present complex strategies in a clear and concise format.

　
duties and responsibilities

be the primary contact for designated customers


responsible for understanding client needs and converting them into solutions.


you will leverage your educational background and skills as you develop an understanding of our clients’ business and develop positive client relationships while working in a consensus-oriented environment. you’ll identify issues, define symptoms or problems, and recommend solutions to clients.


participate in client presentations or services development as well as contributing to effort estimating, work planning and status reporting will be an integral part of your role.


you will be responsible for understanding customer scenarios; defining and prioritizing program requirements and investment roadmap using data and be able to assess and validate investment impacts to the program


analyze data and understand patient trends including most at risk patients, adherence, predictive analytics and other tools to ensure program goals are met. you must be able to present these findings to the client and affect change to address findings with the program manager.


analyze financial data on a regular basis with the ability to determine and evaluate the need for change to drive business.


implement necessary cost controls, execute on growth plans and strategies through all channels. 


lead team through formulation and execution of program plans, strategies and functions.


implementing end to end analytics and data management solutions.


identifying and driving advanced analytics opportunities to completion


creating analytics roadmaps, building supportive analytics organizational structures and applying agile based planning and implementation techniques


creating business rules/ algorithms required to complete customer engagements


adhere to bayshore policies and procedures.


participate in quality activities and continuous improvement initiatives in keeping with the company's quality management system


participates in proactive health & safety activities while performing all duties. is responsible to notify immediate supervisor of any health & safety risks or concerns. responsible for completing accident reports for all direct reports who injure themselves on the job, within 24 hours of the incident.



maintains confidentiality of client and corporate information and discusses same only with appropriate bayshore personnel



complete other tasks as requested


employee will maintain relevant level of knowledge of ich (international conference on harmonization), gcp (good clinical practice) and health canada gvp (good pharmacovigilance practices) guidelines appropriate to their hired role which is to be provided at time of hire and annually. with this knowledge the employee will perform the work as required by their assigned function and will be provided with regular updates as required
 qualifications:
ba in business administration or finance and analytics

ma or mba in business administration is an asset


strong leadership, interpersonal, organizational and communication skills


5-8 years’ experience working with complex projects.


knowledge of the strategic business drivers and operational process requirements.


business development and building a practice with respect to analytics and information management.


5-8 years’ experience in analyzing and presenting results to stakeholders and clients


knowledge of the canadian pharmaceutical industry


strong quantitative and mathematical skills

job description


kpmg professionals are...  individuals who take deep personal accountability for their work, have a passion for excellence, are driven to achieve their full potential and understand the importance of delivering value and building relationships with clients, their communities, the global firm, and each other. a kpmg professional should have the following characteristics:strong work ethicthrive on challengespassion for creativity and innovation dedicated to providing outstanding client serviceoverview of the opportunity:  as part of advisory services, kpmg's management consulting practice can help clients unlock new potential in their organization. with the advantage of objectivity, we can apply a range of market-tested approaches clients can use to build a solid platform for their business. our professionals bring their industry experience, combined with strong technical skills and global resources, to help clients move forward. kpmg’s information technology (it) advisory practice in toronto focuses on it enabling strategies and solutions that drive greater business performance. we provide organizations the insights and capabilities they need to balance the introduction of new, innovative solutions, disrupting their business model, while continuing to maintain ongoing operations in line with cost and quality expectations. as a consultant or senior consultant in the it advisory practice, you will work as part of a multi-disciplinary team, equipped with deep industry knowledge, and use your superior analytical skills to help organizations run a more efficient business in addition to deriving greater value from it. you will help our clients address complex marketplace dynamics, leverage opportunities for growth, explore evolving technologies, and adapt to regulatory shifts. as a consultant or senior consultant in the management consulting practice within it advisory, you will:understand client issues, develop hypotheses, conduct primary and secondary research and analysis, and develop valuable recommendations;rapidly become knowledgeable on the business concepts and issues which drive the client’s needs;analyze client data in order to advise clients on insights and business opportunities based on evidence;work collaboratively with client teams and help develop client capabilities; andcontribute to all aspects of building a management consulting practice (e.g. business development, culture, community engagement, etc.)general skills and qualifications: top candidates will possess an outstanding academic record and should be pursuing (or have obtained) an undergraduate or graduate degree in engineering, computer science, business, information technology, or related field. candidates should demonstrate a proven track record of excellence and achievement, demonstrated personal and professional growth or advancement, and well-rounded involvement in academic, professional, and personal pursuits.  experience in a professional services firm supporting clients is an asset including project management and/or process improvement experience with demonstrated research, analysis, and report writing skills.the following general skills and qualifications are required:consultants are expected to have 0-3 years of work experiencesenior consultants are expected to have 3-5 years of work experience in a relevant settingstrong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to clearly and articulately identify and define problems and develop creative solutions to address client requirementsdata analysis experience demonstrated research, analysis and report writing skillsexcellent oral and written communication skillsproven relationship development and project management skillsability to work independently once provided with directionan affinity for teamwork and relationship-buildinga recognized university degree in a related discipline, with a strong academic recordtechnical skills and qualifications: preference will be given to candidates with demonstrated industry experience in supporting it initiatives using the following technologies:microsoft (e.g. azure, dynamics)workdaysap (e.g. ecc, bw, hana)oracle (e.g. ebs, fusion, peoplesoft)ibm (e.g. cognos bi)servicenowsalesforceprogramming languages (e.g. visual basic, java, c, c++, .net, php, c#, etc.)databases (e.g. microsoft sql server, oracle, mysql, etc.)proficiency and certifications in one or more of the following technical subject areas are also desired:enterprise architecturerequirements analysis and business process modellingsystems implementation (e.g. erp, hrms, etc.)it service management and itilcloud platforms and cloud integrationcyber securityinformation managementdata analytics/data warehousingsystem development lifecycle (e.g. plan, analyze, design, build, test, implement, maintain)independent it project reviews (e.g. health checks)to apply: all applications must be received no later than friday, october 6th, 2017 by 5:00pm est. our online application system will allow you to include up to five documents without losing your formatting. applications can be addressed to hiring manager and should include:cover letterresumeelectronic copy of your most recent transcript, gpa and/or gmat. if you do not have access to an electronic copy of your transcript, we ask that you attach a screenshot of your grades from your school’s website. if you experience any difficulties, please contact ca-fmmbarecruitment@kpmg.ca.

title: 
                        
senior manager, business transformation
                        









 

requisition id: 8614
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose:
the senior manager, business transformation is responsible for the development and execution of strategic and key change management initiatives for small business banking. the incumbent leads complex cross-functional initiatives that will enable profitable growth of our customer base, net income and volume growth targets. the incumbent works closely with a diverse range of stakeholders to deliver on the short-term and long-term business objectives.
the role requires strong presentation and communication skills, influencing, leadership, people management, and project and change management skills.  
 
key accountabilities:
contribute to small business banking strategic objectives by:

supporting the director, business transformation & analytics, in the development and execution of short and long-term strategic initiatives and special projects
creating, delivering and executing business cases to support recommendations, aligned with strategic plans
performing and executing competitive market assessments and research to shape the external environment (customer, regulatory, economic, etc.), increase market position and generate customer value
being a strategic thinker who is innovative and creative in transforming information into actionable insights and plans
communicating clearly and purposefully, sharing business and strategic context on an ongoing basis to ensure our stakeholders are continually informed of relevant industry and business developments and our leadership team’s priorities and expectations
ensuring project timelines are adhered to by keeping the director aware of any red flags concerning the timing or integration process
supporting key initiatives with skills in process excellence, project management, facilitation, problem solving, accelerating transformation and value creation to drive toward required outcomes
surfacing capacity, pacing, resourcing issues and any other red flag issues needing leadership attention
applying his/her passion for growth, driving change and identifying areas of improvement across all disciplines and teams within the department and in the field
continuously improving both his/her skill set and of the team’s processes to optimize the strategy development and communication, project management, stakeholder engagement and analytical support provided to the broader small business department and in the field

 
actively engage with key stakeholders, representing small business banking objectives by:

developing strong relationships with stakeholders at peer and sr. management levels
being someone who can advise and shape strategy by influencing with and without authority
working to proactively engage business lines and product groups in enhancing capabilities and strategies within small business banking and enterprise-wide
collaborating with various other internal or external teams across the bank to deliver on key objectives as required

 
develop team capability and manage team initiatives by:

providing day to day management of his/her direct report ensuring team goal alignment
providing employee development opportunities for his/her direct report
ensuring appropriate communication, coaching, delegation and support are provided to his/her team member to effectively optimize productivity, engagement and long term development plans
continuously acquire and enhance knowledge of one self’s business/product knowledge, competitive practices, and market insights

 
skills:
the small business bank is a large contributor to canadian banking, generating niat of close to $200mm and is supported by over 600 small business advisors across canada

being able to thrive in ambiguous situations, demonstrating structured thinking/processes to simplify complexity
excellent organizational and project management skills and ability to handle multiple initiatives and prioritize effectively
the role requires a high degree of collaboration across wide ranging groups
excellent strategic thinking, organizational, influencing and strong presentation skills are critical for success
strong communication skills essential with clients, vendors and management
ability to prepare and present powerpoint decks to convey key messages and opportunities
solid understanding of financial statements and p&l levers with the ability to drive sound business decisions based on analytics and reporting
clear understanding of competitive small business market place and environment
proficient in the use of all ms office applications
strong customer focus with ability to identify customer needs and develop solutions that create customer value and profitability for the bank
5+ years related work experience in strategy development and execution and experience with strategic planning, business planning and/or strategy review processes
previous product area or business line experience preferred

 
education:

university degree or mba in business management/administration or commerce preferred

 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

bank, banking, law, strategic planning, business manager, finance, legal, strategy, management

text:
job description - senior director, digital insights (17014161)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior director, digital insights (17014161)job description senior director, digital insights requisition id: 17014161position type: regularposition status: full timejob: marketing/advertisingwork location: canada-ontario-toronto-40 dundas street west 4th floorunposting date: oct 10, 2017, 10:59:00 pm description cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution that’s been providing a full range of financial products and services to 11 million clients for 150 years. at cibc digital we provide personalized, simple, yet flexible digital experiences for our clients, and accelerate revenue growth for our bank. our client-centered approach builds relationships and improves sales and service through our targeted offers, atm, web and mobile channels.
 
working in an agile based startup environment, our team is comprised of talent from across all verticals – banking, consulting, and technology, among others. we brainstorm and incubate ideas at our live labs at mars discovery district where we challenge ourselves to see the world through the eyes of the client, then build and test our way to success. and we have fun while we’re doing it!
 
join our growing team of digital groundbreakers with the bank of the future. you’ll fit right in if you…
 
…think like an entrepreneur
…can see through the client’s eyes
…love to challenge the status quo
…have a passion for all things digital
…understand that collaboration is necessary for success
 
to learn more about cibc’s lines of business check out our website. 
 
to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please visit cibc.com.
 
job overview
 

reporting
to the senior vice president, digital, the senior digital insights is
responsible for setting the vision, strategy and enabling deeper insights to
drive digital sales and to provide support other future state digital
experience strategies on cibc’s online, mobile, social and abm channels.  this includes forming a digital insights
centre of excellence goals and objectives, proactively identifying and developing
tactics to accelerate revenue growth, building and leading a team of seasoned
analytics practitioners, supporting long term online/mobile channel
implementations, and developing strategic partnerships with multiple lines of
business.  this position also works closely with the chief data office, technology
and other internal and external partners to ensure data integrity, and the
efficient and effective management of information reported to and utilized by
the business.the senior director will also maintain a
strong understanding of evolving customer preferences, industry best practices,
performance benchmarks, competitor capabilities and strategies while continuing
to identify ways to enhance sales effectiveness / optimization of client
experiences across online, mobile, app, wearable, and atm technologies using
relevant measurement strategies.what you’ll be doinglead a team responsible for the development and
implementation of measuring online, mobile, app and wearable technology- touch-points
in a consistent and comprehensive manner, including understanding effectiveness
of sales, costs of servicing, campaign cost of sale insights, impact of digital
channels on customer retention and satisfaction, digital channels usage impacts
on customer lifetime value and digital enhancement impacts to overall net
promoter score.rollout of the digital experience and insights
centre of excellence operating model with a high priority placed on operating
efficiencies and processes that will enable the quick turnaround of
deliverables, real time / ad hoc insights, and synergies between other digital
channels teams.push the status quo to dive deeper into
understanding the digital client journey, connecting external traffic drivers,
benchmarks, and other relevant client experience insights to build a cohesive
story and actionable recommendation from data.provide post analysis support for digital sales,
strategy, cibc.com, online banking and mobile banking related initiatives. partner with channel strategy to support proof of
concept assessments involving cross selling from digital and identifying interrelationships
between digital and all major cibc distribution channels.create executive level insights as single point of
contact for use in business case development, revenue forecasting, modelling
and presenting findings at an overall committee level.develop and maintain relationships with key vendors
to investigate leading edge analytical tools, methodologies, and to keep
abreast of best practices across the banking and other sales industries.monitor the performance of digital
channel strategies, policies, programs, to ensure the fulfillment of strategic
objectives. recommend changes to
programs, products or services, or channel offerings as needed.provide authoritative analysis,
interpretation and opinion to support and guide executive management and teams,
ensuring an understanding and acceptance of issues and influence the direction
and nature of programs including digital user experience, digital strategy,
digital optimization, digital sales, and lines of business.at the executive level of the
organization, promote the strategic concepts, analytical tools and
deliverables, and other services provided by the digital experience and insights
team.  support sales, strategy and
partner peers with relevant insights related to adopting the new approaches to
doing business, new digital channel technologies, or new products or channel
enhancements.prepare and present reports on
significant trends impacting digital banking, including client, competitive,
regulatory, and technological or data developments.develop and support high-level
recommendations, approaches and solution for input into cibc overall digital
strategy.drive sales through strategic
project insights and new capabilities eg) implementation on how to complete
e-deposit  what we’re looking for
ability to conduct detailed
     analysis, incorporating comprehensive mathematical, statistical and
     analytical methods, models and guidelines. 
comprehensive knowledge of analysis
     sufficient to interpret and analyze complex concepts and apply these in
     innovative ways.
advanced communication skills
     sufficient to creatively and precisely articulate ideas and opinions that
     involve analysis, interpretation and assessment. 
knowledge and user capability
     of test & learn software.
comprehensive knowledge of
     financial services industry and a solid understanding of cibc distribution
     channels. 
ability to build and retain a
     highly skilled experience and insights team.
deep experience in digital strategy
     development, market/competitive and customer research and analytics;
     relevant strategy experience in product/distribution management
developed knowledge of cibc and
     retail banking industry including products, services and channels.
developed understanding of
     retail financial services distribution, including the challenges
     associated with a complex, multi-channel sales and service environment,
     from a customer and organizational perspective. 
ability to define and make
     recommendations on multi-year strategic business priorities by assessing
     implications of industry-level trends, competitive and internal business
     dynamics, and the evolution of customer needs, preferences and behaviours.
experience and understanding of
     process and technology issues and the impact on customer experience.
proven analytic and problem
     solving skills, including the ability to develop creative, logical and
     practical analytic frameworks; ability to define, assess and prioritize a
     broad portfolio of strategic initiatives. 
demonstrated business judgment
     and ability to prioritize actions or focus, particularly when faced with
     significant complexity or ambiguity. 
proficiency with adobe
     marketing cloud, google analytics, sql, ios, android and various other
     industry leading digital sdk’s and technologies is an asset. 
what cibc can offer you

flexible health benefits, stock purchase plan, competitive incentive pay and recognition programs

competitive salary and banking benefits 

career growth, development and continuous learning opportunities

opportunity to be involved in cibc events that help our communities

click to learn more about rewards & recognition, learning & development, and employee community involvement

must be legally eligible to work in canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role#li-al1

manager, operations strategy

company information


solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. that's travelers. our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. you will find travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

job summary

under general supervision, the manager of operations strategy will be responsible for successfully executing approved change initiatives within operations. this position would be responsible for all aspects of change management for projects that originate from or impact operations, including business readiness, planning and communication.this job is a manager: responsible for setting work objectives and goals for employees and managing their performance. typically involved in compensation decisions. employees have a formal reporting relationship to this job. this job works under general direction: establishes procedures for attaining specific goals and objectives in a broad area of work.


primary location

oakville - ontario - canada 


job category

project/operations management 


position type

experienced/professional 


target openings

1


primary job duties & responsibilities

evolve the function of change management within operations to be a leading area that is tightly aligned to the business.gain a detailed understanding of all inflight programs, projects and initiatives to appropriately manage the impact to different areas within operations.identify impediments to effective and efficient operational performance; introduce change in business operational processes and organizational behaviours within operations that have a positive impact on bottom line results.develop robust business intelligence reporting for service and underwriting operationspartner with business teams and owners to make data driven decisionsdetermine appropriate business capabilities needed to achieve a best in class experience and efficiencyestablish data driven benefit and proforma analyses to adequately assess business value of change initiativedefine business architecture of different capabilities and create a road map of activities for improvement investmentsdrive cost-benefit discussions around hard and soft benefit realization and trackingliaise with enterprise workforce analytics group (wag) to manage and evolve work force capacity models to align to business objectivesdevelop a strategic relationship with product management organizations to appropriately deliver necessary adjustments in our operations to meet business objective.provide expert feedback and impact analysis to business partners to help quantify total cost of ownership of changes to our operations.collaborate with business partners to implement recommendations.leverage lean six-sigma techniques to increase efficiency and effectives of operations unit.other duties as assigned.


minimum qualifications

5 years operational effectiveness experience


education, work experience & knowledge

bachelor's degreeprevious management experience considered an assetthorough knowledge or experience with project management processes and methodologythorough knowledge or experience with competitive analytics tools, including how to extract and analyze datageneral knowledge of insurance profitability, risk loads and other ratemaking conceptsgeneral knowledge of insurance operations - products and systemsgeneral knowledge of business analytics, finance or accounting and insurance fundamentals


job specific & technical skills & competencies

advanced organizational and time management skills' advanced oral and written communication skills intermediate ability to interact and manage in a highly matrixed organization intermediate use of excel, access, power point and word


licensing or certificates

green belt six sigma certification


equal employment opportunity statement

travelers is an equal opportunity employer.we are committed to providing accommodation to persons with disabilities.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment or interview process we will work with you to accommodate your needs.

title: Analytics & Insights Manager
text:
job description - analytics & insights manager (0088613)go to the main content section.careers at loyaltyonelearn more about our opportunitieslife at loyaltyoneour teamswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - analytics & insights manager (0088613)job description analytics & insights manager - (0088613) about the analytics & insights group
 
the analytic & insights group at the air miles® reward program provides world class analytical solutions through the delivery of insights that enable our clients to build stronger mutually-beneficial relationships with their customers. the group works directly with the sponsors of the program as well as internal business managers to ensure the successful partnering with our clients.
 
why work with us?
 
the manager will play a key role in supporting the development of customer-centric business and loyalty marketing strategies by delivering world class analytical solutions.  the successful candidate will lead a team of analysts and provide expertise in the application and execution of consumer data and analytics within a retail industry context. this role enables sponsors to build stronger, mutually-beneficial relationships with their customers. as a critical member of the sponsor account team, the incumbent of this role will offer expertise to link analyses and results to the business issues and analytical objectives.\
 
what will you be doing?
 

plan the analytical workload, ensuring that work is completed, insights and case studies are created, and relevant information is communicated to the sponsor team
support the client lead to define metrics and success criteria for program impact
develop and interpret analytical methods (from bi reporting to advanced modeling) in support of retail business objectives
support customer and sponsor strategies/segmentation by creating and leveraging analytics and underlying trends, providing input into developing the data plan to support the strategies
develop an ongoing analytic plan for sponsor, planning timetable and communicating deliverables for key stakeholders
execute quarterly forecasting and monthly variance analyses based on inputs from internal stakeholders, ensuring completion and accuracy and provide explanation of variances as required
accountable for ensuring that the campaign occurs as planned ensuring budget constraints are being considered against the financial forecast.
develop measurement plan and key metrics based on campaign scope as outlined by the client marketing manager and ensure the campaign objectives link back to overall sponsor objective
provide historical/trend insight to facilitate the proper planning of individual sponsor marketing calendars and provide input and recommendations into campaign targeting and campaign design
demonstrate analytics thought leadership, guidance, and representation across loyaltyone and participate in business development initiatives  what will you bring?


bachelor’s degree in any of the following (or combination of): statistics, economics, computer science, engineering, applied math, math

minimum of 8-10 years of directly-related work experience in managing analysis and insight delivery

minimum of 5 years of supervisory/management experience

technical skills - experience with excel, access, sas, sql, r, relational databases, data warehouses, analytics systems (e.g. microstrategy); strong analytical & data mining skills; intermediate predictive modeling / machine learning experience; experience with both qualitative and quantitative consumer research techniques

business skills - strong understanding of retailing - merchandising and direct marketing (market research, experimental design); interpret research, extracting insights, linking to strategies, and communicating a compelling summary of findings and drive results, client communication and presentation.

about loyaltyone

loyaltyone is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics, and loyalty services for fortune 1000 clients around the world. loyaltyone has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. these include the air miles reward program, north america's premier coalition loyalty program, precima, the global retail strategy and analytics arm, loyaltyone consulting, european-based brandloyalty, and latin america's leading coalition program, dotz. loyaltyone is an alliance data company. www.loyalty.com 

about ads

alliance data® (nyse: ads) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. the company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. alliance data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. an s&p 500 and fortune 500 company headquartered in plano, texas, alliance data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com 

employment opportunity employer. accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.

job overview 

cibc’s digital insights boasts a unique experience within the
bank. positioned within cibc’s digital team, and with a startup-like

not just within our walls but canadian banking as well. for examples of current
digital banking solutions, please visit our website. reporting into the director of digital insights, the senior
manager is a high-impact role on a growing team. the senior manager is
accountable for overseeing a variety of projects and working closely with our
development teams, and for fostering an environment of collaboration,
problem-solving, knowledge-sharing and insight generation.  this
individual is responsible for delivering actionable insights that support

company information


solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. that's travelers. our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. you will find travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

job summary

under general supervision, explore and profile data, draw business inferences, complete analysis and clearly articulate findings for a target audience.  this position is accountable for performing less complex core tasks of descriptive analytics (the exploration and investigation of past business performance), and partnering with team members on more complex tasks.this job does not manage staff.

job specific & technical skills & competencies

demonstrated intermediate analytic and diagnostic skills.demonstrated intermediate interpersonal skills.demonstrated intermediate communication skills.intermediate problem solving and decision making skills.ability to work independently and as part of a team.intermediate project management skills.desire to see tasks to completion.intermediate computer skills in excel and basic skills in database programming language and/or related applications. working understanding of the business functions of businesses supported.


preferred qualifications

bachelors degree in stem (science, technology, engineering, mathematics) preferred.2+ years of analytics or related experience preferred.2+ years working successfully with microsoft office products or similar products preferred.working knowledge of analytic concepts.  experience with descriptive analytic practices and processes.general business knowledge preferred.working knowledge of insurance products/concepts preferred.experience working on teams.working knowledge of the main features of the collection of data and the relationship of data elements to each other.working knowledge:  understands basic principles and terminology in order to understand and solve simple problems).


licensing or certificates

none required.

thescore, inc. is an independent creator of mobile-first sports experiences, connecting fans to the sports content they love through an addictive combination of comprehensive and personalized real-time news, scores, stats, alerts and videos via emerging and established digital media platforms, including its mobile sports applications thescore and thescore esports, its web platforms thescore.com and thescoreesports.com and thescore bot for facebook messenger and amazon alexa.
typical work day at thescore:

support marketing & growth efforts across the company’s three products, with an emphasis on its flagship app – thescore.
assist marketing initiatives including seo, aso, house ad executions, email newsletters and push campaigns.
design creative assets/ad units and compose copy.
create and manage marketing lists and partner-tracking docs.
track and identify news trends and media opportunities relevant to thescore.
assist in monitoring of data and performance of strategies and tactics, including compiling reports on user acquisition, retention and channel metrics.
partner identification and research; finding and investigating non-obvious partners for bd or ua (via app annie, trade publications, etc.).
day to day collaboration with the marketing team & the product growth team.
other duties as required.

requirements:

1-3 years of experience in a marketing role.
university degree in marketing preferred.
knowledge of digital marketing channels and growth tactics (a/b testing, running app install campaigns, building marketing funnels, implementing marketing partnerships, managing e-mail newsletter and push notification campaigns).
strong experience with design tools such as adobe photoshop.
proficient at excel.
excellent written and oral communications skills.
adept at managing relationships with both internal constituents and external partners.
experience with social channels including facebook, twitter, instagram and pinterest, and an understanding for what makes good social content.
comprehension of mobile analytics and marketing tools a plus (such as: google analytics, mailchimp, facebook analytics, twitter analytics, appsflyer, branch or other attribution solutions).
ability to work in a nimble and fast paced team environment.
passion and excitement for solving marketing challenges.

what we offer:

competitive salary with employee share purchase plan
comprehensive benefits package
fun, relaxed work environment
located downtown toronto; easily accessible by public transit
snacks and drinks provided
awesome patio with bbq
games room (bring your a game for our fifa 18, arcade, ping pong and foosball tournaments!)

we are an equal opportunity employer. accommodation will be made upon request.

entry-level consultant - consulting by degrees - 2018 intake - toronto






105231br


job description


 we live in an incredible time of transformation for business, society and the workplace. ibm global business services (gbs) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. with global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, ibm gbs empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries. ibm global business services (gbs) canada is now hiring entry-level consultants for the 2018 intake of the consulting by degrees program. ibm consulting by degrees (cbd) is our world class program designed to groom top, entry level consultants into tomorrow’s leaders. by providing a variety of project and role experiences, and deep skills development opportunities, our consultants are prepared to launch and accelerate their careers successfully. the cbd program seeks the best and brightest from all walks of life –from business to engineering; communications to computer science; analytics to application development and everything in between.  for more information on the consulting by degrees program, please visit our cbd program page athttp://www-935.ibm.com/services/ca/en/gbs/consulting/careers/cbd/opportunities/service lines and teams that we are currently recruiting for include:  digital strategy and interactive:you will address customer needs by designing world-class digital customer experiences; create user experience designs and prototypes. mobile development: candidates interested in mobile development roles must have experience with ios, android, hybrid and blackberry mobile applications and platforms, along with development methodologies such as agile. desired experience also include exposure to mobile web technologies (html5, javascript, css3) and hybrid technologies such as worklight, apache cordova etc. ui/ux designers: candidates interested in user experience designers/information architects roles need to have experience with css, adobe creative suite, axure, typography, human factors, agile design and development methodology and processes.cognitive process transformation: cognitive business decision support: supporting decision making that drives business value using advanced analytics, cognitive technology, industry/domain specific expertise and data. candidates interested in this role must have a strong interest in technology, analytics, big data, cloud, mobile, social and how that technology intersects with business and strategy. education includes math, statistics or an analytics or data science degree is strongly preferred. cognitive process services: outsourced functional process services using cognitive technologies to help clients speed up their transformation and deliver faster financial benefits. candidates interested in this area must have a strong financial or talent & engagement background/education. cognitive process re-engineering: core process transformation consulting services to help clients realize their strategic transformation objectives using digitization, automation and cognition. cloud application innovations: next-gen ea and mobile:  will cover all cloud, cognitive, industry, on-premise and mobile offerings and solutions for sap (s/4hana, hana analytics, hybris, successfactors, ariba, concur), oracle (erp cloud, hcm cloud, jde cloud, cx), microsoft (ax, dynamics crm, office 365, sharepoint) and workday (hcm cloud and finance cloud), as well as mobile at-scale offerings and solutions. candidates interested in this role are expected to be fully functional with all aspects of ms technology experience (office 365, visual studio and azure) or have some exposure to sap and crm systems. in addition to the technical requirements, we look for the following in an ibm gbs entry-level consultant:a technical degree in computer science or related field – for design roles, you must be able to showcase your portfolio. demonstrated leadership and adaptability with the willingness to readily and voluntarily take ownership of highly challenging tasks and problems, even beyond initial scope of responsibility.a thorough and analytical approach with the capability to apply logic to solve problems.ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines while maintaining focus despite conflicting demands.drive to overcome the most challenging or difficult obstacles and look for ways to improve results.initiative to actively seek new knowledge and improve skills.effective interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate and work effectively with individuals, strengthening relationships to achieve win-win solutions.ability to communicate complex situations clearly and simply by listening actively and conveying difficult messages in a positive manner.ability to write effectively, communicating complex messages or requirements clearly, simply, and concisely.a passion for innovative ideas, coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of view.additional criteria:must be able to travel extensively.french language proficiency is an absolute requirement for roles in quebec. a valid driver's permit is required for this role. this role will involve working with technology that is covered by embargo export regulations.  if you are a foreign national from any of the following embargoed countries (cuba, iran, north korea, sudan, and syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.

date: 
sep 20, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 176470 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with a 137 year track record of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
an integral part of our customer service focus, includes contact centres across canada supporting all of our bell mobility and bell residential services customers. our  customer operations team is responsible for strategy, design and delivery of core call centre tools and processes, including queue strategy, routing, and call monitoring tools.
 
are you passionate about leveraging big data analysis to enhance the customer experience?
do you want to be part of the team that designs and implements solutions to major customer issues?
are you able to handle multiple demands at once by prioritizing effectively?
 
if you answered an enthusiastic “yes” to the above, then you may be the person we’re looking for to join our team!  if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we would love to discuss our opportunity with you.
 
the role:
as a member of the arpu advocacy group you will develop a deep understanding of different customer interactions and the drivers of negative business impacts including service cancellations, repeat callers and service credits. from there you will leverage this understanding to drive tangible ebitda business benefits by defining, sizing and building the case for initiatives to improve customer experience.  this role entails end to end involvement in problem definition and analysis, solution design, implementation and monitoring involving heavy collaboration with other teams.
 
our ultimate goal is to understand the true value of our customers and their drivers of satisfaction.  we have both the infrastructure and the appetite around data and analytics; we just need the experience and talent to leverage it!
 
responsibilities of the role:
analysis and modeling

working with large data volumes efficiently using sas and teradata to develop a deep understanding of customer behaviour and quantify specific pain points
design solutions and model expected outcomes, individual metrics and overall profitability
provide analytical insight to answer questions from executives and other teams
end-to-end ownership of projects from data analysis and modeling to strategy design and project implementation

collaboration

engage with cross functional stakeholders to socialize issues, develop strategies, drive the case for change and implement solutions
build and deliver material to gain support and drive action among stakeholder groups, including the executive team

 
preferred competencies:

financial or statistical modeling experience.
ability to manage projects end-to-end
professional manner as this role has a high degree of executive exposure
curious and passionate about learning new skills and techniques
strong business acumen
ability to negotiate and influence others
interest in building impactful presentations and delivering them to different audiences
experience in sas or sql is an asset

#li-nd1
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : toronto
application deadline: 2016-10-04
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role.  applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

title: Portfolio Administrator
text: portfolio administrator job - mcmahon keast capital management - vancouver, bc | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province portfolio administrator mcmahon keast capital management - vancouver, bc are you a natural-born riddle master who is enthusiastic and successful at problem-solving? do you work on brain teasers in your spare time? would you thrive in an environment that requires you to implement tactical investment decisions while taking into consideration a multitude of variables with varying degrees of complexities? would you enjoy spending your time discussing financial markets, investment strategies, and portfolio asset allocation without the sales responsibility?if so, then this is the opportunity for you! mcmahon keast capital management is looking for a highly effective, multi-task oriented professional to join their team as portfolio administrator. as a full-time member of the team, you will under the direction of the portfolio managers, execute on investment decisions with specific parameters while demonstrating a meticulous attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy.in this role, you will be primarily responsible for:rebalance portfolios in croesus with the objective of returning optimal portfolio results in the most efficient and cost effective manner;consider multi-criteria factors such as cash flow management, tax-efficient assets allocation, fixed income laddering, and corporate action events for optimal portfolio rebalancing;create scenarios and analyze rebalancing results to identify and correct erroneous outcomes. define rule-based strategies to effectively create a scalable rebalancing process;monitor positions based on client’s investment policy statement (“ips”). resolve variances between asset classes and selected target ranges;prepare trade blotters and perform trade reconciliations within trading hours;facilitate foreign exchange transactions;manage client cash flow and execute trades based on the ips;provide compliance support by proactively minimizing inquiries and responding to requests as required;manage the croesus database, ensuring client information, logs, and document attachments are accurate and up to date;assist portfolio management in conducting research;complete tasks and activities assigned through pareto crm, andaccept new challenges and responsibilities as they arise.to be successful in this role, you must demonstrate:strong ability to solve complex problems using analytics and sound judgement;detail-orientated approach to all aspects of the role;perform all responsibilities with a high degree of accuracy;self-starter while working with minimal supervision;excellent communication and interpersonal skills;team player in a supportive and progressive environment;solid understanding of tax-efficient investing across various type of accounts;comprehensive knowledge of financial markets and products including equities, fixed income products, mutual funds, etfs, and derivatives;5+ years industry experience or an equivalent combination of experience and education;advanced proficiency with croesus and microsoft office is a must;software experience using national bank correspondent network’s suite of systems, bloomberg terminal, and pareto crm are definite assets, andbe an early riser to begin trading at the start of market hours (6:30 am pst).about mcmahon keast to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior business analyst (pla03269-17)job description senior business analyst - pla03269-17description position overview:   the predictive analytics and customer excellence (pace) team in partner solutions is looking for a champion to focus on delivering business critical data and analysis, drive continuous business improvement, and achieve best in class customer experience. the pace team is responsible for driving strategic programs to transform our customer experience and bolster our customer and market intelligence in partner solutions. as a senior business analyst with the pace team you will be a key contributor supporting partner solutions’ strategic vision of “bringing a world of possibilities to our customers and the best of telus to the connected world”, and directly driving our strategic imperative of “self-serve leadership”.   your role will be to identify, develop, and present key analysis and analytic tools used for critical decision making in strategic programs across partner solutions.   if you’re looking for a collaborative, high performance, and customer focused culture, come join our team.   what you will do:  assist in cultivating a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling/analytical process to gain operational efficiency build complex models using statistical or operational research tools and techniques focused on providing clarity to complex business issues and situations conceptualize and present key drivers and relationships between data sets to support strategic business decisions act as a data and key performance indicator (kpi) consultant to the business, ensuring high quality of repeatability and reproducibility of system and process data lead strategic complex end to end team project efforts and develop tactics and timelines to address specific project objectives to ensure customer needs are met synthesize analytical and modeling findings/insights, and ensure it is clearly communicated to stakeholders in business context in order to be able to solve customer/business issues and objective maintain a strong understanding of partner solutions applications, products and services, organizational delivery capabilities, and telus end-to-end processes work collaboratively with leadership team within tps to ensure a cohesive aligned approach work with supporting counter-parts in other parts of telus to ensure interlock; areas include customer care, customer marketing, sales, operations, it, technology strategy, business transformations & optimization and regulatory among others develop and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with cross-functional leadership teams and act as a trusted advisor to business unit stakeholders work collaboratively with external vendors on solution requirements where required support a number of business critical operational activities continue to enhance our business, customer and market intelligence and drive actionable insights for our sales, marketing and care teams manage and maintain buy side tools and data visualization tools mentor, coach and provide expert guidance to team members qualifications what you bring:  ability to proactively hypothesize and perform data analysis to enable business problem resolution advanced data management skills to transform raw data into meaningful business information strong business and financial acumen combined with an innovative and process improvement mindset ability to quickly and thoroughly understand business priorities and operations strong interpersonal skills with the ability to foster good cross-functional working relationships with peers and business partners at multiple organizational levels ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical teams ability to influence others in presenting ideas and concepts; excellent written and communication skills with the ability to present information at all levels of the organization experience dealing/communicating effectively with leaders across different levels experience building effective working relationships with internal/external partners demonstrated ability to work independently with a strong track record of high performance capacity to take initiative and ownership of issues and tasks through to resolution technological interest/curiosity would be an asset to help the team test/learn how to use latest tools available (e.g. mapping tools, dashboard tools, etc.) thoroughly analyze challenges, thoughtfully formulate action plans, and diligently perform tasks knowledge of operational readiness, assure and fulfillment, and reporting and analytics advanced knowledge in applications, systems and processes used by the partner solutions team would be an asset excellent working knowledge of microsoft office applications (ms excel, ms word, visio, ms powerpoint) use of data mining and presentation tools such as data flux/alteryx, tableau, sql considered strong assets ability to deal with ambiguity and complex issues and concepts ability to react quickly and take advantage of changing business conditions a minimum of 3 years of related predictive modeling/statistical experience university degree and/or equivalent combination of experience and education experience working in the telecom or any related industries would be considered an asset  role can be based in: toronto, vancouver calgary or montreal.   who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoother date: 
sep 18, 2017
                


location: 
mississauga, on, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 177196 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with over 137 years of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
 
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.  
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
 
the bell residential services team is in the business of enabling customers to connect with people, information and entertainment by delivering integrated products and service experience for consumers while enhancing our competitiveness in the marketplace.  the team provides customers with bell home phone, local and long distance services, bell internet, bell satellite tv and amazing new technologies such as bell fibe tv.
 
the bell residential & small business team is enabling small businesses to connect with their customers, and helping them do more and make more. bell’s best network technology brings powerful internet performance & phone services with maximum reliability straight to the small business.   
 
the pricing and strategy team is responsible for driving core pricing and the full suite of competitive offers for the bell small business services portfolio (tv, internet and phone).  in addition, the team is responsible for monitoring and analyzing the competitive pricing landscape for the canadian telecom market and ensuring the brsb team is well informed on all competitive developments.
the team is currently seeking a highly motivated, analytical and self-driven individual to join the team.  in the role, the brsb pricing strategy specialist will be the subject matter expert on a diverse range of pricing initiatives.  this individual will utilize their strategic and financial acumen to help identify, define, and explore pricing opportunities for the brsb team.  the successful candidate will need to work across several different cross functional teams (i.e. marketing, finance, sales, operations and product), as such, strong communication skills, and the ability to influence will be essential.
 
job duties/accountabilities: 
reporting to the senior manager of brsb pricing, the successful candidate will be responsible for:

problem identification, opportunity assessment, proposal development, business case development, and presentation delivery
structure development of strategic, transformational, and business process improvement plans
apply database knowledge and perform data and business analysis to support various business priorities, including business cases, cost/benefit analysis, process optimization & pricing strategies
 influence decisions and provide key insights to internal partners and cross functional teams based on customer analytics and a thorough understanding of both services and customer profile
develop effective pricing strategies through the understanding of key drivers that affect profitability
proven analytical skills and ability to uncover information in big data
relationship building with external departments, working collaboratively in a team environment with colleagues and senior leadership
presentation of strategic plans at the senior leadership level

 
critical qualifications/competencies:

experience in a marketing / pricing strategy role                                
experience with financial models and analysis
organization, coordination and strong time management skills to handle multiple demands in a fast-paced environment
 highly motivated, energetic, and a has a winning mind-set
ability to manage tolerance to ambiguity, flexibility, and deal effectively with adversity
excellent communication and presentation skills (written and verbal)
proficiency in ms office applications (excel, powerpoint, word and outlook)
results-driven attitude with the ability to grasp and communicate complex ideas clearly

 
preferred qualifications/competencies:

graduate  degree – business/commerce or pricing analytics background
5 years experience in a core business analytics role

 
#li-kr1
 
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : don mills || canada : ontario : mississauga
application deadline: 10/13/2017
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role. applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

title: VP, Business Strategy
text:
vp, business strategy | huge toronto, ca






























work.
about.
careers.
ideas.

contact.





vp, business strategy
strategy, toronto, ca





our vp, business strategy partners closely with clients to develop, guide, and implement the strategy group’s digital business strategies. they collaborate with creative, ux and tech departments to define the right approach for our clients’ digital businesses. they work to grow new and existing relationships by working closely with business development to assess client business models and identify new revenue opportunities within the context of brand, market, user, financial, and technology constraints. the strategy group has a broad focus, from developing long-term holistic business plans to creating website monetization, social media, or mobile strategies (and everything in between).
the vp, business strategy is a thought leader, and is passionately dedicated to growing our domain expertise and knowledge base through the development of first party research. they define new organizational structures and business processes in addition to working closely with our client services team to help grow large accounts and participating in pitches. they spend significant time onsite with clients to gain deep insight into client business needs, becoming trusted partners and advisors to senior client executives.
what we’d like to see:

must have experience within a management consultancy
strong experience consulting in business transformation and business plans
experience in developing revenue models and forecasts in excel as well as working with analytics platforms such as omniture or double click.
excellent public speaking and presentation skills in client facing and high-pressure situations.
demonstrated experience communicating broad strategic initiatives to both key stakeholders and diverse internal teams.
ability to simultaneously tackle multiple projects and challenges with enthusiasm.
passion to rapidly build expertise on new businesses and industry verticals.

 
huge is an equal opportunity employer (eoe).  we strongly support diversity in the workforce.  we are committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and work environment.  if you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodation needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process.  any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: Data Scientist
text:
407 etr | career



skip to content






























search





































career opportunities







data scientist


location:
headquarters


job code:
504


# of openings:
2



description
position summary:
the successful candidate will assist in leveraging customer, digital and transportation datasets to create insights on pricing, marketing and customer behavior. the data scientist will assist the director of data analytics and other key stakeholders to bring actionable data driven solutions to 407etr. this job involves model design, data management, data queries, and providing input into programs and policies. this position is part of a highly collaborative and energetic team in a start-up minded environment.
position responsibility:

assemble and analyze data to understand customer behavior from existing 407 etr data, external data sources and emerging sources.


undertake analysis of target customer groups (segments) for specific marketing and pricing programs and assess opportunities and strategies for marketing.
ad hoc analysis and modeling of data.
ability to understand business stakeholder’s issues and create valuable insight.
raise awareness and action of data science within the company to help focus on fact based decisions.
support the department along with the information technology management department in planning the structure and storage of new customer related data fields.
represent the department in committees within the organization.

qualifications:

a university degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics, or computer science.


minimum 5 years working experience with data science techniques: clustering, regression models, classification, anomaly detection and other machine learning techniques.
minimum 5 years of experience with data analysis tools (eg. sas, r or python) and bi visualization for reporting.
well-developed business analysis, research and creative problem solving skills.
organizational skills and time management skills; planning and project management, and ability to meet multiple deadlines.
strong communication skills and work ethic.
highly collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit.
familiarity with microstrategy is an asset.

note: this job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
accommodations for disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process.

title: Manager, Analytics
text:
job description - manager, analytics (0089604)go to the main content section.careers at loyaltyonelearn more about our opportunitieslife at loyaltyoneour teamswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - manager, analytics (0089604)job description manager, analytics - (0089604) the opportunity

as the analytics manager on the global solutions team, you will lead the delivery of effective, timely and best in class initiatives and consulting engagements globally. we are looking for someone who is a self-starter, comfortable working cross-functionally in partnership with all stakeholders, and an outstanding analytic storyteller. you’ll be detail-oriented and results driven to achieve the organization’s vision for analytics capabilities. 
 
you will be partnering with the consulting, data science, product development and technology teams, to identify and deliver actionable insights. you will collaboratively support client financial goals, partner, member, and campaign measurement, as well as cost optimization.
 
this is an opportunity to innovate, deepen our existing client relationships, and help establish loyaltyone as a leader in this space.
 
what you’ll do

lead and manage advanced data analysis to identify and deliver actionable insights (key driver analysis, churn analysis, customer segmentation)
lead and execute data extraction, transformation and mapping activities
design the analytics plan for engagements, including data requirements and methodology 
provide thought leadership and coaching to a team of quantitative specialists in the delivery of data insight, development of complex analytical and statistical models, optimization of campaign execution and measurement to achieve financial performance targets
build insight and provide interpretation of results linking analytical perspective to objectives and identify new or innovative paths to accomplish or exceed goals
work with the client to establish operational processes for analytics execution that ensures appropriate safeguards for data
generate and support content focused on analytics thought leadership for external publication
participate in business development pitches by sharing thought leadership & advanced analytical solutions that solve customer problems
manage the process for standardization of the analytics methodologies and tools and automation  who you are


strong business acumen and understanding of direct marketing, interpreting research, extracting insights and communicating a compelling summary of findings to drive results

solid understanding of the retail industry and how consumer information and analytics is leveraged to generate revenue and financial modeling

a collaborative leader who has a keen interest in developing others

an excellent problem solver with an eye to future opportunities

ability to manage and thrive in a matrix organization and effectively communicate with all audiences 
what you have 

bachelor’s degree in statistics, economics, computer science, applied math or math
master’s degree is required (preferred programs include management/business analytics, operations research)    
minimum of 3-5 years of directly related work experience in managing analysis and insight delivery
minimum of 1 year of supervisory/management experience 
advanced skills in excel and powerpoint 
proficent in sas, visualization tools (qlick, tableau, microstrategy), r, python, sql
proficiency with spark, scala and alteryx. experience with aws and cloud deployments is preferred 
about loyaltyone

loyaltyone is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics, and loyalty services for fortune 1000 clients around the world. loyaltyone has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. these include the air miles reward program, north america's premier coalition loyalty program, precima, the global retail strategy and analytics arm, loyaltyone consulting, european-based brandloyalty, and latin america's leading coalition program, dotz. loyaltyone is an alliance data company. www.loyalty.com 
 
about ads
 
alliance data® (nyse: ads) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. the company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. alliance data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. an s&p 500 and fortune 500 company headquartered in plano, texas, alliance data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com 
 
employment opportunity employer. accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.
