date: 
sep 29, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca, m4w 1g9


at rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, rogers is the place where ideas become reality. we embrace change, and find ways to do better. and we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.
 
the sr. analyst, resi base analytics will be accountable for supporting and evolving analytics, and sharing insights to support the overall residential customer lifecycle strategy, with the goal of improving growth and customer satisfaction. this includes defining and implementing necessary data query techniques for performance reporting, analyzing and summarizing data, and providing insights to improve revenue growth and customer retention. the successful candidate will be highly strategic, command the business acumen to understand how to move the business forward, and have the analytical skills to bring ideas to life.
 
what you will be doing: 
 

analyze customer-based data, to determine for opportunities and gaps for revenue growth activity
develop and make recommendations for revenue growth strategies that meet customer, revenue, cost and profitability targets.
translate business issues into analytical requirements; prepare presentations to communicate findings to management
assess the current data and reporting environment and recommend design and implement improvements to create more efficient processes
work with cross functional teams (e.g. finance, marketing, care, and channels) on business case development for base management programs
present to senior management of customer base management, in addition to the rogers senior leadership team when required

 
what you bring:
 

undergraduate degree. masters degree is considered an asset.
must have 5+ years of experience in analytic roles demonstrating an ability to derive actionable insights. knowledge of telecom industry is a plus.
excellent computer and programming skills with advanced knowledge of sas and sql, relational databases and ms office suite
practical experience in manipulating large datasets and working effectively with different data sources
proficient in statistics and business/financial analysis
solid organizational skills, with attention to detail and the ability to be flexible and adaptable to a changing environment to provide results
good work ethic, with the ability to work both independently and with teams
excellent oral, written and presentation skills

 
schedule: full time
shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 333 bloor street east (012), toronto, on 
travel requirements: up to 10%
posting category/function: marketing & marketing research / analysis
requisition id: 109526
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers?  because your tomorrow inspires our today.
 
what makes us different makes us stronger. rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. everyone who applies for a job will be considered.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

title: 
                        
sr. manager, global hiring & onboarding experience
                        









 

requisition id: 8225
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
reporting to the vp, global recruitment, this leadership role is accountable for the development and execution of an awesome candidate hiring experience.  this role identifies potential tools/solutions to enhance an efficient recruitment process, works with program owners to make changes to the existing process and supports the roll-out of a new global recruitment platform to over 50 countries.  additionally, this role measures and reports on the overall effectiveness of the hiring process.
 
this role leads a team of recruitment professionals that are passionate about delivering an excellent experience to all stakeholders in the hiring process.  we have an award winning hiring process and we are looking to make it even better.
 
accountabilities:

develop a global candidate experience strategy; identifying moments of truth, gaps in current process and opportunities for improvement
lead the continuous improvement of a new global hiring process that is currently being implemented across 50+ countries; driving maximum efficiency.
partner with the recruitment technology lead on ongoing global roll-out of successfactors recruitment ensuring alignment of new process and tools to the candidate experience strategy.
identify, develop and implement tool solutions that will continue to enhance the hiring experience for candidates and hiring managers.
optimize current recruitment tools and relationships with third parties to improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the hiring process.
lead the development of key metrics to measure the success and efficiency of the new candidate hiring and onboarding experience including leading our candee award initiative.
develop ongoing relationships with global recruitment teams, hr services and other relevant parties to execute processes and maintain recruitment technologies and tools
ensure recruitment processes, policies and tools are aligned with the overall talent strategy and in compliance with regulatory requirements.
provide thought leadership on all aspects of recruitment operations to drive effective usage of tools and program delivery.  recommending innovative and progressive solutions to enhance overall experience.
build a high performing and inclusive team; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

 
required skills and experience

demonstrated thought-leadership in the identification, development and implementation of leading edge recruitment solutions and tools for a global organization.


deep subject matter and technical recruitment expertise to support a global recruitment team, business hr and other internal stakeholders globally.
strong people leader that is excellent at setting goals, providing feedback and coaching a high performing team.
ability to leverage data from multiple sources to analyze and understand business trends as well as use analytics and insights to influence change.
strong skills in research, writing, editing and project management
fluent spanish, french ideal, but not essential

 
education / experience / other information 

post-secondary degree in human resources or business or related field
3-5 year of previous experience in a global recruitment team required 
demonstrated expertise of global recruitment processes and programs
excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
strong change management and influencing skills
ability to understand organizational needs and develop solutions
ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences

location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

data analyst | inliv

share this job:





data analyst

company:
        inliv
      

location:
      calgary, ab
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
as the data analyst at inliv inc., you will work closely with the chief data officer to build our business intelligence platform.  you will be responsible for managing all aspects of inliv's data including inputting, integrity, integration, manipulation, analytics and reporting.
you will perform impact assessments related to technology choices, design / architectural considerations and implementation strategy and provide recommendations
the data analytics team will support the leadership team to create innovative data and analytics driven solutions.
your day-to-day will include:

acquire, transform and analyze data from multiple sources ensuring data quality
responsible for defining, developing, and evolving data science related tasks using the latest development methods and infrastructure
participate in normal analytics development activities like design, implementation, reviews, defect management, document handling, etc.
support impact assessments and decisions related to technology choices, design /architectural considerations and implementation strategy
collaborate with system engineers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with our stakeholder’s and our own strategic directions
lead the design and creation of appropriate reporting and dashboarding for use by individual departments as well as company leadership
partner with the marketing, sales and operations teams to deliver data insights, identify trends and opportunities, make suggestions for improvement and answer business questions
influence business decision making through data-based recommendations
prepare ad-hoc analysis in the support of specific initiatives as required

qualifications:

4-6 years of experience in data analytics and business reporting
bachelor degree in computer science, math, physics, applied economics or statistics
demonstrated ability to communicate in a way that is easy to understand by all stakeholders both verbally and written
proficiency with python, r, sql and tableau for data visualization
demonstrated etl skills/experience (extract, transform, load)
ability to grasp the essence of large data sets and can use and create analytical and/or statistical methods to find solutions
an eagerness to roll up your sleeves, dig deep and get the work done
experience building dashboards in common visualization tools
prior experience of working with cross functional teams
competent programming attitude with good computation and data mining skills
technical expertise, domain knowledge, experience in statistical/modeling techniques, focused on the big data space
ability and willingness to learn new technologies and methods
business oriented mindset

in order to apply, we ask you that you take the time to add a customized cover letter that clearly demonstrates what skills you have and where you have obtained them - simply add it as page 1 to your resume so that it is sent in one clear document. in addition, please add a brief paragraph as to why you want to work at inliv.
any resumes that do not include a cover letter will not be considered as this is a key piece of our recruitment methodology. we want to ensure our candidates can follow instructions and communicate clearly in a written format.

home

analytics manager












analytics manager


department: marketing
location: toronto, canada 

apply for this position


we’re a tight-knit group of analytical minded, self declared ‘nerds’, who provide marketing intelligence for the world’s greatest small-group adventure travel company. we work fast. we work hard. we serve a global brand that stubbornly refuses to stop growing. we do it all in-house, and we have a blast making it all happen.
the g adventures marketing intelligence team is on the hunt for a passionate, intelligent, experienced, hard-working and authentic analytics manager. if you fit the bill, give us a call. we can’t wait to meet you.
at g adventures, we’re obsessed with the customer, our traveller; it’s about engaging and connecting emotionally with each and every one of them, along each and every step of their journey - so they keep coming back for more. 
as analytics manager, you will lead the charge in delivering proactive marketing and sales insights to support our business. you will provide recommendations for optimizing the customer experience, marketing channel spend and campaign strategy. you will consult with teams across g adventures to understand our key business issues and will work with your team to deliver data driven, actionable insights. you are our in-house marketing research consultant.
the right candidate has a passion for, and deep understanding of, analytics and can easily communicate insights to stakeholders with varying levels of data savviness. someone who embraces and champions the ‘democratization of data’ notion and approach. an inspiring leader, committed to growing and developing their team. someone with opinions, and the ability to express them. someone who aspires to use their strong strategic and analytical skills to help change people’s lives through travel. sound like a lofty goal? we live and breathe our brand promise every day so, if this sounds like you, we want you on our team.
responsibilities

lead, develop and mentor a dynamic team consisting of a digital analyst, data analyst, and (junior) data analyst, enabling and empowering these individuals to deliver marketing intelligence excellence through positive support, guidance and inspiration. hire, guide and develop with finesse
understand and become an expert in our industry, our business, our culture and our customer, and use that knowledge to create effective, impactful, strategic and shareworthy work
work closely with the analyst team to complete complex analyses which are, importantly, actionable
manage and actively contribute to the day-to-day workload of the team, ensuring all team goals met in a timely manner
proactively deliver insights around marketing kpis, campaign strategy, measurement plans, reporting and post mortem processes
proactively deliver recommendations for optimizing the customer experience, marketing channel spend and campaign strategy
manage a repository of learnings and best practices and ensure results are socialized
act as the lead resource for the global and regional marketing teams and other departments for anything marketing analytics related, on a day-to-day basis 
lead with service - we’re an in-house agency! - and contribute to an engaged and dynamic corporate culture

requirements

bachelor's degree in marketing, math, statistics, economics or a related field
4+ years of demonstrated experience as an analyst, preferably in roles supporting marketing analysis
1+ years of experience in a management position, preferably where overseeing analysts
intermediate sql knowledge and understanding of relational databases is required
has solid experience working with various data sources
has experience with digital analytics
a strong analytical thinker with a natural intellectual curiosity
is able to translate complex data into precise and simple insights for business partners
demonstrates the ability to critique and discuss his/her own work and the work of others in a constructive manner
possesses excellent communication and influencing skills, combined with strong oral presentation skills
is both collaborative and proficient at building positive working relationships with multi-disciplinary stakeholders across the business 
possesses strong computer/technology skills and is highly proficient in microsoft office, excel, powerpoint and keynote
experience with salesforce is an asset
experience with business intelligence tools is an asset
experience with data warehouses and etl processes an asset
experience with workfront or other project management software is an asset
experience in data science is an asset

we thank all interested candidates however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.
***qualified applicants must hold appropriate citizenship or documents permitting them to reside and work in canada***
g adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. we consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

details job number:  38090 communications assistant job posted: wednesday, 13 september 2017 closing date: wednesday, 1 november 2017 (in 28 days) toronto wildlife centre region: toronto metro area type: full time location: toronto salary: (not entered) communications assistant status:  full-time location(s):  currently located at downsview park with plans to move to the rouge park area in 2019 reports to:  executive director compensation: tbd, commensurate with experience   about toronto wildlife centre   toronto wildlife centre (twc), a registered charity, is the only wildlife centre in the greater toronto area and the busiest in canada. approximately 5,000 wild animals are admitted to the centre each year representing over 270 different species of wildlife.  dedicated to the rehabilitation of sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, and to educating the public on wildlife-related issues, twc was the first wildlife centre in canada with a full veterinary hospital and the only one with a dedicated wildlife rescue program, and is open 365 days a year.  position summary in this unique and exciting role, you will combine your creative communication and social media skills with your passion for promoting peaceful co-existence for people and wildlife. you will join a fantastic team of staff and volunteers committed to educating the public on wildlife issues and providing medical and rehabilitative care to sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, with the goal of releasing healthy animals back into the wild. as a key member of the team, the communications assistant will assist with strategy for all communications, website, and public relations messages to consistently articulate toronto wildlife centre’s mission. your goal is to advance our position and profile with relevant constituents, as well as drive broader awareness and donor support. scope includes assisting with content creation for our varied and integrated communications channels and ensuring adherence to our style and branding guidelines. key responsibilities assist with developing and implementing an integrated strategic communications plan to broaden awareness of programs and mission, and increase the visibility of our programs across key stakeholder audiences identify fundraising challenges and emerging issues collaborate with staff to recognize communications opportunities and solutions, and execute appropriate strategies to support them compile marketing and user statistics to inform ongoing strategy assist with the development of print and web communications including social media postings, website and blog content, newsletters, brochures and donor correspondence, while maintaining brand standards and enforcing style guidelines assist with posting “to-the-moment” content on our website and social media channels and monitor our presence on social media channels assist with updating our website and review and approve content from other members of staff assist with managing volunteer photographers, videographers and graphic designers work collaboratively with communications staff and volunteers assist with developing messaging for annual fundraising assist with other communication and fundraising tasks as needed requirements excellent writing/editing and verbal communication skills strong attention to detail in both design and writing strong track record as an implementer who thrives on managing a variety of key initiatives sincere commitment to work collaboratively with all constituent groups, including staff, board members, volunteers, donors, program participants, and other supporters ability to work quickly and under tight timelines to communicate “to-the-moment” news and funding needs excellent and persuasive communicator self-starter, able to work independently, and entrepreneurial; enjoys creating and implementing new initiatives advanced computer skills — i.e.; ms word, excel, wordpress, adobe photoshop and indesign savvy with current popular social media channels ability to work efficiently and effectively within a fast paced and dynamic environment passion for toronto wildlife centre’s mission assets  education background in communications graphic design abilities experience in a communications role education and/or experience in fundraising basic photography skills basic understanding of seo and web analytics how to apply: please mention you saw this posting on workinnonprofits.ca. to apply: please e-mail cover letter, resume and references to hr@torontowildlifecentre.com[anti-spam measure - please enable javascript to view] with subject line “communications assistant.” attention shannon brown. due to high number of expected applicants, only those individuals who qualify for an interview will be contacted. no inquiries please. contact details: shannon browntoronto wildlife centre60 carl hall rd., unit 4toronto, on, m3k 2c1 tel: 416-631-0662e-mail: hr@torontowildlifecentre.com[anti-spam measure - please enable javascript to view] www:   www.torontowildlifecentre.com  thanks for looking on workinnonprofits.ca and good luck with your job search! culture specialist (distribution centers)*12 month contract to be based in vancouver, bc or seattle, wa (approx start jan/feb 2018)**candidate must be independently authorized to work both in canada and the us. lululemon is unable to sponsor candidates unable to work in both countries at this time.
who we are 
yoga is our first love, and we also make technical product
for running, training and pretty much every other way you like to sweat. you
can find our stores all around the world, from vancouver to dubai, and places
in between. our vision is to create transformational experiences for people to
live happy, healthy, fun lives. 
about the team
most companies call us ‘human resources’ but we’re way
cooler than most companies. we are a team that helps our great people achieve
their dreams and live a life they love. we attract great talent, ensure our
compensation and benefits embody our core values, and we provide support in
developing and managing our greatest assets – our people! your people + culture
teammates are your biggest fans and most dedicated coaches. 
a day in the life: 
reporting directly to the manager, people & culture,
the people & culture specialist works closely with the employees and
managers to administer, coordinate and support the people & culture
function for the distribution centers. areas of support include employee
relations, coaching and developing business partners; recruitment & people
pipeline support; leaves of absence; facilitation and or administration of
training programs; assisting with compensation and benefits management; as well
as development, maintenance and administration of company people policies.
accuracy, confidentiality, clear communication and follow up are key
accountabilities. 
·  contribute
to and execute on the hr strategy for our distribution centers (dcs)
·  work
directly with dc management on performance management and employee relations
issues in ensuring implementation and follow through of performance management
programs are in place and working
·  establish
and maintain p&c as a business partner within the dcs, while working
cross-functionally with other areas of the business
·  facilitate
training for new managers, as needed
·  development
and maintenance of training materials and toolkits
·  facilitate
exit process including exit interviews, where applicable 
·  provide
reporting and analytics for business partners, as needed
·  provide
frontline support for employees (company policies, employee relations, annual
programs)
·  partner
with employees, managers and benefits specialists to ensure employee leaves are
managed accurately and efficiently 
·  coordinate
employment contracts and independent contractor agreement process
·  assist
people & culture team with creation of company policies, identifies gaps in
current policies and develops new policies as required
 
qualifications:
 
·   
3-5 years’ previous experience in human resources
·   
a post-secondary diploma, degree or certificate in
human resource management or related field
·   
knowledge of employment/labor standards in the us
and canada
·   
knowledge of human rights legislation
 
 
must haves:
·   
capable of effectively managing multiple demands
from a variety of sources
·   
be able to maintain composure in demanding
situations 
·   
have strong focus on customer service and meeting
the requests of internal and external clients from an administrative/support
perspective
·   
highly ethical and able to deal with confidential
issues with tact & discretion
·   
strong communication skills both written and verbal
·   
excellent technical ability (microsoft office suite)
·   
must be an effective team player
·   
candidate
is independently authorized to work both in canada and the us. lululemon is
unable to sponsor candidates unable to work in both countries at this time. 
 
note: only those applicants
under consideration will be contacted. please accept our utmost appreciation
for your interest. lululemon is an equal employment opportunity employer.
employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race,
color, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion,
marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military
service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other
classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and
ordinances. reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals
with disabilities, upon request. this equal employment opportunity policy
applies to all practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation,
benefits, discipline, transfer, termination and all other terms and conditions
of employment. while management is primarily responsible for seeing that
lululemon equal employment opportunity policies are implemented, you share in
the responsibility for assuring that, by your personal actions, the policies
are effective.job: people potentialorganization: store support centerunposting date: ongoing

date: 
sep 20, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 176470 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with a 137 year track record of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
an integral part of our customer service focus, includes contact centres across canada supporting all of our bell mobility and bell residential services customers. our  customer operations team is responsible for strategy, design and delivery of core call centre tools and processes, including queue strategy, routing, and call monitoring tools.
 
are you passionate about leveraging big data analysis to enhance the customer experience?
do you want to be part of the team that designs and implements solutions to major customer issues?
are you able to handle multiple demands at once by prioritizing effectively?
 
if you answered an enthusiastic “yes” to the above, then you may be the person we’re looking for to join our team!  if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we would love to discuss our opportunity with you.
 
the role:
as a member of the arpu advocacy group you will develop a deep understanding of different customer interactions and the drivers of negative business impacts including service cancellations, repeat callers and service credits. from there you will leverage this understanding to drive tangible ebitda business benefits by defining, sizing and building the case for initiatives to improve customer experience.  this role entails end to end involvement in problem definition and analysis, solution design, implementation and monitoring involving heavy collaboration with other teams.
 
our ultimate goal is to understand the true value of our customers and their drivers of satisfaction.  we have both the infrastructure and the appetite around data and analytics; we just need the experience and talent to leverage it!
 
responsibilities of the role:
analysis and modeling

working with large data volumes efficiently using sas and teradata to develop a deep understanding of customer behaviour and quantify specific pain points
design solutions and model expected outcomes, individual metrics and overall profitability
provide analytical insight to answer questions from executives and other teams
end-to-end ownership of projects from data analysis and modeling to strategy design and project implementation

collaboration

engage with cross functional stakeholders to socialize issues, develop strategies, drive the case for change and implement solutions
build and deliver material to gain support and drive action among stakeholder groups, including the executive team

 
preferred competencies:

financial or statistical modeling experience.
ability to manage projects end-to-end
professional manner as this role has a high degree of executive exposure
curious and passionate about learning new skills and techniques
strong business acumen
ability to negotiate and influence others
interest in building impactful presentations and delivering them to different audiences
experience in sas or sql is an asset

#li-nd1
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : toronto
application deadline: 2016-10-04
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role.  applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

title: Portfolio Administrator
text: portfolio administrator job - mcmahon keast capital management - vancouver, bc | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province portfolio administrator mcmahon keast capital management - vancouver, bc are you a natural-born riddle master who is enthusiastic and successful at problem-solving? do you work on brain teasers in your spare time? would you thrive in an environment that requires you to implement tactical investment decisions while taking into consideration a multitude of variables with varying degrees of complexities? would you enjoy spending your time discussing financial markets, investment strategies, and portfolio asset allocation without the sales responsibility?if so, then this is the opportunity for you! mcmahon keast capital management is looking for a highly effective, multi-task oriented professional to join their team as portfolio administrator. as a full-time member of the team, you will under the direction of the portfolio managers, execute on investment decisions with specific parameters while demonstrating a meticulous attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy.in this role, you will be primarily responsible for:rebalance portfolios in croesus with the objective of returning optimal portfolio results in the most efficient and cost effective manner;consider multi-criteria factors such as cash flow management, tax-efficient assets allocation, fixed income laddering, and corporate action events for optimal portfolio rebalancing;create scenarios and analyze rebalancing results to identify and correct erroneous outcomes. define rule-based strategies to effectively create a scalable rebalancing process;monitor positions based on client’s investment policy statement (“ips”). resolve variances between asset classes and selected target ranges;prepare trade blotters and perform trade reconciliations within trading hours;facilitate foreign exchange transactions;manage client cash flow and execute trades based on the ips;provide compliance support by proactively minimizing inquiries and responding to requests as required;manage the croesus database, ensuring client information, logs, and document attachments are accurate and up to date;assist portfolio management in conducting research;complete tasks and activities assigned through pareto crm, andaccept new challenges and responsibilities as they arise.to be successful in this role, you must demonstrate:strong ability to solve complex problems using analytics and sound judgement;detail-orientated approach to all aspects of the role;perform all responsibilities with a high degree of accuracy;self-starter while working with minimal supervision;excellent communication and interpersonal skills;team player in a supportive and progressive environment;solid understanding of tax-efficient investing across various type of accounts;comprehensive knowledge of financial markets and products including equities, fixed income products, mutual funds, etfs, and derivatives;5+ years industry experience or an equivalent combination of experience and education;advanced proficiency with croesus and microsoft office is a must;software experience using national bank correspondent network’s suite of systems, bloomberg terminal, and pareto crm are definite assets, andbe an early riser to begin trading at the start of market hours (6:30 am pst).about mcmahon keast capital management:our firm, located in downtown vancouver, specializes in wealth management for affluent individuals, families, and business owners. we provide our clients with the trust and confidence required to establish long-term advisory relationships with high net worth clients. each member of our team’s contributions are paramount to help meet this objective. at mcmahon keast capital management, we surround ourselves with professional people who are talented, possess a great attitude, and love what they do. we offer a competitive salary depending on experience, benefits, an inspiring work environment, and a culture that promotes collaboration, support, and mutual respect.to apply for this role, please submit your resume and cover letter along with salary expectation. we thank all applicants who express an interest in this role, however only those considered will be contacted.job type: full-timerequired experience:croesus portfolio management software: 2 years 23 to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior business analyst (pla03269-17)job description senior business analyst - pla03269-17description position overview:   the predictive analytics and customer excellence (pace) team in partner solutions is looking for a champion to focus on delivering business critical data and analysis, drive continuous business improvement, and achieve best in class customer experience. the pace team is responsible for driving strategic programs to transform our customer experience and bolster our customer and market intelligence in partner solutions. as a senior business analyst with the pace team you will be a key contributor supporting partner solutions’ strategic vision of “bringing a world of possibilities to our customers and the best of telus to the connected world”, and directly driving our strategic imperative of “self-serve leadership”.   your role will be to identify, develop, and present key analysis and analytic tools used for critical decision making in strategic programs across partner solutions.   if you’re looking for a collaborative, high performance, and customer focused culture, come join our team.   what you will do:  assist in cultivating a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling/analytical process to gain operational efficiency build complex models using statistical or operational research tools and techniques focused on providing clarity to complex business issues and situations conceptualize and present key drivers and relationships between data sets to support strategic business decisions act as a data and key performance indicator (kpi) consultant to the business, ensuring high quality of repeatability and reproducibility of system and process data lead strategic complex end to end team project efforts and develop tactics and timelines to address specific project objectives to ensure customer needs are met synthesize analytical and modeling findings/insights, and ensure it is clearly communicated to stakeholders in business context in order to be able to solve customer/business issues and objective maintain a strong understanding of partner solutions applications, products and services, organizational delivery capabilities, and telus end-to-end processes work collaboratively with leadership team within tps to ensure a cohesive aligned approach work with supporting counter-parts in other parts of telus to ensure interlock; areas include customer care, customer marketing, sales, operations, it, technology strategy, business transformations & optimization and regulatory among others develop and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with cross-functional leadership teams and act as a trusted advisor to business unit stakeholders work collaboratively with external vendors on solution requirements where required support a number of business critical operational activities continue to enhance our business, customer and market intelligence and drive actionable insights for our sales, marketing and care teams manage and maintain buy side tools and data visualization tools mentor, coach and provide expert guidance to team members qualifications what you bring:  ability to proactively hypothesize and perform data analysis to enable business problem resolution advanced data management skills to transform raw data into meaningful business information strong business and financial acumen combined with an innovative and process improvement mindset ability to quickly and thoroughly understand business priorities and operations strong interpersonal skills with the ability to foster good cross-functional working relationships with peers and business partners at multiple organizational levels ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical teams ability to influence others in presenting ideas and concepts; excellent written and communication skills with the ability to present information at all levels of the organization experience dealing/communicating effectively with leaders across different levels experience building effective working relationships with internal/external partners demonstrated ability to work independently with a strong track record of high performance capacity to take initiative and ownership of issues and tasks through to resolution technological interest/curiosity would be an asset to help the team test/learn how to use latest tools available (e.g. mapping tools, dashboard tools, etc.) thoroughly analyze challenges, thoughtfully formulate action plans, and diligently perform tasks knowledge of operational readiness, assure and fulfillment, and reporting and analytics advanced knowledge in applications, systems and processes used by the partner solutions team would be an asset excellent working knowledge of microsoft office applications (ms excel, ms word, visio, ms powerpoint) use of data mining and presentation tools such as data flux/alteryx, tableau, sql considered strong assets ability to deal with ambiguity and complex issues and concepts ability to react quickly and take advantage of changing business conditions a minimum of 3 years of related predictive modeling/statistical experience university degree and/or equivalent combination of experience and education experience working in the telecom or any related industries would be considered an asset  role can be based in: toronto, vancouver calgary or montreal.   who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoother date: 
sep 18, 2017
                


location: 
mississauga, on, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 177196 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with over 137 years of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
 
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.  
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
 
the bell residential services team is in the business of enabling customers to connect with people, information and entertainment by delivering integrated products and service experience for consumers while enhancing our competitiveness in the marketplace.  the team provides customers with bell home phone, local and long distance services, bell internet, bell satellite tv and amazing new technologies such as bell fibe tv.
 
the bell residential & small business team is enabling small businesses to connect with their customers, and helping them do more and make more. bell’s best network technology brings powerful internet performance & phone services with maximum reliability straight to the small business.   
 
the pricing and strategy team is responsible for driving core pricing and the full suite of competitive offers for the bell small business services portfolio (tv, internet and phone).  in addition, the team is responsible for monitoring and analyzing the competitive pricing landscape for the canadian telecom market and ensuring the brsb team is well informed on all competitive developments.
the team is currently seeking a highly motivated, analytical and self-driven individual to join the team.  in the role, the brsb pricing strategy specialist will be the subject matter expert on a diverse range of pricing initiatives.  this individual will utilize their strategic and financial acumen to help identify, define, and explore pricing opportunities for the brsb team.  the successful candidate will need to work across several different cross functional teams (i.e. marketing, finance, sales, operations and product), as such, strong communication skills, and the ability to influence will be essential.
 
job duties/accountabilities: 
reporting to the senior manager of brsb pricing, the successful candidate will be responsible for:

problem identification, opportunity assessment, proposal development, business case development, and presentation delivery
structure development of strategic, transformational, and business process improvement plans
apply database knowledge and perform data and business analysis to support various business priorities, including business cases, cost/benefit analysis, process optimization & pricing strategies
 influence decisions and provide key insights to internal partners and cross functional teams based on customer analytics and a thorough understanding of both services and customer profile
develop effective pricing strategies through the understanding of key drivers that affect profitability
proven analytical skills and ability to uncover information in big data
relationship building with external departments, working collaboratively in a team environment with colleagues and senior leadership
presentation of strategic plans at the senior leadership level

 
critical qualifications/competencies:

experience in a marketing / pricing strategy role                                
experience with financial models and analysis
organization, coordination and strong time management skills to handle multiple demands in a fast-paced environment
 highly motivated, energetic, and a has a winning mind-set
ability to manage tolerance to ambiguity, flexibility, and deal effectively with adversity
excellent communication and presentation skills (written and verbal)
proficiency in ms office applications (excel, powerpoint, word and outlook)
results-driven attitude with the ability to grasp and communicate complex ideas clearly

 
preferred qualifications/competencies:

graduate  degree – business/commerce or pricing analytics background
5 years experience in a core business analytics role

 
#li-kr1
 
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : don mills || canada : ontario : mississauga
application deadline: 10/13/2017
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role. applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

text:
vp, business strategy | huge toronto, ca






























work.
about.
careers.

vp, business strategy
strategy, toronto, ca





our vp, business strategy partners closely with clients to develop, guide, and implement the strategy group’s digital business strategies. they collaborate with creative, ux and tech departments to define the right approach for our clients’ digital businesses. they work to grow new and existing relationships by working closely with business development to assess client business models and identify new revenue opportunities within the context of brand, market, user, financial, and technology constraints. the strategy group has a broad focus, from developing long-term holistic business plans to creating website monetization, social media, or mobile strategies (and everything in between).
the vp, business strategy is a thought leader, and is passionately dedicated to growing our domain expertise and knowledge base through the development of first party research. they define new organizational structures and business processes in addition to working closely with our client services team to help grow large accounts and participating in pitches. they spend significant time onsite with clients to gain deep insight into client business needs, becoming trusted partners and advisors to senior client executives.
what we’d like to see:

must have experience within a management consultancy
strong experience consulting in business transformation and business plans
experience in developing revenue models and forecasts in excel as well as working with analytics platforms such as omniture or double click.
excellent public speaking and presentation skills in client facing and high-pressure situations.
demonstrated experience communicating broad strategic initiatives to both key stakeholders and diverse internal teams.
ability to simultaneously tackle multiple projects and challenges with enthusiasm.
passion to rapidly build expertise on new businesses and industry verticals.

 
huge is an equal opportunity employer (eoe).  we strongly support diversity in the workforce.  we are committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and work environment.  if you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodation needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process.  any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

text:
407 etr | career



skip to content






























search





































career opportunities







data scientist


location:
headquarters


job code:
504


# of openings:
2



description
position summary:
the successful candidate will assist in leveraging customer, digital and transportation datasets to create insights on pricing, marketing and customer behavior. the data scientist will assist the director of data analytics and other key stakeholders to bring actionable data driven solutions to 407etr. this job involves model design, data management, data queries, and providing input into programs and policies. this position is part of a highly collaborative and energetic team in a start-up minded environment.
position responsibility:

assemble and analyze data to understand customer behavior from existing 407 etr data, external data sources and emerging sources.


undertake analysis of target customer groups (segments) for specific marketing and pricing programs and assess opportunities and strategies for marketing.
ad hoc analysis and modeling of data.
ability to understand business stakeholder’s issues and create valuable insight.
raise awareness and action of data science within the company to help focus on fact based decisions.
support the department along with the information technology management department in planning the structure and storage of new customer related data fields.
represent the department in committees within the organization.

qualifications:

a university degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics, or computer science.


minimum 5 years working experience with data science techniques: clustering, regression models, classification, anomaly detection and other machine learning techniques.
minimum 5 years of experience with data analysis tools (eg. sas, r or python) and bi visualization for reporting.
well-developed business analysis, research and creative problem solving skills.
organizational skills and time management skills; planning and project management, and ability to meet multiple deadlines.
strong communication skills and work ethic.
highly collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit.
familiarity with microstrategy is an asset.

note: this job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
accommodations for disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process.

title: Manager, Analytics
text:
job description - manager, analytics (0089604)go to the main content section.careers at loyaltyonelearn more about our opportunitieslife at loyaltyoneour teamswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - manager, analytics (0089604)job description manager, analytics - (0089604) the opportunity

as the analytics manager on the global solutions team, you will lead the delivery of effective, timely and best in class initiatives and consulting engagements globally. we are looking for someone who is a self-starter, comfortable working cross-functionally in partnership with all stakeholders, and an outstanding analytic storyteller. you’ll be detail-oriented and results driven to achieve the organization’s vision for analytics capabilities. 
 
you will be partnering with the consulting, data science, product development and technology teams, to identify and deliver actionable insights. you will collaboratively support client financial goals, partner, member, and campaign measurement, as well as cost optimization.
 
this is an opportunity to innovate, deepen our existing client relationships, and help establish loyaltyone as a leader in this space.
 
what you’ll do

lead and manage advanced data analysis to identify and deliver actionable insights (key driver analysis, churn analysis, customer segmentation)
lead and execute data extraction, transformation and mapping activities
design the analytics plan for engagements, including data requirements and methodology 
provide thought leadership and coaching to a team of quantitative specialists in the delivery of data insight, development of complex analytical and statistical models, optimization of campaign execution and measurement to achieve financial performance targets
build insight and provide interpretation of results linking analytical perspective to objectives and identify new or innovative paths to accomplish or exceed goals
work with the client to establish operational processes for analytics execution that ensures appropriate safeguards for data
generate and support content focused on analytics thought leadership for external publication
participate in business development pitches by sharing thought leadership & advanced analytical solutions that solve customer problems
manage the process for standardization of the analytics methodologies and tools and automation  who you are


strong business acumen and understanding of direct marketing, interpreting research, extracting insights and communicating a compelling summary of findings to drive results

solid understanding of the retail industry and how consumer information and analytics is leveraged to generate revenue and financial modeling

a collaborative leader who has a keen interest in developing others

an excellent problem solver with an eye to future opportunities

ability to manage and thrive in a matrix organization and effectively communicate with all audiences 
what you have 

bachelor’s degree in statistics, economics, computer science, applied math or math
master’s degree is required (preferred programs include management/business analytics, operations research)    
minimum of 3-5 years of directly related work experience in managing analysis and insight delivery
minimum of 1 year of supervisory/management experience 
advanced skills in excel and powerpoint 
proficent in sas, visualization tools (qlick, tableau, microstrategy), r, python, sql
proficiency with spark, scala and alteryx. experience with aws and cloud deployments is preferred 
about loyaltyone

loyaltyone is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics, and loyalty services for fortune 1000 clients around the world. loyaltyone has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. these include the air miles reward program, north america's premier coalition loyalty program, precima, the global retail strategy and analytics arm, loyaltyone consulting, european-based brandloyalty, and latin america's leading coalition program, dotz. loyaltyone is an alliance data company. www.loyalty.com 
 
about ads
 
alliance data® (nyse: ads) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. the company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. alliance data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. an s&p 500 and fortune 500 company headquartered in plano, texas, alliance data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com 
 
employment opportunity employer. accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.

date: 
sep 29, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca, m4w 1g9


at rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, rogers is the place where ideas become reality. we embrace change, and find ways to do better. and we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.
 
the sr. analyst, resi base analytics will be accountable for supporting and evolving analytics, and sharing insights to support the overall residential customer lifecycle strategy, with the goal of improving growth and customer satisfaction. this includes defining and implementing necessary data query techniques for performance reporting, analyzing and summarizing data, and providing insights to improve revenue growth and customer retention. the successful candidate will be highly strategic, command the business acumen to understand how to move the business forward, and have the analytical skills to bring ideas to life.
 
what you will be doing: 
 

analyze customer-based data, to determine for opportunities and gaps for revenue growth activity
develop and make recommendations for revenue growth strategies that meet customer, revenue, cost and profitability targets.
translate business issues into analytical requirements; prepare presentations to communicate findings to management
assess the current data and reporting environment and recommend design and implement improvements to create more efficient processes
work with cross functional teams (e.g. finance, marketing, care, and channels) on business case development for base management programs
present to senior management of customer base management, in addition to the rogers senior leadership team when required

 
what you bring:
 

undergraduate degree. masters degree is considered an asset.
must have 5+ years of experience in analytic roles demonstrating an ability to derive actionable insights. knowledge of telecom industry is a plus.
excellent computer and programming skills with advanced knowledge of sas and sql, relational databases and ms office suite
practical experience in manipulating large datasets and working effectively with different data sources
proficient in statistics and business/financial analysis
solid organizational skills, with attention to detail and the ability to be flexible and adaptable to a changing environment to provide results
good work ethic, with the ability to work both independently and with teams
excellent oral, written and presentation skills

 
schedule: full time
shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 333 bloor street east (012), toronto, on 
travel requirements: up to 10%
posting category/function: marketing & marketing research / analysis
requisition id: 109526
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers?  because your tomorrow inspires our today.
 
what makes us different makes us stronger. rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. everyone who applies for a job will be considered.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

title: 
                        
sr. manager, global hiring & onboarding experience
                        









 

requisition id: 8225
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
reporting to the vp, global recruitment, this leadership role is accountable for the development and execution of an awesome candidate hiring experience.  this role identifies potential tools/solutions to enhance an efficient recruitment process, works with program owners to make changes to the existing process and supports the roll-out of a new global recruitment platform to over 50 countries.  additionally, this role measures and reports on the overall effectiveness of the hiring process.
 
this role leads a team of recruitment professionals that are passionate about delivering an excellent experience to all stakeholders in the hiring process.  we have an award winning hiring process and we are looking to make it even better.
 
accountabilities:

develop a global candidate experience strategy; identifying moments of truth, gaps in current process and opportunities for improvement
lead the continuous improvement of a new global hiring process that is currently being implemented across 50+ countries; driving maximum efficiency.
partner with the recruitment technology lead on ongoing global roll-out of successfactors recruitment ensuring alignment of new process and tools to the candidate experience strategy.
identify, develop and implement tool solutions that will continue to enhance the hiring experience for candidates and hiring managers.
optimize current recruitment tools and relationships with third parties to improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the hiring process.
lead the development of key metrics to measure the success and efficiency of the new candidate hiring and onboarding experience including leading our candee award initiative.
develop ongoing relationships with global recruitment teams, hr services and other relevant parties to execute processes and maintain recruitment technologies and tools
ensure recruitment processes, policies and tools are aligned with the overall talent strategy and in compliance with regulatory requirements.
provide thought leadership on all aspects of recruitment operations to drive effective usage of tools and program delivery.  recommending innovative and progressive solutions to enhance overall experience.
build a high performing and inclusive team; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

 
required skills and experience

demonstrated thought-leadership in the identification, development and implementation of leading edge recruitment solutions and tools for a global organization.


deep subject matter and technical recruitment expertise to support a global recruitment team, business hr and other internal stakeholders globally.
strong people leader that is excellent at setting goals, providing feedback and coaching a high performing team.
ability to leverage data from multiple sources to analyze and understand business trends as well as use analytics and insights to influence change.
strong skills in research, writing, editing and project management
fluent spanish, french ideal, but not essential

 
education / experience / other information 

post-secondary degree in human resources or business or related field
3-5 year of previous experience in a global recruitment team required 
demonstrated expertise of global recruitment processes and programs
excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
strong change management and influencing skills
ability to understand organizational needs and develop solutions
ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences

location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

data analyst

company:
        inliv
      

location:
      calgary, ab
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
as the data analyst at inliv inc., you will work closely with the chief data officer to build our business intelligence platform.  you will be responsible for managing all aspects of inliv's data including inputting, integrity, integration, manipulation, analytics and reporting.
you will perform impact assessments related to technology choices, design / architectural considerations and implementation strategy and provide recommendations
the data analytics team will support the leadership team to create innovative data and analytics driven solutions.
your day-to-day will include:

acquire, transform and analyze data from multiple sources ensuring data quality
responsible for defining, developing, and evolving data science related tasks using the latest development methods and infrastructure
participate in normal analytics development activities like design, implementation, reviews, defect management, document handling, etc.
support impact assessments and decisions related to technology choices, design /architectural considerations and implementation strategy
collaborate with system engineers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with our stakeholder’s and our own strategic directions
lead the design and creation of appropriate reporting and dashboarding for use by individual departments as well as company leadership
partner with the marketing, sales and operations teams to deliver data insights, identify trends and opportunities, make suggestions for improvement and answer business questions
influence business decision making through data-based recommendations
prepare ad-hoc analysis in the support of specific initiatives as required

qualifications:

4-6 years of experience in data analytics and business reporting
bachelor degree in computer science, math, physics, applied economics or statistics
demonstrated ability to communicate in a way that is easy to understand by all stakeholders both verbally and written
proficiency with python, r, sql and tableau for data visualization
demonstrated etl skills/experience (extract, transform, load)
ability to grasp the essence of large data sets and can use and create analytical and/or statistical methods to find solutions
an eagerness to roll up your sleeves, dig deep and get the work done
experience building dashboards in common visualization tools
prior experience of working with cross functional teams
competent programming attitude with good computation and data mining skills
technical expertise, domain knowledge, experience in statistical/modeling techniques, focused on the big data space
ability and willingness to learn new technologies and methods
business oriented mindset

in order to apply, we ask you that you take the time to add a customized cover letter that clearly demonstrates what skills you have and where you have obtained them - simply add it as page 1 to your resume so that it is sent in one clear document. in addition, please add a brief paragraph as to why you want to work at inliv.
any resumes that do not include a cover letter will not be considered as this is a key piece of our recruitment methodology. we want to ensure our candidates can follow instructions and communicate clearly in a written format.

analytics manager












analytics manager


department: marketing
location: toronto, canada 

apply for this position


we’re a tight-knit group of analytical minded, self declared ‘nerds’, who provide marketing intelligence for the world’s greatest small-group adventure travel company. we work fast. we work hard. we serve a global brand that stubbornly refuses to stop growing. we do it all in-house, and we have a blast making it all happen.
the g adventures marketing intelligence team is on the hunt for a passionate, intelligent, experienced, hard-working and authentic analytics manager. if you fit the bill, give us a call. we can’t wait to meet you.
at g adventures, we’re obsessed with the customer, our traveller; it’s about engaging and connecting emotionally with each and every one of them, along each and every step of their journey - so they keep coming back for more. 
as analytics manager, you will lead the charge in delivering proactive marketing and sales insights to support our business. you will provide recommendations for optimizing the customer experience, marketing channel spend and campaign strategy. you will consult with teams across g adventures to understand our key business issues and will work with your team to deliver data driven, actionable insights. you are our in-house marketing research consultant.
the right candidate has a passion for, and deep understanding of, analytics and can easily communicate insights to stakeholders with varying levels of data savviness. someone who embraces and champions the ‘democratization of data’ notion and approach. an inspiring leader, committed to growing and developing their team. someone with opinions, and the ability to express them. someone who aspires to use their strong strategic and analytical skills to help change people’s lives through travel. sound like a lofty goal? we live and breathe our brand promise every day so, if this sounds like you, we want you on our team.
responsibilities

lead, develop and mentor a dynamic team consisting of a digital analyst, data analyst, and (junior) data analyst, enabling and empowering these individuals to deliver marketing intelligence excellence through positive support, guidance and inspiration. hire, guide and develop with finesse
understand and become an expert in our industry, our business, our culture and our customer, and use that knowledge to create effective, impactful, strategic and shareworthy work
work closely with the analyst team to complete complex analyses which are, importantly, actionable
manage and actively contribute to the day-to-day workload of the team, ensuring all team goals met in a timely manner
proactively deliver insights around marketing kpis, campaign strategy, measurement plans, reporting and post mortem processes
proactively deliver recommendations for optimizing the customer experience, marketing channel spend and campaign strategy
manage a repository of learnings and best practices and ensure results are socialized
act as the lead resource for the global and regional marketing teams and other departments for anything marketing analytics related, on a day-to-day basis 
lead with service - we’re an in-house agency! - and contribute to an engaged and dynamic corporate culture

requirements

bachelor's degree in marketing, math, statistics, economics or a related field
4+ years of demonstrated experience as an analyst, preferably in roles supporting marketing analysis
1+ years of experience in a management position, preferably where overseeing analysts
intermediate sql knowledge and understanding of relational databases is required
has solid experience working with various data sources
has experience with digital analytics
a strong analytical thinker with a natural intellectual curiosity
is able to translate complex data into precise and simple insights for business partners
demonstrates the ability to critique and discuss his/her own work and the work of others in a constructive manner
possesses excellent communication and influencing skills, combined with strong oral presentation skills
is both collaborative and proficient at building positive working relationships with multi-disciplinary stakeholders across the business 
possesses strong computer/technology skills and is highly proficient in microsoft office, excel, powerpoint and keynote
experience with salesforce is an asset
experience with business intelligence tools is an asset
experience with data warehouses and etl processes an asset
experience with workfront or other project management software is an asset
experience in data science is an asset

we thank all interested candidates however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.
***qualified applicants must hold appropriate citizenship or documents permitting them to reside and work in canada***
g adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. we consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

september 2017 closing date: wednesday, 1 november 2017 (in 28 days) toronto wildlife centre region: toronto metro area type: full time location: toronto salary: (not entered) communications assistant status:  full-time location(s):  currently located at downsview park with plans to move to the rouge park area in 2019 reports to:  executive director compensation: tbd, commensurate with experience   about toronto wildlife centre   toronto wildlife centre (twc), a registered charity, is the only wildlife centre in the greater toronto area and the busiest in canada. approximately 5,000 wild animals are admitted to the centre each year representing over 270 different species of wildlife.  dedicated to the rehabilitation of sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, and to educating the public on wildlife-related issues, twc was the first wildlife centre in canada with a full veterinary hospital and the only one with a dedicated wildlife rescue program, and is open 365 days a year.  position summary in this unique and exciting role, you will combine your creative communication and social media skills with your passion for promoting peaceful co-existence for people and wildlife. you will join a fantastic team of staff and volunteers committed to educating the public on wildlife issues and providing medical and rehabilitative care to sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, with the goal of releasing healthy animals back into the wild. as a key member of the team, the communications assistant will assist with strategy for all communications, website, and public relations messages to consistently articulate toronto wildlife centre’s mission. your goal is to advance our position and profile with relevant constituents, as well as drive broader awareness and donor support. scope includes assisting with content creation for our varied and integrated communications channels and ensuring adherence to our style and branding guidelines. key responsibilities assist with developing and implementing an integrated strategic communications plan to broaden awareness of programs and mission, and increase the visibility of our programs across key stakeholder audiences identify fundraising challenges and emerging issues collaborate with staff to recognize communications opportunities and solutions, and execute appropriate strategies to support them compile marketing and user statistics to inform ongoing strategy assist with the development of print and web communications including social media postings, website and blog content, newsletters, brochures and donor correspondence, while maintaining brand standards and enforcing style guidelines assist with posting “to-the-moment” content on our website and social media channels and monitor our presence on social media channels assist with updating our website and review and approve content from other members of staff assist with managing volunteer photographers, videographers and graphic designers work collaboratively with communications staff and volunteers assist with developing messaging for annual fundraising assist with other communication and fundraising tasks as needed requirements excellent writing/editing and verbal communication skills strong attention to detail in both design and writing strong track record as an implementer who thrives on managing a variety of key initiatives sincere commitment to work collaboratively with all constituent groups, including staff, board members, volunteers, donors, program participants, and other supporters ability to work quickly and under tight
