description:
our company
brandactive specializes in the financial analysis, strategy and logistics of rebranding implementation for organizations undergoing a brand identity change due to a rebranding program, an acquisition, merger, or spin-off.
our services combine industry leading analytics with a unique and proven methodology that provides our clients with the information needed to make sound financial decisions, and save time and money. since 1998, brandactive has scoped, budgeted, planned, and executed brand change for many of the world’s most valuable brands.  
our goal is to build a unique company; a company that provides an experience where people are valued for who they are and what they contribute, are supported and challenged in their growth and feel proud to be part of brandactive. we do a great job with great people and have a great time doing it!
brandactive continues to grow and expand.  to meet the needs of our clients we have the following opportunity.
 
the opportunity
brandactive continues to grow and expand our business.  as a result, we have an immediate opening for an administrative assistant, project delivery working with project teams in our head office in downtown toronto.  this is a great opportunity to work with a very dynamic and experienced team in a full-time permanent role.
we are looking for a curious, energetic, positive, task-oriented team player, who will play a critical role in supporting brandactive's project teams in organizing our brand implementation projects.  you must be willing to challenge yourself and be enthusiastic about professional development.
 
responsibilities
your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

schedule and organize workgroup and other meetings
coordinate client site visit schedules for the project team
respond to all routine enquiries from clients and other stakeholders and refer complex issues to appropriate personnel
proofreading documents for formatting and other errors
develop and update excel spreadsheet project analysis, including data entry
develop and update reporting tools and other documents in word, excel, and powerpoint
attend ad hoc internal project meetings and client conference calls to provide administrative support as required
maintain records from internal and client facing meetings and communicate updates accordingly
maintain project databases and contact lists
vendor / supplier data updates and maintenance
additional administrative support as need arises

 
qualifications

college diploma or university degree in office administration, business administration or a related field
three to four years administrative experience working in a business environment
experience working for a consulting firm is an asset
high level of comfort with all forms of technology including excellent knowledge of outlook, word, excel, powerpoint; experience with sharepoint (preferred)
excellent spelling, grammar and mathematics
strong organizational skills including the ability to juggle multiple priorities
excellent communication skills, verbal and written
customer-service oriented with a great can-do attitude
sense of accountability and the ability to consistently deliver on commitments
strong attention to detail
additional languages an asset

 
compensation
brandactive offers a competitive compensation package including a comprehensive benefits plan and a health-care spending account.  salary commensurate with experience and education.
 
start date
immediately
 
location
downtown toronto

business intelligence and analytics manager

highest education level / certifications required:

strong database understanding

master data management

 reference code: 28441-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
job descriptionthe human capital practice in toronto is currently seeking senior consultants for their orgizational design team.
as a member of the organization design team within the human capital practice, you will work with a dedicated team of od professionals to solve our client’s complex structural issues.
some of the duties and responsibilities attributable to this role include (but is not limited to)

managing client and key stakeholder’s expectations to help build and sustain long-term relationships.
supporting organization design projects across our client’s entire enterprise and / or their specific business units.
supporting the development of our client’s talent and workforce management plans while being mindful of the potential implications of such a reorganization.
using organizational analytics to identify structural, process and / or people issues and opportunities.
the implementation of new organization models and related governance and workforce transition plans.

qualificationsin order to succeed as a senior consultant within this team the following skills, qualifications, and experiences are required:

previous professional services / consulting experience within a reputable firm.
completed undergraduate degree (e.g. business, organizational behaviour, psychology, etc.) with outstanding academic credentials.
minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in business transformation, with at least 1 year working as a consultant within a professional services firm.
demonstrated ability to manage multi priorities and deliver commitments on time.
attention to detail and commitment to deliver high-quality work products.
strong business acumen.
ability to coach, counsel and guide clients across all levels of an organization.
ability to anticipate the long term impact of all decisions and take a broad approach to problem solving.


strong commitment to professional and client service excellence.
impeccable verbal and written communication skills.
a willingness to travel within canada as/if required.

 
in addition, candidates who possess the following will be treated with priority:

mba or post graduate degree and/or a professional designation.
candidates with experience supporting clients in the financial services and/or public sectors with change management programs.
relevant experience in organization design or a relevant, adjacent field, eg-
	
od strategy,
business transformation
analytics / business intelligence,
human resources strategy,
executive compensation.


ability to travel and work internationally.

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

					seo/sem strategy consultant
				


						job description
					

why autotrader.ca?
autotrader.ca is canada's #1 automotive marketplace, with the #1 app and is one of canada's most iconic brands. we are a leader in the automotive industry and one of canada’s largest digital businesses with unrivalled consumer and dealer brand recognition. our technology solutions help our dealers drive their business forward and helps canadians to buy and sell like pros. autotrader.ca traffic has tripled over the last 3 years, generating more than 5.5 million unique visitors a month. it’s where canadians click with cars!
what does autotrader.ca offer you?

the opportunity to work with some of the industry's best minds
flexible benefits
casual dress environment
free membership to on-site gym
tuition reimbursement
regular employee appreciation events
employee vehicle purchase discounts 

why should you apply to this job?
we recognize that each employee brings a unique set of skills and experience to help us achieve success. we want to hear your story!  
this role offers great visibility to the exciting world of npv digital marketing! a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment working with a great team and the ability to attend the top north american’s digital marketing conferences all expenses paid!
the  seo/sem consultant plays a pivotal role in supporting the sales and marketing teams to ensure we continue to foster and generate new online business for the (npv) non-passenger vehicle (powersports, rv, boat, heavy truck, heavy equipment and trailer) operation. you will be able to apply your deep understanding of data analysis, product features and current seo/sem/social strategies. you have a strong ability to convey digital strategy recommendations face to face to our npv clients.
the work you will be involved in:

work as an integrated part of the sales organization with a focus on client performance, product competitive studies and optimization reviews.
build and manage relationships with npv clients to acquire an in-depth understanding of their business and product offerings in order to maintain and increase partner revenues.
produce and analyze seo/sem/social reports with the goal of measuring results and adjusting digital marketing strategies.
drive the process to define technical specifications, system scope and objectives through engagement with key stakeholders and business users.

 


						required skills
					

required skills:

strong analytical and statistical skills, attention to detail, and technical aptitude.
ability to juggle multiple projects.
strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, to present findings to internal and external clients.
proactive approach in identifying emerging trends in portfolio performance metrics, its key drivers, and its impact on future performance expectations
understanding of search engines, local search engine optimization, critical updates (penguin, panda, pigeon, hummingbird) and other factors that influence rankings with search engines.
understanding of link building techniques, compliance with google's webmaster guidelines, authority sculpting, site redirect strategies, url rewriting methods and best practices.
ability to speak to various technologies: web ui (css3, html5, jquery, responsive design, user experience, browser compatibility).
a curious mind: stays current with key social trends, media platforms and new technologies.
demonstrated proficiency using google analytics, google tag manager, google adwords, and facebook business manager in a professional capacity.
analytical approach to complex business problems using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers.
expert experience in conversion funnel optimization (across multiple devices)

 


						required experience
					

 

experience in web analytics methodologies; a/b and multivariate testing, with proven ability to apply web behavioral data to influence web design.
demonstrated proficiency in multi-channel funnel attribution modeling, model types, and practical proficiency in analysis of such models
understand development processes for web-based applications and experience in web information architecture, usability and web analytics
google adwords advanced certification is required 
bing ads certificate is an asset.
experience with successful sales initiatives in a highly competitive and fast paced environment.
experience in intangible, media and internet product sales.

						on, ontario, canada

						full-time/regular

this is an exciting opportunity that is on the forefront of a critical enterprise capability and priority for the bank. as a change agent, you will be providing thought leadership to the enterprise on the value of data, analytics and machine learning and get to work with lines of business across the bank to help them achieve their objectives.
 
this role would be attractive for data scientists who have experience with big data analytics on large volumes and wide varieties of structured and unstructured data, and are looking to gain a wide exposure to problems in the financial industry.
 
what will you do?


engage business partners to advocate the benefit of machine learning, and work collaboratively to define machine learning solutions for priority business problems

lead partner interviews, brainstorming sessions and workshops to capture business objectives and prioritize opportunities


translate business objectives into high quality analytical and machine learning-based end-to-end solutions that are innovative and drive real business outcomes

lead in the design, development, and implementation of innovative machine learning and analytical solutions and build roadmaps for business transformation


design and build proofs of concept and real world statistical and machine learning solutions aligned to business priorities

generate a roadmap of opportunities with the businesses you work with and implement solutions iteratively to drive value

contribute to enterprise data and analytics strategy and champion adoption of enterprise analytics capabilities, including “big data” platforms and open source toolsqualifications what do you need to succeed?   knowledge   possesses a university degree in data science, computer science, engineering, physics, financial modeling and/or mathematics (masters or phd preferred) and/or 7 to 10 years of experience in advanced analytics with machine learning, finance and/or consulting  advanced machine learning applications of python or r, including relevant packages and statistical testing methodologies  experience with implementation of solutions with modern machine learning platforms within a hadoop environment, e.g. spark, tensorflow, and h2o  experience using a wide range of analytical techniques: supervised learning, clustering, natural language processing (nlp), recommender engines, time series analysis, a/b testing, network/link analysis, sentiment analysis and data visualization   skills   demonstrates solid communication skills (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills at a senior management level  exhibits advanced critical thinking skills, integrative skills and creativity to drive innovation   demonstrates ability to build a good fact base, apply sound reasoning, and generate relevant recommendations that get implemented and lead to business success  able to work highly independently and manage multiple priorities  possesses solid leadership skills and is able to work successfully with a team that has diverse skills, knowledge, and educational backgrounds   we’re here to help    at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.    as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.    to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.     bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.   #li-mf1              job risk managementprimary location canada-ontario-torontoorganisation data governance & analytics-x004874schedule full-timejob posting 06/13/17unposting date ongoingplease note, if you are using internet explorer this site requires ie11 or greater.

job description - intern, search (172136)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - intern, search (172136)job description intern, search - (172136) organization: edelman practice area: digital description edelman has experienced unprecedented growth in recent years –
growth that is reflective of the firm’s ongoing evolution from a pr agency into
a communications marketing firm.  we now
offer several specialized areas of expertise, including creative, social, paid
media and research to help clients evolve, promote and protect their brands in
the market. by investing
heavily in specialty areas – and by focusing on collaboration, agency position,
innovation, and establishing a culture of creativity – edelman is
well-positioned to continue to deliver best-in-class work to our clients in
today’s complex media landscape. 
 
edelman digital is looking for a talented intern to join
our rapidly growing digital search department in our toronto office! reporting
to the director of search, the search intern will join our team in a 12 week
paid internship, supporting seo/sem and general digital search related
initiatives.
 
responsibilities:
 
the intern will be responsible for assisting with
analytics, reporting, research, and other tasks for a specific set of accounts
under the direction of the director of search. your responsibilities include
but are not limited to:
 
general
     paid & organic monitoring and reporting to identify trends and
     recommendationsbuilding
     and launching paid search account/campaign structuresdeveloping
     and iterating ad copy for paid search campaignsoptimizing
     and testing title and meta-tags towards performanceconducting
     keyword and content research to identify opportunitiesdefine
     and track kpis based on client business objectivesimplementing
     variables/tags within tag management platformsimplement
     basic schema using json-ldintegrating
     strategies with other specialties within the edelman offeringstay
     up-to-date with the latest search trends and updateskeep
     a creative mind to develop unconventional search strategies that you could
     propose and implement towards a case-study   qualifications:post-secondary program/education
     in digital analytics, digital media marketing or related fieldpossess excellent
     communication skills - both written and verbalpossess excellent
     interpersonal skillsintermediate microsoft excel
     skills (with knowledge of nested “if” statements and pivot tables)experience working with html
     and javascript – loops and arrays.basic understanding of web
     analytics tools (i.e. google analytics, search console, etc…)familiarity with seo/sem
     related tools and platforms (such as google adwords, google tag manager,
     searchmetrics, etc…)google certifications are a
     plusexperience in ux design is a
     plusshould you be interested in applying for this role,
please send your résumé and cover.  only
those candidates short listed for an interview will be contacted. thank you for
your interest in working with edelman canada.accomodations: 
edelman is committed
to accessibility and equal opportunity in its recruitment processes.  if
you require accommodation to participate in this recruitment, please contact hr.toronto@edelman.com  about us 
edelman is a leading global communications marketing firm that partners with many of the world’s largest and emerging businesses and organizations, helping them evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. edelman was awarded the grand prix cannes lion for pr in 2014; six cannes lions in 2015; and the grand prix in the titanium category in 2016. the firm was named “2016 global agency of the year” by the holmes report, and one of advertising age’s “agencies to watch” in 2014. in 2015, edelman was among glassdoor’s “best places to work” for the fifth time. edelman owns specialty firms edelman intelligence (research) and united entertainment group (entertainment, sports, experiential), a joint venture with united talent agency. visit http://www.edelman.com for more information.

title: 
                        
manager, data analytics
                        










 
requisition id: 9084
the digital factory is an innovation hub with a clear and well-supported mandate to transform the way banking technology is delivered, by re-imaging the customer experience, to deliver new digital value propositions. we have the support and experience of one of the world’s largest banks behind us and a talented, and growing, team of industry leaders driving us forward.
do you want to help us reinvent how people bank? at the scotiabank digital factory, we are passionate about transforming the customer experience.
we’re looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done.
by joining our team, you will make an impact on our customers, the banking industry, and ultimately, the world.
 
about the manager, data analytics
the manager, data analytics contributes to the overall success of the applied analytics team at the digital factory in canada. you will ensure that specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed and delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. you will ensure that all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
 
you are responsible for providing reporting and insights through the use of analytical, statistical and visualization techniques.  you will work closely with internal stakeholders and data stewarts to define data elements and turn data into critical customer insights and knowledge that can be used to make sound organizational decisions within the canadian digital bank. in this role, you will require a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem solving skills, and programming knowledge to quickly draw insights from data in order to support strategies for canadian digital bank.
 
accountabilities:

you will be a champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
you will collaborate with business partners and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to develop metrics to measure initiatives and provide ongoing tracking and monitoring of performance.  prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, elements and metrics used and developed
you will develop data elements metrics and indicators to provide insights and drive business value  
you will investigate and become an expert in available data sources of data, transform and determine how they can be interpreted for analysis
you will collaborate with data scientists, data engineers and operational teams to implement quality controls and automate data feeds and report generation.
you will present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes
you should understand how the bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
you will actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, aml/atf risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the operational risk management framework, regulatory compliance risk management framework, aml/atf global handbook and the guidelines for business conduct.
you will champion a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

 
required skills:

university education in business, computer sciences, electrical/computer/software engineering, mathematics or equivalent experience.
experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, xml, json, flat files, sas, csv)
experience with unix tools and shell scripting
solid knowledge of data analysis or manipulation tools for working with data (e.g., sql, db2, mysql, python, r)
knowledge of banking products and reporting systems are an asset (including finance systems, enterprise data warehouse and enterprise data lake)
experience using and implementing visualization tools like d3, tableau or qlikview

 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto 
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. scotiabankers hail from over 120 countries, speak more than 100 languages and serve over 23 million customers globally. as a highly diverse company, we know that an inclusive environment for employees and customers helps everyone achieve their best. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide a positive recruitment experience.









job segment: 
analytics, database, data analyst, bank, banking, management, technology, data, finance

date posted: 
sep 6, 2017
                                

 reference code: 28021-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: montreal, quebec, canada 
all available locations: montreal 
external posting descriptionthe corporate development office (cdo) leads deloitte’s m&a, joint venture, alliances and international investment initiatives where deloitte canada enters into transactions to grow its services offerings. the cdo is committed to increasing value to the partnership through thoughtful execution and innovative thinking. the cdo is targeting a significant amount in incremental annual revenue opportunities from these initiatives. the cdo has executed 30 transactions in the last four years. few professional services firm in canada has executed this many transactions. the team has six people throughout the country. transactions have been undertaken in interesting areas such as cyber-security, specialized legal services, analytics, data, innovative technologies, artificial intelligence, infrastructure, capital projects disputes, reserves evaluations, to name but a few.
a career in the cdo will offer you the opportunity to:

work in a fast paced and challenging environment in collaboration with the firm’s leaders
apply experience and skills to tangible value creation
work on high profile opportunities within canada and internationally
be part of a team of 6 (including the head of the cdo who works out of montreal) that has existed for over 4 years and which has closed on average, one transaction every 2 to 3 months
continue your professional development to reinforce and expand your chosen career path

as a valued member of the cdo group, you will:

work as part of a canadian collaborative transaction team
assist in the development of the firm’s strategy and evaluate the strategic fit
work with senior executives
support certain business lines in their strategic thinking
research industry trends and transactions
identify potential opportunities
financial modeling of projects
negotiate your own deals in some instances after developing the required expertise
build transaction rationale of projects and get them approved
work with the deloitte global network on projects
prioritize objectives and contribute to a variety of projects across all deloitte service lines
contribute to deloitte’s growth and development
ensure our inclusion agenda is considered
coordinate the firm transaction teams (talent, legal, it, real estate, independence, tax, etc.)

 
external posting qualifications
2 to 6 years of experience, including ideally at least one year in mergers and acquisitions or in strategy
work in montreal as part of a national team
have completed a professional bachelor of commerce or similar degree; mba, cbv, cpa and/or cfa designation would be an asset
strong written and communication skills in french and especially in english
strong proficiency in powerpoint and building presentations, strong experience with excel and financial modeling
leadership and sense of initiative
strong interpersonal and team-building skills
strong analytical and problem-solving skills
ability to prioritize, execute and operate under tight timelines
ethical, flexibility, integrity and professionalism
exemplary record of achievement and excellent references
some experience in working in a corporate development role (including m&a) is an asset; working in a professional services environment is also an asset
some experience with strategic advisory is an asset

 
get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
 
purpose of job
the senior manager, data & reporting analyst is responsible for creating reports and analytics results that track performance in key areas such as digital customer adoption, usage and sales. this role acts as the digital data sme in performing technical data analysis, producing monthly reports and being the group’s data representative. through data etl and working closely with various data teams and enterprise data warehouse / data lake, this role updates key digital data in databases and maintains data integrity. outside of regular data/reporting deliverables, this role also provides trending analysis, data-backed insight, as well as supports campaign measurement and new functionality development support towards the bank’s digital transformation objectives.

major accountabilities
 

works with various data teams, enterprise data warehouse and data lake to ensure month-end data production runs in orderly fashion, and address/resolve data anomalies
performs data pulls from various sources (sql and non sql) and maintain data integrity through data validation and auditing
tracks customer adoption, usage and sales for multiple digital channels (scotiaonline, mobile apps, mobile web) and identifies underlying trends and behaviours
independently creates various reports and dashboards for the needs of broad audience, includes executives, enterprise strategy, digital organization, operation teams, etc.
updates existing mis data systems with digital data
prepares ad-hoc reports and analysis based on needs
explores and accesses new data from various platforms, and ensure proper incorporation of any new data feeds
interprets analytics results and presents findings to upper management team
performs measurement of digital marketing campaigns, new product development and new customer experience functionalities
participates in future development and improvement of mis systems that might involve sas/sql, as400, hadoop/hive and other data and reporting systems
identifies and deliver new means of enhancing business intelligence and analytics


education/work experience

bachelor degree in computer science, mathematics, digital marketing, business, or related fields
5-7 years of proven track record in data analytics or technical disciplines in financial or telecommunication industry
python, spark, r with skills in sas and sql coding skills
extended experience in analyzing customer, transaction and sales data
in-depth understanding of digital delivery channels (mobile, online, abm, etc.)
experience in analytical/statistics tools (eg. excel, alteryx, r)
experience in graphing/visualization tools (eg. powerpoint, tableau)
exposure in data management platforms (eg. db2, hadoop, cloud solutions)
passionate about data, digital innovations and cutting-edge technology
excellent communication (written and verbal) and presentation skill

 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.









job segment: 
database, telecom, telecommunications, bank, banking, technology, finance

date posted: 
oct 3, 2017
                                

 reference code: 28883-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting description 
deloitte real estate’s team is comprised of over 1,000 dedicated professionals worldwide, specializing in delivering market leading industry expertise to ensure our clients meet their challenges and take advantage of opportunity with their real estate assets and projects.
 
our deloitte real estate team advises a wide variety of clients including many of the industry’s largest real estate occupiers, investors, owners, funds, service companies, government, investment advisers, developers, financial institutions and reits. our real estate team has all the right industry experience to convert challenge into opportunity.
 
in this exciting role, you will work with our clients across the marketplace to provide real estate valuation and advisory services to both existing clients of deloitte canada and to new clients from the public and private sectors.
 
corporate real estate advisory services include: portfolio strategy and analysis, real estate strategy, workplace strategies, corporate real estate operations strategies, feasibility studies, lease analysis, disposition strategies, location selections, long term land use studies, alternative use strategies and corporate real estate, providing a full range of real estate services to support both canadian and international clients – across both the public and private sector.
 
responsibilities
 

lead a high performance, multi-disciplined team of real estate professionals in the delivery of outstanding client assignments and marketplace opportunities
originate new business including internal and external development opportunities across both the public and private sectors
deliver deep technical expertise across the commercial real estate marketplace and deliver high quality client reports and presentations to “bring the best of” service for our clients
work closely with deloitte partners and other senior professionals to accelerate opportunities within canada and around the globe
oversee the wide range of technical deliverable requirements including marketplace analytics, valuations, transactions, client requirements across all property types, budgets, financial performance etc.
originate, prepare, attend and participate in client presentations
maintain market eminence through ongoing networking, relationship building, articles, speeches etc.
generate opportunity to deliver results to grow our canadian real estate service toward outstanding team benefits

 
external posting qualifications 

have a proven track record of providing real estate valuation, advisory, and/or corporate real estate advisory services to the canadian real estate market through a reputable professional services firm.
have demonstrated leadership capability to drive growth and performance to deliver results for a high performance real estate service delivery team
be highly respected in the canadian real estate professional services marketplace among corporations, pension funds, real estate operating companies, reits, financial institutions, corporations, government and other market participants.
have sales ability to originate real estate services through existing deloitte clients and relationships, the broader real estate market and rfps available in the market.
demonstrate leadership skills to build a high performance team to deliver real estate advisory services to our clients. this includes the ability to develop emerging talent to become highly competent for our client assignments.
demonstrate technical capability through client service delivery including, but not necessarily limited to: asset valuation, asset strategy, highest and best use analysis, corporate real estate strategy, due diligence, occupancy strategy, government advisory services plus the full range of real estate advisory services required by the canadian market.
understand commercial real estate markets across canada with a solid foundation in market research in office, industrial, retail, multi-residential and land sectors to name a few.
successful candidates may possess a aaci, mrics, bcomm, mba, ma and/or cmc designation and have a minimum 10 years of direct professional services experience with a reputable service provider through a wide range of relevant assignments across numerous asset classes.


at deloitte we are redefining what it means to be a professional services firm. we know that business as usual just won’t cut it. our culture is built on the collaboration, flexibility and innovation needed to perform at the highest levels and exceed expectations.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s workplace of the future is a unique workspace that strengthens connections and inspires innovative ways of working.
 
get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

date: 
sep 27, 2017
                


location: 
don mills, on, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 177970 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with a 137 year track record of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
an integral part of our customer service focus, includes contact centres across canada supporting all of our bell mobility and bell residential services customers. our  customer operations team is responsible for strategy, design and delivery of core call centre tools and processes, including queue strategy, routing, and call monitoring tools.
 
are you passionate about leveraging big data analysis to enhance the customer experience?
 
do you want to be part of the team that designs and implements solution to major customer issues?
 
are you able to handle multiple demands at once by prioritizing effectively?
 
if you answered an enthusiastic “yes” to the above, then you may be the person we’re looking for to join our team!  if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we would love to discuss our opportunity with you.
 
the role:
as a member of the arpu advocacy group you will develop a deep understanding of different customer interactions and the drivers of negative business impacts including service cancellations, repeat callers and service credits. from there you will leverage this understanding to drive tangible ebitda business benefits by defining, sizing and building the case for initiatives to improve customer experience.  this role entails end to end involvement in problem definition and analysis, solution design, implementation and monitoring involving heavy collaboration with other teams.
our ultimate goal is to understand the true value of our customers and their drivers of satisfaction.  we have both the infrastructure and the appetite around data and analytics; we just need the experience and talent to leverage it!
 
analysis and modeling:

working with large data volumes efficiently using sas and teradata to develop a deep understanding of customer behavior and quantify specific pain points
design solutions and model expected outcomes, individual metrics and overall profitability
provide analytical insight to answer questions from executives and other teams
end-to-end ownership of projects from data analysis and modeling to strategy design and project implementation

 
collaboration:

engage with cross functional stakeholders to socialize issues, develop strategies, drive the case for change and implement solutions
build and deliver material to gain support and drive action among stakeholder groups, including the executive team

 
preferred competencies:

financial or statistical modeling experience.
professional manner as this role has a high degree of executive exposure
curious and passionate about learning new skills and techniques
strong business acumen
ability to negotiate and influence others
interest in building impactful presentations and delivering them to different audiences
experience in sas or sql is an asset

 
 #li-kr1
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : don mills
application deadline: 10/20/2017
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role.  applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

title: Epidemiologist (RED-17-13)
text: epidemiologist (red-17-13) job - institute for clinical evaluative sciences ('ices') - toronto, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province epidemiologist (red-17-13) institute for clinical evaluative sciences ('ices') - toronto, on contract the ices research and analysis department is seeking a motivated epidemiologist to provide epidemiological expertise and research methodology expertise, and general project oversight in the context of our health services research. the epidemiologist reports to the research program manager in their assigned program. the epidemiologist will work collaboratively with the project team and under the direction of the principal investigator (pi) or staff scientist; and will provide epidemiological expertise, analytic input and project management for their assigned projects in collaboration with investigators, students and key partners.responsibilities of the position include, but may not be limited to: research and organization related duties may include:1. develop, plan and implement study/project protocols under the direction of the pi or staff scientist. these activities may include:assisting in grant/project submissions including budget preparation;completing literature searches and/or literature reviews;assisting with study design and sampling strategies;assisting with the production of accurate and timely data/reports including the development of data creation and analytic plans; data interpretation and presentation; and the development of procedures for data validation as appropriate.2. stakeholder management activities:engage actively with and/or provide consultation services to stakeholder communities and organizations on research feasibility, design, methodology, availability of ices data and interpretation of findings;interface with internal and external stakeholders and partners in support of the project such as expert panels, committees and team meetings;facilitate the uptake of knowledge by local decision-makers across ontario through the presentation of findings, education sessions, and one-on-one interactions as required.3. analyze data using statistical software according to ices sas programming standards independently and/or in collaboration with team member(s) or faculty:develop sas programs to extract and merge data from existing ices databases according to data set creation plans to create study cohorts following analytic standards and guidelines;carry out statistical analysis on developed study cohorts according to specifications of project analysis plans;prepare and review analytic output (e.g., tables and reports) .4. general project management which may include:monitoring project timelines, risks and deliverables in collaboration with other team members;managing project budgets and allocating funds in collaboration with the pi;liaising with other departments as required.5. work effectively and efficiently according to ices policies, procedures, standards, workflow processes, documents and requirements (e.g., complete program and project documentation according to ices standards and guidelines ) ;6. write reports (technical reports/working papers/ices publications/web-based summaries), abstracts, poster presentations, peer-reviewed publications and other relevant deliverables, in collaboration with the pi or staff scientist;7. work with communications to finalize written and graphic formats and to create report dissemination plans;8. may contribute to or support the development of a body of knowledge in support of ices such as updating documentation;9. may contribute to other committees or activities within the department or ices in support of ices business plan as required;10. perform other duties as assigned within the scope of the position.knowledge, skills and abilities required: master’s degree in epidemiology, public health or a related field;knowledge generally gained through 2 years related experience;experience in managing clinical, epidemiological and/or health services research projects and/or experience in health planning and decision support;working knowledge of common research and data presentation methodologies, bio-statistical analytic methods applied to health services research and data collection and/or management methodologies;working knowledge of the concepts of health services research;understanding of bio-statistical analytic techniques;sas programming skills;proficient in the use of ms office software (word, excel, powerpoint and outlook, internet explorer) , as well as the ability to work with computerized databases;strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills and ability to exercise discretion and good judgment;strong presentation skills;ability to demonstrate time management skills to manage and prioritize work load responsibilities and timelines;ability to work accurately and effectively under pressure, and to meet deadlines.this position is a one year full-time contract located at ices central in toronto.ices offers a competitive compensation package with full benefits, and participation in a defined benefit pension plan with hoopp (healthcare of ontario pension plan).interested candidates should submit their resume, and cover letter detailing how their knowledge, skills and abilities match the scope of this position by friday, september 29, 2017, to the attention of:human resources departmenticesplease quote job# red-17-13we thank all applicants for their interest in working at ices. due to the volume of applications received, only applicants being considered for the position will be contacted for further discussions.ices is committed to providing accessible employment practices, in compliance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act, 2005. requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process, and applicants are asked to make their needs known.job type: contract 19 days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions before applying to institute for clinical evaluative sciences ('ices'). apply now other req id: 178491 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with a 137 year track record of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
an integral part of our customer service focus, includes contact centres across canada supporting all of our bell mobility and bell residential services customers. our  customer operations team is responsible for strategy, design and delivery of core call centre tools and processes, including queue strategy, routing, and call monitoring tools.
 
would you enjoy partnering with other like minded high energy professionals that are passionate about leveraging data analytics to enhance the customer experience at bell?
 
do you want to be part of the team that designs and implements solutions to major customer issues, partnering with the senior executive team to drive change across the organization?
 
would you enjoy working in a fast paced environment? are you able to handle multiple demands at once by prioritizing effectively?
 
if you answered an enthusiastic “yes” to the above, then you may be the person we’re looking for to join our team!  if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we would love to discuss our opportunity with you.
 
as a member of the customer experience proactive strategy team you will develop a deep understanding of customer interactions and the drivers of negative business impacts including service cancellations, repeat callers and service credits. from there you will leverage this understanding to drive tangible ebitda business benefits by defining, sizing and building the business case for initiatives to improve customer experience.  this role entails end to end involvement in solution design, implementation and monitoring as well as extensive collaboration with cross-functional teams.
 
our ultimate goal is to understand the true drivers of customer satisfaction and proactively influence positive customer experiences.
 
responsibilities:

working with large data volumes efficiently using sas and teradata to develop a deep understanding of customer behavior and quantify specific pain points
design solutions and model expected outcomes, individual metrics and overall benefits
provide analytical insight to answer questions from the executive and other teams
end-to-end ownership of projects from data analysis and modeling to strategy design and project implementation
engage with cross-functional stakeholders to socialize issues, develop strategies, drive the case for change and implement solutions
build and deliver material to gain support and drive action among stakeholder groups, including the executive team

 
preferred competencies:

financial or statistical modeling experience
professional manner as this role has a high degree of executive exposure
curious and passionate about learning new skills and techniques
strong business acumen
ability to negotiate and influence others
interest in building impactful presentations and delivering them to different audiences
experience in sas or sql is an asset

 
#li-kr1
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : don mills
application deadline: 10/11/2017
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role.  applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

title: Consulting Analyst (New Grad) | Mercer | Canada - Multiple L...
text:
job description - consulting analyst (new grad) | mercer | canada - multiple locations (tor002kl)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagesearch|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - consulting analyst (new grad) | mercer | canada - multiple locations (tor002kl)job description consulting analyst (new grad) | mercer | canada - multiple locations-tor002kldescriptionyour career at mercer will begin as a consulting analyst. you will gain direct client exposure, working with a broad range of clients from various industries, in an engaging environment. working along-side high-performing individuals within project teams, you will help diagnose issues and design strategic solutions that help our clients drive shareholder and stakeholder value. 
 
your role as a consulting analyst will be to:

work within a team to provide quantitative and qualitative analytical support to senior consultants 
conduct research and analysis to understand industry and organization-specific issues, including business strategy, corporate performance, market practice and industry trends
analyze clients' strategic, financial, and organizational information to provide insights that will develop into human capital strategies and solutions 
prepare client reports that will be presented to board of directors and senior-level executives
sample projects include:

on-going communication and advisory to board of directors and executive teams 
benchmarking and assessing executive, board of director, and workforce compensation levels and compensation design 
advising companies on integration and retention strategy during corporate transactions (e.g., m&a) 
helping our clients align with best practices in corporate governance 
providing clients with market trends regarding rewards and incentive design practices
developing career frameworks and structures for an organization’s employees, including salary structures, workforce and succession planning and workforce analytics working with clients to assess their performance management system 
conducting job evaluation and pay equity analyses to ensure organizations are compliant with legislation 
supporting clients in developing and articulating a total reward strategy, compensation philosophy, and employee value proposition qualifications
a bachelor's or master’s degree in business, finance, accounting, hr, economics, statistics, or mathematics 
previous consulting, finance/banking, accounting, hr, and/or economics experience is an asset
strong analytical skills, both quantitative and qualitative, and excellent excel capabilities 
experience in data analysis, financial modeling, and presentation building 
excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
intellectual curiosity, superior organizational skills, and strong attention to detail 
flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to work under tight deadlines and changing client needs
to apply:

apply online via our website at mmc.com with your cover letter, resume, and all university transcripts 
toronto: applications must be received by september 10th, 2017
vancouver and calgary: applications must be received by september 30th, 2017 
montréal: applications must be received by october 7th, 2017

in accordance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act, 2005, mercer will provide a reasonable accommodation to employees and prospective employees to the point of undue hardship upon request and as required in respect of the individual’s particular restrictions and limitations. if you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, feel free to contact stephanie joseph at +1 416 349 4855 or via email: stephanie.joseph@mmc.com

 
at mercer, we make a difference in the lives of more than 110 million people every day by advancing their health, wealth, and careers. we’re in the business of creating more secure and rewarding futures for our clients and their employees — whether we’re designing affordable health plans, assuring income for retirement or aligning workers with workforce needs. using analysis and insights as catalysts for change, we anticipate and understand the individual impact of business decisions, now and in the future. we see people’s current and future needs through a lens of innovation, and our holistic view, specialized expertise, and deep analytical rigor underpin each and every idea and solution we offer. for more than 70 years, we’ve turned our insights into actions, enabling people around the globe to live, work, and retire well. we embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. at mercer, we say we make tomorrow, today. visit www.mercer.com for more information and follow us on linkedin and twitter @mercer
 
mercer llc and its separately incorporated operating entities around the world are part of marsh & mclennan companies, a publicly held company (ticker symbol: mmc). 
 
marsh & mclennan companies offers competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits and programs including: health and welfare, tuition assistance, pension, employee assistance program, domestic partnership benefits, career mobility, employee network groups, volunteer opportunities, and other programs. for more information about our company, please visit us at: http://www.mmc.com/. we embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. for more information, please visit us at: www.mmc.com/diversity.

title: Senior Business Analyst - Procurement
text:
job description - senior business analyst - procurement (pla03259-17)go to the main content section.skip to navigationpersonal business careers my accountsupportsearchsearch telus.comcareerswhy telus?search all jobswelcome. you are not signed in.|my profile optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagejob search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior business analyst - procurement (pla03259-17)job description senior business analyst - procurement - pla03259-17description ready to lead and drive change in procurement best practices? 
 
position overview:
 
as a senior business analyst within the procurement team, you will play a critical role in supporting the delivery of broadband services and other customer products and services to our customers. how? you will use your analytical expertise to deliver meaningful data insights and make recommendations on category spend and process improvements that will lead to value that ultimately impacts customers. you will have the opportunity to wear multiple hats throughout the sourcing process: conducting market research, identifying suppliers, analyzing proposals, creating and recommending solutions, and reviewing supplier performance. in our culture, you will be encouraged to stretch your creative muscles, collaborate with key stakeholder-partners across the organization, including broadband and customer delivery teams, finance, legal, risk, privacy, and security. additionally, you will be part of an exciting strategic procurement initiative – the evolution of our next generation service model.
 
this is a critical role and reports to the director, procurement.
 
if you are excited by the challenge and opportunity to drive procurement best practices to deliver value and an exceptional customer experience, join our team
 
what you will do:

analyze strategic sourcing requirements to effectively manage business demand requirements and optimize the sourcing strategies for a given category of spend
deliver on ad hoc business analysis requirements and the development of vendor metrics that enable optimal vendor negotiations
participate and lead work streams to support the evolution of procurement tools (spend visibility, contract lifecycle management) and procure-to-pay (p2p) processes
provide strategic and market insights on transactional movements in annual spend associated with the specific categories and/or with strategic suppliers 
identify, drive, deliver on, and manage strategic approaches to achieving annual total value of ownership (tvo) savings targets, including: 

tracking and managing results
collaboratively address and resolve issues (non-sla compliance) with suppliers
present updates, analysis and recommendations to senior leadership
equip the team in their preparation for contract negotiations by providing critical information and data
prepare executive level vendor briefings that summarize vendor relations from a financial and business perspective
lead quarterly performance and relationship reviews with key strategic vendorsqualifications what you bring:

exceptional verbal and written communication skills
advanced influencing and presentation skills that convey a compelling story
strong business and financial acumen combined with an innovative and process improvement mindset
a passion for data analytics and an ability to translate date into valuable, easy to understand information to help senior leadership make business decisions 
advanced level use working knowledge of microsoft excel, powerpoint and access
proficiency in e-sourcing tools (rfis, rfps, rfqs)
solid working experience large complex data sets, organize and synthesize to tell a story and help leadership team make informed decisions 
experience with sap contract management, ariba e-sourcing tools and sap 4.7 interface

7 or more years of relevant work experience, ideally in a procurement or supply chain organization 
bachelor degree in finance/accounting, business, engineering, computer science, math or relevant discipline with an focus on data analysis
mba or scmp designation is an asset
location: 


toronto

vancouver
edmonton
who is telus?

 
we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.
 
everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.
 
do you share our passion? 
   
at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.
 
at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.primary location: ca-on-torontoother locations: ca-ab-edmonton, ca-bc-vancouverschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

as the senior manager, customer experience, you will be responsible for helping to optimize the customer engagement, providing advanced insights and implementation recommendations to the hydro one organization through the efforts of cx surveys, best practices and mining of all internal customer data. an integral member of market solutions, this customer experience professional is results-driven and customer-first focused, helping to drive innovation, bring key insights forward, set meaningful kpis and develop a centre of excellence, advising hydro one with the best validations to enhance the customer experience.
 
accountabilities:

lead the development of an integrated centre of excellence for customer experience, through incorporation of best practices, process improvements and advanced reporting capabilities across all customer research programs, insights, data collection and analytics
champion the development of our customer experience strategy and implementation plan across lines of business and key stakeholders
lead the process for developing updated customer journey maps, customer personas and increasing our customer intelligence to help drive informed business decisions
support the development and implementation of customer segmentation models, providing solutions, new insights and greater awareness on the findings back to market solutions and various business stakeholders
develop tools to gauge customer behavior, conducting strategic customer research to understand motivation, needs, and values, sharing the influences with market solutions in the development of marketing, digital and creative initiatives
champion the implementation process for the collected data and new insights back to the business through stakeholder engagement, action plans and other communication methods
support the development of the customer experience team through coaching and leadership to create a strong customer-focused and strategic team
collaborate with creative services, integrated marketing, corporate communications and other key stakeholders in the development of plans to increase customer satisfaction, brand perception and through targeted business programs to advance the brand in the market
advance our insights and analytics practice by extracting and analyzing voice of the customer data and working directly with the business to create implementation plans
assist in the development of marketing tools and digital projects to shape customer behavior, utilizing customer research to understand motivation, needs, and preferences, to inform campaign and program development
advance customer engagement and customer satisfaction by working closely with the integrated marketing and creative services teams to influence brand perception through creative and digital properties
analyze and recommend best practices, creative/digital strategies and customer insights back to market solutions and various internal stakeholders to assist them in selecting the best messaging, tactics and channels to communicate effectively back to customers
champion the internal promotion of our customer experience team’s capabilities, insights, customer personas, customer journey maps, and various segmentations to help the business through awareness and education

 
knowledge and experience:

10+ years of customer experience, research, strategy, and management experience
advanced understanding of the total customer experience, with a proven track record in developing personas, advanced segmentations, ethnography, and customer journey maps
exceptional business acumen and communication skills with strong presentation skills
strong analytical skills with the ability to pull together and interpret quantitative, qualitative and technical data
advanced skills in strategy development, research methodology, and measuring performance

 
if you share our passion for safety, our customer service focus, and are ready to play a lead role in building a bright future, we would love to hear from you!
 
hydro one is an enthusiastic equal opportunity employer.  we thank all candidates for applying.  only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  if you are selected for an interview and require special accommodations please speak with the hiring manager.
 
deadline:
october 11, 2017

administrative assistant

company:
        brandactive
      

location:
      toronto, on
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
our company
brandactive specializes in the financial analysis, strategy and logistics of rebranding implementation for organizations undergoing a brand identity change due to a rebranding program, an acquisition, merger, or spin-off.
our services combine industry leading analytics with a unique and proven methodology that provides our clients with the information needed to make sound financial decisions, and save time and money. since 1998, brandactive has scoped, budgeted, planned, and executed brand change for many of the world’s most valuable brands.  
our goal is to build a unique company; a company that provides an experience where people are valued for who they are and what they contribute, are supported and challenged in their growth and feel proud to be part of brandactive. we do a great job with great people and have a great time doing it!
brandactive continues to grow and expand.  to meet the needs of our clients we have the following opportunity.
 
the opportunity
brandactive continues to grow and expand our business.  as a result, we have an immediate opening for an administrative assistant, project delivery working with project teams in our head office in downtown toronto.  this is a great opportunity to work with a very dynamic and experienced team in a full-time permanent role.
we are looking for a curious, energetic, positive, task-oriented team player, who will play a critical role in supporting brandactive's project teams in organizing our brand implementation projects.  you must be willing to challenge yourself and be enthusiastic about professional development.
 
responsibilities
your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

schedule and organize workgroup and other meetings
coordinate client site visit schedules for the project team
respond to all routine enquiries from clients and other stakeholders and refer complex issues to appropriate personnel
proofreading documents for formatting and other errors
develop and update excel spreadsheet project analysis, including data entry
develop and update reporting tools and other documents in word, excel, and powerpoint
attend ad hoc internal project meetings and client conference calls to provide administrative support as required
maintain records from internal and client facing meetings and communicate updates accordingly
maintain project databases and contact lists
vendor / supplier data updates and maintenance
additional administrative support as need arises

 
qualifications

college diploma or university degree in office administration, business administration or a related field
three to four years administrative experience working in a business environment
experience working for a consulting firm is an asset
high level of comfort with all forms of technology including excellent knowledge of outlook, word, excel, powerpoint; experience with sharepoint (preferred)
excellent spelling, grammar and mathematics
strong organizational skills including the ability to juggle multiple priorities
excellent communication skills, verbal and written
customer-service oriented with a great can-do attitude
sense of accountability and the ability to consistently deliver on commitments
strong attention to detail
additional languages an asset

 
compensation
brandactive offers a competitive compensation package including a comprehensive benefits plan and a health-care spending account.  salary commensurate with experience and education.
 
start date
immediately
 
location
downtown toronto
