job description: 
                        
job requisition id: 805
business function: digital
working hours:
number of vacancies 2.0
job closing date 06/10/2017:
 
discover your future
broad horizons
there’s much more to a fun and exciting work life at canada post than a good job with a great company. we’ll help you achieve your full potential. you’ll find opportunities to develop and expand your career, chances to try out new jobs in different areas of the company, or even a complete change of career path.
job description canada post is committed to providing innovative physical and electronic delivery solutions that create value for our customers, employees and all canadians. the assistant product manager participates in managing products, solutions, and services to ensure that each generates maximum financial contribution while satisfying market needs and the corporation's service mandate.job responsibilities below are the main job requirements and responsibilities for the assistant product manager.
• participates in the planning, development, and monitoring of the corporation's product, solutions modifications, new product/solutions development, and pricing strategies to achieve corporate targets for revenue, volume, market share, cost containment and reduction, customer mail preparation, and net financial contribution for products, solutions and services. recommends required corrective actions to be initiated by the responsible corporate functions as required.
• participates in the development of market share, revenue and volume, cost containment and reduction, customer mail preparation and net financial contribution targets for products and services for the setting of corporate goals and the development of the corporate operating plan.
• identifies current and future market opportunities and threats and prepares assessments of forecasted impacts on the corporation's market, service and financial goals for products, solutions, and services.
• evaluate the market, service and financial performance of products, solutions and services against corporate goals and prepares assessments of variances form corporate goals.
• assesses proposed initiatives and plans of all corporate functions and the divisions to determine their acceptability and impact regarding the corporation's product/solutions strategies, plans and objectives.
• prepares detailed multi-functional corporate product/solutions operating plans and operating budgets which translate approved strategies and objectives for products, solutions, and services into the specific functional activities necessary to develop and implement the operating and financial systems, procedures and infrastructures to implement all aspects of the plan.
• assists, and monitors, with the implementation of the multi-functional plans to ensure that new products, solutions, and services are carefully launched and revenue targets achieved.
• develops and recommends sales contract pricing proposals for products, solutions, and services and supports sales and customer service staff in the concluding of approved agreements with customers.
• meets with major customers and national customer associations to gain customer feedback regarding the need for product/solution improvements and/or the impact of possible changes to product/solutions and pricing.
qualifications education
• completed post-secondary, preferably in a related field such as marketing, business administration, commerce, business analytics.
 
experience
• 2 to 3 years of relevant functional experience.
 
other candidate requirements
• proficient computer skills and competent with microsoft office programs.
• strong communication, analytical, and customer service skills.
• one or more years of experience in a unionized environment an asset.
• knowledge of postal convention, regulations and agreements an asset.
• excellent understanding of marketing and customer data, targeting and campaign measurement.
other information  
 
to take on the permanent assistant product manager role in the scrum team to lead the roadmap to delivery of multiple digital solutions for other lines of business, including parcels, smb, e-change of address, delivery preferences, etc. so digital assets are a source of sustainable and competitive advantage to the corporation in the marketplace.  the right candidate will have strong attention to detail, be customer-focused, have strong written and verbal communication skills and will have experience with qualtrics or other voc platforms.
there is also another temporary term assistant product manager position that will be hired for a period of 6 months that is responsible for supporting the scrum teams and product manager in creation of and management of product management artifacts and documentation as well as creation of executive briefs.  this person will plan activities to enable business growth and profitability by making our digital assets a source of sustainable and competitive advantage in the market.  this position will focus on channel management - customer irritants, (far, fpc), native, mobile and 2018 projects.

employment equity
canada post is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.
 
conflict of interest
the conflict of interest policy prohibits employees from hiring, supervising or reporting to, directly or indirectly via the reporting hierarchy, their immediate family or close personal relations. should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential conflict of interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated human resources representative.
 
accommodation
if you are contacted by canada post regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if you require accommodation.
 
important message
your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as canada post cannot make assumptions about your education and experience. we thank all those who apply. only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
 
our leadership behaviours 
decision making – a champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner that aligns with the corporation's best interests.
accountability – an individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds him/herself and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved.
business orientation – a proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities.
execution – a focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations.
leading people – a compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things. 

 
our values
canada post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.
transformation – we will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace.
customer – we serve canadians with pride and passion.
integrity – we act responsibly and with integrity.
respect – we treat each other with fairness and respect.
safety – we are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders.

title: Associate Producer, Cross Country Check Up (English Services...
text:
job description - associate producer, cross country check up (english services) (tor05998)go to the main content section.français current openingswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - associate producer, cross country check up (english services) (tor05998)job description associate producer, cross country check up (english services) - tor05998  job family  programming (tv-radio-web)primary location  torontoposition language requirement  english onlylanguage skill levels (reading / writing / speaking)  - - -status of employment  permanentwork schedule(s)  part-time  description what it’s like working at cbc/radio-canada
 
at cbc/radio-canada, we’re all about creating content that informs, entertains and connects canadians on multiple platforms and from coast to coast to coast. want to be part of all this, and think you have the ability and drive to keep pace with this exciting, ever-changing industry? then we hope you’ll consider this posting, check out our job-listings, and explore the possibilities of working with us. whether it be in front of the camera, on mic, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making the connections and telling the stories that are important to canadians.
 
cbc radio’s cross country checkup is looking for a creative digital associate producer with a unique blend of journalistic, digital production and communication skills. working under the direction and supervision of the senior producer, the ideal candidate must have a keen interest and strong background in finding innovative, creative ways to engage with and grow online audiences. this associate producer will pitch story ideas and digital treatments, and be responsible for initiating and leading conversations with our online audience. this associate producer will maintain and build the show’s online presence, as well as be responsible for: digital content creation (value-added shareable content, online audio/video, graphics and quote boards); repackaging various audio and video content for an online audience; maintaining show website; developing and managing a consistent and interactive presence on all social media properties; creating and executing a promotional strategy that expands audience base; identifying and chasing interesting guests for radio or online that may emerge from the social media conversation; assisting with live events. during the show, she/he would be required to maintain an active presence online in twitter, scribblelive online chat and monitor facebook and e-mail to provide curated content from all platforms for the radio show and for the scribblelive forum. to be successful in this role, the associate producer must be a driven, hard-working self-starter, open to taking on a range of tasks whether they be creative, strategic or administrative. the ideal candidate will also embody cross country checkup’s core values to be relevant, inclusive, interactive, balanced, and open-minded.  function: with appropriate direction from one or more producers, the associate producer plans, conceives, organizes, and/or develops the production and realization of digital content.  work must adhere to cbc journalistic and/or program policies, standards and practices.  nevertheless, there is wide latitude for initiative, independent judgment and creativity.  qualifications we are looking for a candidate with the following: 
job requires a university degree or equivalent.job requires a minimum of two years relevant experience in a multi-media environment and expertise in creating/disseminating online content.excellent and creative writing ability that will engage the audience.ability to take radio and video content and create multi-platform extensions.ensuring all multi-platform content meets cbc's journalistic standards and procedures.skilled in digital audio and video editing, exporting, uploading, metadata in tools including theplatform mpx, dalet, adobe premiere, cbc’s audio upload tool, etc.proven experience with cross-platform and multi-media work which includes: maintaining and updating a daily web site; html; using polopoly, wordpress, expression engine and similar cms software; using image editor, image research and creation; writing, editing and proofreading copy for the web; playlist management, uploading audio, video and images.implement new initiatives and strategies such as live chats, live streams, blogs and new platforms to remain at the forefront of the multi-platform realm; ability to moderate online communities and social media applications, including live chats and live web streaming, ensuring an appropriate level of discourse. judgment is required in dealing with issues related to user-generated content.strong knowledge of adobe photoshop and graphic design, including image research, editing, and creation.strong knowledge and experience on all social media platforms and the ability to use them to grow audience.ability to develop internal and external relationships to ensure content reaches different audiences, on different platforms, through a range of media.experience working with digital analytics tools including adobe marketing cloud (omniture sitecatalyst), chartbeat, clicktale, etc. to assess and optimize performance of content.conducting regular checks of online content to identify glitches, mistakes, broken links, non-functioning files and liaising with technical personnel to ensure problems are fixed in a timely manner.well-developed administrative and organizational abilities.embracing of technological and media change, with the ability to master new platforms quickly and assist the department in being at the forefront of emerging technological trends that affect the media.working experience with cbc platforms would be considered an asset.ability to be a guest on radio shows would be considered an asset.ability to shoot video with audio for original online video content, as well as facility with a range of video recording devices such as iphone, camcorders.good editorial judgment and critical-thinking skills.ability to work effectively in a high-pressure environment and with tight deadlines, without sacrificing creativity or quality.ability to take critical feedback and incorporate it into the work.well-developed interpersonal skills: excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to clearly explain concepts to peers.flexibility to adapt to changing work patterns and methods.independent and self-motivated, combined with the ability to work well in a team environment.strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple priorities. and respond to competing demands in a deadline-driven environment.
candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.cbc/radio-canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. that’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. that’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as canada’s public broadcaster. for more information, visit the talent and diversity section of our website. if you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.if this sounds interesting, please apply online! we thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  job posting date  sep 28, 2017, 11:45:00 amunposting date  oct 12, 2017, 11:59:00 pmproficiency levels of second language:
-  = no level required
a = beginner level
b = intermediate level
c = advanced level  ici.radio-canada.ca|cbc.ca copyright ©  cbc/radio-canada

careers

epidemiologist (two year, full-time contract)




ices central
epidemiologist (two year, full-time contract)

            closing date:  
            10/13/2017





functional area: research and data
the ices research and analysis department is seeking a motivated epidemiologist to provide epidemiological expertise and research methodology expertise, and general project oversight in the context of our health services research. the epidemiologist reports to the research program manager in their assigned program. the epidemiologist will work collaboratively with the project team and under the direction of the principal investigator (pi) or staff scientist; and will provide epidemiological expertise, analytic input and project management for their assigned projects in collaboration with investigators, students and key partners.
responsibilities of the position include, but may not be limited to:
research and organization related duties may include:

develop, plan and implement study/project protocols under the direction of the pi or staff scientist. these activities may include:
    
assist in grant/project submissions including budget preparation 
complete literature searches and/or literature reviews 
assist with study design and sampling strategies 
assist with the production of accurate and timely data/reports including the development of data creation and analytic plans; data interpretation and presentation; and the development of procedures for data validation as appropriate. 


stakeholder management activities:
    
engage actively with and/or provide consultation services to stakeholder communities and organizations on research feasibility, design, methodology, availability of ices data and interpretation of findings 
interface with internal and external stakeholders and partners in support of the project such as expert panels, committees and team meetings 
facilitate the uptake of knowledge by local decision-makers across ontario through the presentation of findings, education sessions, and one-on-one interactions as required. 


analyze data using statistical software according to ices sas programming standards independently and/or in collaboration with team member(s) or faculty:
    
develop sas programs to extract and merge data from existing ices databases according to data set creation plans to create study cohorts following analytic standards and guidelines
carry out statistical analysis on developed study cohorts according to specifications of project analysis plans
prepare and review analytic output (e.g., tables and reports). 


general project management which may include:
    
monitor project timelines, risks and deliverables in collaboration with other team members 
manage project budgets and allocate funds in collaboration with the pi 
liaise with other departments as required. 


work effectively and efficiently according to ices policies, procedures, standards, workflow processes, documents and requirements (e.g., complete program and project documentation according to ices standards and guidelines) 
write reports (technical reports/working papers/ices publications/web-based summaries), abstracts, poster presentations, peer-reviewed publications and other relevant deliverables, in collaboration with the pi or staff scientist 
work with communications to finalize written and graphic formats and to create report dissemination plans 
may contribute to or support the development of a body of knowledge in support of ices such as updating documentation 
may contribute to other committees or activities within the department or ices in support of ices' business plan as required 
perform other duties as assigned within the scope of the position. 

knowledge, skills and abilities required

master’s degree in epidemiology, public health or a related field 
knowledge generally gained through two years related experience 
experience in managing clinical, epidemiological and/or health services research projects and/or experience in health planning and decision support 
working knowledge of common research and data presentation methodologies, bio-statistical analytic methods applied to health services research and data collection and/or management methodologies 
working knowledge of the concepts of health services research 
understanding of bio-statistical analytic techniques 
sas programming skills
proficient in the use of ms office software (word, excel, powerpoint and outlook, internet explorer), as well as the ability to work with computerized databases 
strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills and ability to exercise discretion and good judgment 
strong presentation skills 
ability to demonstrate time management skills to manage and prioritize work load responsibilities and timelines 
ability to work accurately and effectively under pressure, and to meet deadlines. 

this position is a two year full-time contract with possibility of renewal located at ices central in toronto.
ices offers a competitive compensation package with full benefits, and participation in a defined benefit pension plan with hoopp (healthcare of ontario pension plan).
interested candidates should submit their resume, and cover letter detailing how their knowledge, skills and abilities match the scope of this position to the attention of:
human resources department
please quote job# red-17-11
we thank all applicants for their interest in working at ices. due to the volume of applications received, only applicants being considered for the position will be contacted for further discussions.
ices is committed to providing accessible employment practices, in compliance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act, 2005. requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process, and applicants are asked to make their needs known.

text:

senior analyst – research and development






position id:
j0617-0145


job type:
permanent full time


job location:
toronto, ontario, canada


division:
actuarial


region:
head office


job category:
actuarial


number of positions
1





keeping you moving:
rsa is one of the world’s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving – for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development.in rsa, employing people with a ‘winning mindset’ is how we achieve success. you will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. we believe your personality and passion will keep rsa and our business moving forward. at rsa we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers.  our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader.  also rsa’s bwow (better ways of working) provides everyone with the flexibility of working where it best suits your needs – downtown toronto, mississauga or richmond hill (and even from home).
position overview:
the senior analyst, research & development will be a part of the research & development unit. you will support the pricing and underwriting objectives of the business through the use of advanced analytics. reporting to the manager, research & development, you will enhance our analytics capability through innovation and will embed best practices throughout pricing and underwriting analytics teams.
who you are:
your enthusiasm is infectious. you challenge the status quo.  you find solutions to problems.  you go the extra mile to exceed customers’ expectations.  you get things done the right way.  you represent our brand with passion and pride.  you are a team player.  you have fun and you make work fun for those working around you.
what you will achieve in this role:
•	develop new predictive models to be used for pricing, underwriting, claims, marketing etc; •	drive modelling sophistication through research and analysis of advanced statistical techniques; •	design, build and maintain market-leading cost and behaviour prediction algorithms; •	communicate complex technical models and results to colleagues in the business and provide recommendations;•	develop, enhance, and promote modelling best practices, including providing training to junior analysts and other teams; •	investigate, develop, and enhance data quality and data manipulation processes; •	contribute to the development of winning pricing and business process improvement strategies; •	engage, support, and influence business partners to drive pricing sophistication and deliver results
what you bring to this role:
•	university/college or master degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or statistics;•	minimum 3+ years relevant pricing/predictive analytics experience or relevant statistical experience; •	technical expertise in predictive analytics, ideally including experience with sas, r, emblem, and radar; •	out-of-the-box thinker, always striving for the next innovation;•	proven ability to turn innovative insight into implementable value-driving business solutions •	demonstrated success in people, project, and relationship management;•	knowledge of property and casualty insurance; and•	outstanding communication skills (both oral and written)#li-rs1
other information:
applicants agree that by providing personal information in response to this ad, and otherwise in any recruitment process with rsa or its affiliated companies (the “company”) such personal information may be retained and used for a period of one (1) year from the date of this application, for the purpose of consideration for employment opportunities which may arise during that time period, unless an applicant notifies the company to the contrary.we thank all applicants. however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.we invite you to learn more about us at our career site, www.rsagroup.ca, where you can apply on line. rsa group of companies is strongly committed to diversity and welcomes applications from visible minority group members, women, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities, members of the lgbt community, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.rsa group of companies will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process.if you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email aoda@rsagroup.ca or call us at toll free 1 (800)-855-0511. please note this email is only for accommodation requests. resumes sent to this email address will not be considered.

and activate new social media network partnership opportunities as well as deepen existing partner relationships.the ideal candidate will be excited to build and manage affinio’s data supply vertical, drawing from a combined account management and product management skillset.what you’ll be doing:work with the product, sales and success teams to identify and vet data partnership opportunities and own data partner opportunities.monitor industry news of api announcements on a daily basis to stay abreast of new opportunities.partner with product, technology and operational teams to ensure alignment on data specifications and requirements of participation.prospect, secure, and expand external partnerships by building relationships with executive stakeholders, submitting api access applications, outlining proposed use cases for approval, coordinating contractual arrangements, etc..manage the day-to-day operations of each data partner, serving as a proactive liaison and champion to promote partnerships both internally and within the partner’s broader sales, marketing and product management organizations.work with data partners to understand the technical landscape of their systems, in order to identify and secure additional opportunities and to communicate these internally.provide expertise across affinio’s data capabilities and educate internal and external parties on our products and differentiating network factors.track and analyze key performance metrics related to partnership sourcing and successes.work to secure official, promotable partnership status on a per api basis for each api accessed as part of a partnership.represent affinio at networking, workshop, or summit events as sponsored by data partners.what we’re looking for:7+ years in a data-intensive role, preferably in a product management capacity, though could be in engineering, data science or analytics.demonstrated success at establishing, executing on, and maintaining data partnership relationships.bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field of study.solid technical understanding of foundational technologies (i.e. apis).proactive, creative, and autonomous approach to sourcing new api opportunities within existing and prospective data partners.demonstrated success managing multiple work streams.ability to gather and transform business requirements and market needs into a successful product strategy that can be championed with partners.comfort working high and low - from presenting strategy to execs, to defining acceptance criteria for technical teams.leadership dna - demonstrated ability to drive alignment between different stakeholders with different motivations.deep strategic understanding of the current social media landscape and partnership programs.job type: experiencethe tourism kamloops team promotes kamloops as an attractive, affordable and accessible getaway for outdoor enthusiasts, families, athletes and weekend warriors. we lead innovative technological marketing strategies with our partner stakeholders to promote kamloops as a valued tourism destination.as director of marketing & visitor experience you’re responsible for elevating kamloops as an attractive tourist destination while elevating our visitor’s experience and honoring the tourism kamloops brand. this role is key to achieving the organization’s five-year strategic plan, through leadership of the marketing and visitor centre teams, and related cross-functional teamwork. you’ll be accountable for the creation of visitor-centric marketing programs, leveraging owned, earned and paid media to increase market awareness and attract visitors.you have a deep understanding and are passionate about all aspects of marketing including digital marketing, content marketing, and social media. you are a creative thinker who embraces change in the fast-paced world of digital and social media. you drive results, foster collaboration and energize others. you are detail-oriented with exceptional strategic, planning, and leadership skills. you make insightful decisions, based on careful and measurable analysis and effectively communicate direction. you have proven experience managing cross-functional projects that involve multiple external and internal stakeholders.you work with an inclusive, hands-on, collaborative group that connects people with unforgettable tourism experiences. you’ll always be learning, and there’s a good chance your co-workers will inspire you to try a new outdoor activity.key responsibilitiesdevelop and execute comprehensive marketing programs and campaign strategies to maximize the exposure and awareness of kamloops as a tourism destinationcreate a forward-looking marketing strategy and roadmap utilizing consumer insights, best practices, and past successes with a look to innovationgrow visitors leveraging digital media and compelling communications to increase awareness, engage audiences, and drive trafficevolve the visitor centre experience using contemporary and innovative approaches to serve guests’ information needs by incorporating digital, mobile and crowd-sourced solutionslead, mentor and develop a high performing, highly engaged team of people to deliver successful programscapture and prioritize actionable visitor insights and identify new business opportunitiesinspire and lead cross-functional teams to contribute and execute marketing strategies and campaignsbuild relationships and collaborate with stakeholders and clients to promote tourism in the regionsimultaneously manage multiple complex projects, with many internal and external stakeholders, on time and within budgetdevelop performance measures and evaluate effectiveness of marketing programs while optimizing for resultsencourage data and insight sharing with partners and stakeholdersdrive innovative, creative thinking - testing and trying new methods and technology to keep programs fresh and vibrantdevelop new insights into situations, encourage new ideas and innovations, question conventional approaches, design and implement new or cutting edge programs/processesrequired qualifications10+ years’ experience in marketing, with a focus on strategic marketing and digital media5+ years in tourism marketinga bachelor’s degree, preferably in marketing, business management or tourismproven leader, capable of motivating a team to reach their potential and achieve desired goalsexperience developing results-focused marketing strategies and delivering integrated marketing programsexperience managing digital marketing programs and campaigns including content marketing, social media, crm, paid advertising, website design and analyticsstrong team player with experience planning, leading and implementing large cross functional projectsproven experience making data-driven decisions and excels in identifying actionable insights and strategic growth opportunitiesexperience working collaboratively and building relationships with stakeholders and partners to achieve a common goalhighly motivated and action-oriented with the ability to see opportunity where others may see challengescomfortable working in a fast-paced and changing environment with the ability to set, prioritize, manage and delegate tasksexceptional organization and time management skills – including the ability to multitask, manage deadlines and work efficiently within a small team environmentdemonstrated ability to communicate professionally, work with flexibility, efficiency, and diplomacy both individually and as part of a complex teamappetite and aptitude for innovative technology and emerging business trendsmarketing is a multi-disciplined profession that is job description

requisition id: 1551170927 
johnson & johnson family of companies touches more than a billion people’s lives each day through our health care products and services, our corporate giving, and the volunteer efforts of our employees. the johnson & johnson family of consumer companies develop and market beloved brands that address the needs of consumers and health care professionals worldwide. our portfolio ranges across several distinct business units: baby care, oral care, compromised skin care, beauty, feminine care, and otc products.position summary:•within the customer & logistics services team, the logistics strategy analyst (lsa), takes a lead role in the analytics, development and implementation of key customer logistics improvements and initiatives. lsa collaborates both internally and externally to evaluate logistics & supply chain processes and business practices to develop plans to improve service, improve operational efficiency, performance and determine courses of action.  the lsa must have the capability of working across multiple business sectors to institute best practices, and drive efficiencies. •provides tactical analytical support to customer logistics services team under direction of the  manager, customer logistics. •the lsa utilizes business intelligence tools, cognos data, inventory, pos and syndicated business data to identify performance trends. will be the bi sme for consumer cls team.•drive increased productivity, efficiencies, and growth opportunities through detailed analysis and recommendations to customer policies and process improvements.•ownership of reverse logistics process and relationships with north american reverse distribution coe (centre of excellence)performs required analytics for the customer logistics services team which include but not limited to:•customer and corporate scorecard developmentleadership of the training & use of advance analytic tools•performance analysis•promotional analysis •vulnerability of existing items•productivity and process improvement behind ufr communication with demand & supply planning•management of the quarter end processes •other assignments by manager, customer logisticsmajor responsibilities:•works with key j&j customers on continuous customer service improvements and joint value creation strategies.  meet with key stakeholders on a regular basis to implement business planning enhancements and track progress.•partner with customer logistics, distribution and transportation to support process improvements and achieve logistics efficiencies•responsible for the development and continuous improvement of customer metric tracking, issue regular scorecards and service reports.  provide proactive support to the definition of kpi. •leads /supports customer logistics services initiatives by serving as cls contact on key issues, taking the lead role as appropriate and participating in major initiatives involving demand and supply management.  this includes cross-sector opportunities related to the jjmc or janssen businesses•evaluates operational aspects of both existing and new supply chain strategies (examples: service offering model, cycle time reduction etc.)•provides reporting for team compliance against financial objectives.•leverages us competencies and industry best practices to recommend and develop value added services to drive joint value creation•leads special projects as assigned by the director or manager, customer logistics services that may include the following:•customer data analysis•process and systems optimization•launch support•team planning, discussion & decision making as appropriate.•participation in business process development.•project analysis•cost improvement projects/strategies•reverse logisticsqualifications•university degree •candidates must be proficient in advanced excel, powerpoint, and word in a windows environment.•experience with ms access and tableau is an asset•strong technical skills: sap, cognos, and ability to quickly learn other customer specific proprietary systems •forecasting, planning, retail link & winshuttle experiences will be an asset•experience with sap bi hana is an asset•minimum 3 years experience in cpg companies would be beneficial•strong interpersonal, and collaboration competencies, within and across organizations. demonstrated ability to cultivate strong business relationships across matrixes organization.•big picture thinking: looking for areas of improvement to create growth, improve financial performance and gain global & local competitive advantage•self starter, results and performance driven with bias for action & sense of urgency on priorities.•proven leadership, analytical and strategic thinking abilities are essential. •previous experience in an analytical role. •extensive analytical & troubleshooting skills, •strong communication & presentation skills.•sales or consumer marketing, finance, demand/supply planning, it project management, cpfr experience would be beneficial.be vital in your career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. explore opportunities within the johnson & johnson family of companies. diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the johnson & johnson family of companies.  attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success.  we are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential. primary locationcanada-ontario-markhamorganizationjohnson & johnson inc. text:
job description - avp strategy execution (1708542)go to the main content section.welcome.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign intaleo@manulife.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - avp strategy execution (1708542)  avp strategy execution-1708542 description business title: avp strategy execution        
reports to: vice president strategy & execution global technology
location: 200 bloor toronto, ontario 
                                                                                                                                                                             
job summary: 
 
reporting to the vice president, strategy & execution, this role will support the delivery of global technology’s strategic objectives and will be a key member of the global technology strategy & execution team.  the incumbent will be responsible for developing and outlining the strategy through coordination and collaboration with various technology groups, in addition to developing the roadmap and plan, outlining and tracking the governance for the special projects and driving the communication and change management around the same.  they will also be responsible for developing the financial business case for the corporate projects, and various analytics to support the strategy of the group. qualifications key accountabilities:
 
individual accountabilities:
 


responsible for the development of the overall technology strategy through collaboration with various technology teams.  leads the creation and development of the comprehensive technology strategy ensuring alignment between the divisional and corporate technology strategies.   

responsible and accountable for the creation and development of the monthly and quarterly technology function reporting packages for the chief operations officer and the executive committee.  ensures determination and tracking of the ‘lead & lag’ indicators (kpi’s).  collaborates with the various divisional and corporate technology teams to ensure alignment.  

responsible for driving program governance across key initiatives and the overall global technology function.  

leads the building and development of special projects, including the creation of effective reporting and analysis for these projects.  

responsible and accountable for enhancing the global technology reporting dashboard, data cubes, and for creating visibility around the outcomes of key technology initiatives and projects.   

manages the internal global technology communication mechanisms for key projects and deliverables. 

responsible for the execution of change management related to global technology’s key strategic initiatives and projects.  
 
key shared accountabilities:
 


collaborate with the strategy team to create alignment on various strategic initiatives and to help develop the overall plan 

engage with technology teams to create alignment on key projects and initiatives and help develop execution roadmaps   
 

collaborate with the cross functional teams to develop a communication and change management strategy   
 

collaborate with the pmo to ensure standard and ad-hoc reporting requirements are delivered effectively  
                                                                                                                                                             
job requirement: 


minimum of bachelor’s degree in finance 

overall 10-15+ years’ experience in consulting and strategy

previous experience with a major consulting organization

reporting and planning experience 

metrics collation and reporting capabilities 

data analytics experience 

change and global program management experience

process improvement 

lean and process improvement  
                                                                                                                                                                             
about manulife
 
manulife financial corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. we operate as john hancock in the united states and manulife elsewhere. we provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. at the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. as of march 31, 2017, we had $1 trillion (us$754 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26.3 billion in payments to our customers. 
 
our principal operations are in asia, canada and the united states where we have served customers for more than 100 years. with our global headquarters in toronto, canada, we trade as 'mfc' on the toronto, new york, and the philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in hong kong.
 
manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.   it is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment.  a human resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially. primary location : ca-on-torontoorganization : gis exec & initiativesjob posting : aug 28, 2017, 1:54:31 pmexpiry date : ongoingcategories : financial   taleo@manulife.com

the business process consultant is accountable to design and document processes that integrate and optimize workflows (end-to-end, cross-channel, cross-role, and cross-market) to support operational processes; fulfillment, service & sales acquisition.  
 
the role will also help create an environment that promotes continuous improvement of key processes (initiated through run work or the digitization program) that will: increases operating model consistency, reduces frontline pain points, and empowers employees to enhance the value of the service we provide to customers.  this role will also support administration of operations management (om) tasks, management control framework audit tracking database (mcfatd) and divisional offices on day-to-day issues and “run” activities
 
key accountabilities: 
 
30% process documentation:

design and document processes that optimize end-to-end workflow. integrate and streamline various end to end processes across business groups and channels to bring about operational efficiencies, using systematic, disciplined and data based methods that get to root causes.
leverage nimbus process mapping tool to capture future state process flows at the level appropriate for the defined audience. 
ensure that process design reflects current business strategy and business requirements and supports the desired customer experience across channels, simplifies work activities & adheres to the bank’s operational risk and compliance framework. 
monitor regulatory, policy, procedural and other relevant business changes and revise internal processes and standards, as required, to meet requirements on a timely basis.
conduct risk assessment and validation of new processes and process improvements.
ensure documentation for standard operating procedures, rics, lpgs, topics (etc) are updated.
 
30% end to end process management:

identify synergies across business groups and connect the dots across engagements to obtain maximum value to the enterprise.
integrate end-to-end processes in cross-pillar business groups to affect operational efficiencies.
conduct analysis, generate ideas and identify business process improvement opportunities that would lead to significant productivity enhancements and customer satisfaction. 
lead work streams (everyday banking, lending, investments, credit cards, digitization as applicable) within enterprise programs; be accountable for delivery of a value stream against a business case; develop planning documents, work breakdown structures, prepare and present status updates on projects/initiatives including escalating issues and risks, perform administration tasks such as coordinating meetings, maintaining project issue logs, action item trackers etc. 
manage and resolve issues ensuring appropriate analysis and well-thought out alternatives are articulated.
create and deliver presentations summarising findings and recommendations to business partner executives and senior management.
implement changes required to standardize processes and to achieve consistency.
provide, and/or coordinate the provision of, required training on all changes to process procedures, policies and documentation as they are implemented to ensure team member understanding and competency in applying the changes.
facilitate buy-in and support from senior management for business cases, key project plans, commitments and project changes relating to process improvements.
contribute to the creation of end to end test plans and execute as part of the project assigned.
  
20% analysis & decision making:

conduct fact-finding interviews and/or brainstorming sessions with the objective of identifying value-creation opportunities and solutions, within the scope of the project and its stated objectives.
act as a resource / subject matter expert and may supervise other members on the engagement. work collaboratively with the other teams in the business group on enterprise programs. engage with cross functional project teams on multiple engagements consistent with matric management.
lead problem resolution through analytical expertise during project engagement by: articulating several aspects or components of a problem or complex situation, defining variables in complex problems, draw logical conclusions from data, situations or events.
provide feedback and guidance on prioritizing process tasks for technology projects. 
leverage data analytics to identify process baseline, identify trends, build business case and make recommendations to process changes.
 
15% leadership/stakeholder management:

participate in engagements, as a team lead/member and a business lead 
manage stakeholder expectations and negotiate with project stakeholders on scope and deliverables.
role model values to promote positive high performance culture during a time of rapid change within the bank.
build relationships with other areas of the bank such as product groups, operations support teams, finance, it, legal, etc. 
manage change by actively engaging with senior stakeholders, act as change agent, influencing others to implement appropriate methodologies, diagnose barriers to project success and facilitate resolution.
 
5% other:

prepare documentation for leadership review regarding project status including escalating issues, changes to processes and risks to executives in the divisions and/or support organizations. 
support training content development, validation and or delivery as required.
 qualifications knowledge & skills:

leadership experience in a transformational, fast-paced environment. expert at dealing with rapid change and dealing with ambiguous situations 
experience of managing small to medium work streams within a project 
track record of delivering significant process design and improvement
proven ability to effectively manage multiple activities with varying complexity within tight time frames
proven ability to operate and influence at all levels
experience documenting policies and procedures, user manuals, developing end-to-end test plans 
knowledge of bmo products and services a plus (everyday banking, credit cards, investments, lending). knowledge of distribution and branch network, systems and applications used by personal banking desired.  
strong analytical and problem solving skills
aptitude for technology, fast learner, ability to grasp processing systems quickly 
experienced in preparing presentations and material for senior leadership
able to work well both within a team and as an individual contributor
highly motivated & demonstrates initiative and take-charge attitude
well-organized & detail oriented, excellent verbal and written communication skills. 
intermediate to advanced user of ms office suite
knowledge of lean six sigma principles, process mapping fundamentals an asset
experience in documentation of policies and procedures 
education and experience: 

possesses a university degree in business or any related field or equivalent related experience
financial industry knowledge and experience is preferred
possesses 3 to 5+ years of professional experience demonstrating career progression
experience in project management and/or managing small to medium sized initiatives is considered an asset
training in or exposure to lean fundamentals, process mapping tools and/or business process management
acting as a sme or liaison with t&o in relation to application development, maintenance/support or testing is considered an asset
bilingual considered an asset

 
 
 
 
 
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. 
 

 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 
 

 
 
 
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com/. 
 

 
 
 
 
bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

your opportunity:alberta health services is seeking an information management professional interested in directly contributing to the strategic direction of continuing care in alberta for the role of data analyst, continuing care audit. this is a new key position in the newly forming provincial continuing care audit team.
as a data analyst, continuing care audit, you will provide information and decision support to the provincial continuing care audit team to streamline and improve the flow and use of information to support the audits that inform quality improvement initiatives in continuing care across alberta. you will function as an innovator and change agent in the pursuit of excellence in continuing care and draw on your specialized knowledge of performance analytics and reporting to achieve success in your work. 
working under limited guidance, you will manage the continuing care audit data, including collection, analysis and reporting. you will use advanced content knowledge, along with highly developed analytical skills, to work with databases, spreadsheets and other analytical software packages, to extract data and prepare reports for the team, executive and other internal and external stakeholders. you will contribute to the development of the provincial continuing care audit team’s audit strategy and methodology by identifying trends and potential issues in the data.description: reporting to the senior consultant, continuing care audit, you will:
develop and maintain accurate and complete databases for the team.
input audit data and ensure data integrity.
perform advanced qualitative and quantitative data analysis.
develop strategic reporting based on the needs of various stakeholders.
maintain audit tools and audit methodology for the team.
engage others (internal and external) to develop networks to resolve issues and exchange information.
the location is negotiable in edmonton or calgary.

classification: analystunion: exemptdepartment: co-internal audit-edmprimary location: calgaryemployee class: regular full timefte:  1.00posting end date: 10-oct-2017date available: 30-oct-2017hours per shift: 7.75length of shift in weeks: 2shifts per cycle: 10shift pattern: daysdays off: saturday/sundayminimum salary:           $28.20maximum salary:           $48.45vehicle requirement: n/arequired qualifications: degree in statistics, information management, or business. 
minimum four years’ relevant experience.
equivalencies of education and experience will be considered.additional qualifications: advanced user of excel and access, with ability to adapt easily to new software. 
proficiency in microsoft office word, powerpoint, visio and outlook.
experience working with large databases, and varied data sources.
proven project management skills.
strong organizational skills. ability to cope with demanding timelines – works well under pressure.
excellent communication and report writing skills.
ability to build rapport with stakeholders. 
strong commitment to work collaboratively in a team environment to achieve common goals.
able to work independently with minimal guidance when warranted.
experience in an organization of significant size, complexity and diversity.
advanced ability to synthesize and analyze data and compile meaningful reports.
critical thinking skills and creative problem solving abilities when approaching taskspreferred qualifications: experience in health care environment – preference for senior’s health or continuing care.
knowledge of continuing care health service standards.












important:
alberta health services ( ahs) is committed to ensuring the safety of staff and patients and requires all new employees to provide a satisfactory criminal record check (crc) and/or vulnerable sector search(vss) prior to the start of their employment.  the crc/vss must be specific to the role at ahs and must be dated no more than 90 days prior to the date on your written offer from ahs. 










healthy albertans. healthy communities. together.
we’re passionate about what we do.  our team of skilled and dedicated health care professionals, support staff and physicians who promote wellness and provide health care every day, all across alberta. everything we do at ahs reflects a patient and family centred approach; it’s about putting patients’ and families’ experiences, priorities and trust first.we are an equal opportunity employer. ahs values the diversity of the people and communities we serve and is committed to attracting, engaging and developing a diverse and inclusive workforce.

job description: 
                        
job requisition id: 805

working hours:
number of vacancies 2.0
job closing date 06/10/2017:
 
discover your future
broad horizons
there’s much more to a fun and exciting work life at canada post than a good job with a great company. we’ll help you achieve your full potential. you’ll find opportunities to develop and expand your career, chances to try out new jobs in different areas of the company, or even a complete change of career path.
job description canada post is committed to providing innovative physical and electronic delivery solutions that create value for our customers, employees and all canadians. the assistant product manager participates in managing products, solutions, and services to ensure that each generates maximum financial contribution while satisfying market needs and the corporation's service mandate.job responsibilities below are the main job requirements and responsibilities for the assistant product manager.
• participates in the planning, development, and monitoring of the corporation's product, solutions modifications, new product/solutions development, and pricing strategies to achieve corporate targets for revenue, volume, market share, cost containment and reduction, customer mail preparation, and net financial contribution for products, solutions and services. recommends required corrective actions to be initiated by the responsible corporate functions as required.
• participates in the development of market share, revenue and volume, cost containment and reduction, customer mail preparation and net financial contribution targets for products and services for the setting of corporate goals and the development of the corporate operating plan.
• identifies current and future market opportunities and threats and prepares assessments of forecasted impacts on the corporation's market, service and financial goals for products, solutions, and services.
• evaluate the market, service and financial performance of products, solutions and services against corporate goals and prepares assessments of variances form corporate goals.
• assesses proposed initiatives and plans of all corporate functions and the divisions to determine their acceptability and impact regarding the corporation's product/solutions strategies, plans and objectives.
• prepares detailed multi-functional corporate product/solutions operating plans and operating budgets which translate approved strategies and objectives for products, solutions, and services into the specific functional activities necessary to develop and implement the operating and financial systems, procedures and infrastructures to implement all aspects of the plan.
• assists, and monitors, with the implementation of the multi-functional plans to ensure that new products, solutions, and services are carefully launched and revenue targets achieved.
• develops and recommends sales contract pricing proposals for products, solutions, and services and supports sales and customer service staff in the concluding of approved agreements with customers.
• meets with major customers and national customer associations to gain customer feedback regarding the need for product/solution improvements and/or the impact of possible changes to product/solutions and pricing.
qualifications education
• completed post-secondary, preferably in a related field such as marketing, business administration, commerce, business analytics.
 
experience
• 2 to 3 years of relevant functional experience.
 
other candidate requirements
• proficient computer skills and competent with microsoft office programs.
• strong communication, analytical, and customer service skills.
• one or more years of experience in a unionized environment an asset.
• knowledge of postal convention, regulations and agreements an asset.
• excellent understanding of marketing and customer data, targeting and campaign measurement.
other information  
 
to take on the permanent assistant product manager role in the scrum team to lead the roadmap to delivery of multiple digital solutions for other lines of business, including parcels, smb, e-change of address, delivery preferences, etc. so digital assets are a source of sustainable and competitive advantage to the corporation in the marketplace.  the right candidate will have strong attention to detail, be customer-focused, have strong written and verbal communication skills and will have experience with qualtrics or other voc platforms.
there is also another temporary term assistant product manager position that will be hired for a period of 6 months that is responsible for supporting the scrum teams and product manager in creation of and management of product management artifacts and documentation as well as creation of executive briefs.  this person will plan activities to enable business growth and profitability by making our digital assets a source of sustainable and competitive advantage in the market.  this position will focus on channel management - customer irritants, (far, fpc), native, mobile and 2018 projects.

employment equity
canada post is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.
 
conflict of interest
the conflict of interest policy prohibits employees from hiring, supervising or reporting to, directly or indirectly via the reporting hierarchy, their immediate family or close personal relations. should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential conflict of interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated human resources representative.
 
accommodation
if you are contacted by canada post regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if you require accommodation.
 
important message
your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as canada post cannot make assumptions about your education and experience. we thank all those who apply. only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
 
our leadership behaviours 
decision making – a champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner that aligns with the corporation's best interests.
accountability – an individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds him/herself and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved.
business orientation – a proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities.
execution – a focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations.
leading people – a compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things. 

 
our values
canada post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.
transformation – we will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace.
customer – we serve canadians with pride and passion.
integrity – we act responsibly and with integrity.
respect – we treat each other with fairness and respect.
safety – we are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders.

text:
job description - associate producer, cross country check up (english services) (tor05998)go to the main content section.français current openingswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - associate producer, cross country check up (english services) (tor05998)job description associate producer, cross country check up (english services) - tor05998  job family  programming (tv-radio-web)primary location  torontoposition language requirement  english onlylanguage skill levels (reading / writing / speaking)  - - -status of employment  permanentwork schedule(s)  part-time  description what it’s like working at cbc/radio-canada
 
at cbc/radio-canada, we’re all about creating content that informs, entertains and connects canadians on multiple platforms and from coast to coast to coast. want to be part of all this, and think you have the ability and drive to keep pace with this exciting, ever-changing industry? then we hope you’ll consider this posting, check out our job-listings, and explore the possibilities of working with us. whether it be in front of the camera, on mic, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making the connections and telling the stories that are important to canadians.
 
cbc radio’s cross country checkup is looking for a creative digital associate producer with a unique blend of journalistic, digital production and communication skills. working under the direction and supervision of the senior producer, the ideal candidate must have a keen interest and strong background in finding innovative, creative ways to engage with and grow online audiences. this associate producer will pitch story ideas and digital treatments, and be responsible for initiating and leading conversations with our online audience. this associate producer will maintain and build the show’s online presence, as well as be responsible for: digital content creation (value-added shareable content, online audio/video, graphics and quote boards); repackaging various audio and video content for an online audience; maintaining show website; developing and managing a consistent and interactive presence on all social media properties; creating and executing a promotional strategy that expands audience base; identifying and chasing interesting guests for radio or online that may emerge from the social media conversation; assisting with live events. during the show, she/he would be required to maintain an active presence online in twitter, scribblelive online chat and monitor facebook and e-mail to provide curated content from all platforms for the radio show and for the scribblelive forum. to be successful in this role, the associate producer must be a driven, hard-working self-starter, open to taking on a range of tasks whether they be creative, strategic or administrative. the ideal candidate will also embody cross country checkup’s core values to be relevant, inclusive, interactive, balanced, and open-minded.  function: with appropriate direction from one or more producers, the associate producer plans, conceives, organizes, and/or develops the production and realization of digital content.  work must adhere to cbc journalistic and/or program policies, standards and practices.  nevertheless, there is wide latitude for initiative, independent judgment and creativity.  qualifications we are looking for a candidate with the following: 
job requires a university degree or equivalent.job requires a minimum of two years relevant experience in a multi-media environment and expertise in creating/disseminating online content.excellent and creative writing ability that will engage the audience.ability to take radio and video content and create multi-platform extensions.ensuring all multi-platform content meets cbc's journalistic standards and procedures.skilled in digital audio and video editing, exporting, uploading, metadata in tools including theplatform mpx, dalet, adobe premiere, cbc’s audio upload tool, etc.proven experience with cross-platform and multi-media work which includes: maintaining and updating a daily web site; html; using polopoly, wordpress, expression engine and similar cms software; using image editor, image research and creation; writing, editing and proofreading copy for the web; playlist management, uploading audio, video and images.implement new initiatives and strategies such as live chats, live streams, blogs and new platforms to remain at the forefront of the multi-platform realm; ability to moderate online communities and social media applications, including live chats and live web streaming, ensuring an appropriate level of discourse. judgment is required in dealing with issues related to user-generated content.strong knowledge of adobe photoshop and graphic design, including image research, editing, and creation.strong knowledge and experience on all social media platforms and the ability to use them to grow audience.ability to develop internal and external relationships to ensure content reaches different audiences, on different platforms, through a range of media.experience working with digital analytics tools including adobe marketing cloud (omniture sitecatalyst), chartbeat, clicktale, etc. to assess and optimize performance of content.conducting regular checks of online content to identify glitches, mistakes, broken links, non-functioning files and liaising with technical personnel to ensure problems are fixed in a timely manner.well-developed administrative and organizational abilities.embracing of technological and media change, with the ability to master new platforms quickly and assist the department in being at the forefront of emerging technological trends that affect the media.working experience with cbc platforms would be considered an asset.ability to be a guest on radio shows would be considered an asset.ability to shoot video with audio for original online video content, as well as facility with a range of video recording devices such as iphone, camcorders.good editorial judgment and critical-thinking skills.ability to work effectively in a high-pressure environment and with tight deadlines, without sacrificing creativity or quality.ability to take critical feedback and incorporate it into the work.well-developed interpersonal skills: excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to clearly explain concepts to peers.flexibility to adapt to changing work patterns and methods.independent and self-motivated, combined with the ability to work well in a team environment.strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple priorities. and respond to competing demands in a deadline-driven environment.
candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.cbc/radio-canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. that’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. that’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as canada’s public broadcaster. for more information, visit the talent and diversity section of our website. if you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.if this sounds interesting, please apply online! we thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  job posting date  sep 28, 2017, 11:45:00 amunposting date  oct 12, 2017, 11:59:00 pmproficiency levels of second language:
-  = no level required
a = beginner level
b = intermediate level
c = advanced level  ici.radio-canada.ca|cbc.ca copyright ©  cbc/radio-canada
